loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr: Tabu est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Sheria», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 54 ans, mère 4 enfants dont 2 étudient et 2 sont mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 30 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 3 sacs de maïs. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Tabu is a shopkeeper and member of the "banc villageois" Sheria. She is a client of the microfinance organization Hekima, a widow, 54 years old and the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom attend school and 2 of whom are married.

Tabu began her business with funds received from her husband while he was alive. She has been selling various food products from her home on a busy street for the last 30 years.

Tabu will use this loan to stock up on 3 bags of corn. She hopes to expand her business, as well as educate and feed her children.

In closing, Tabu wants to thank Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs not eligible for traditional banking.

loans.use: to supply themselves with 3 bags of corn

loans.name: Bao Beoneere Group

texts.fr:
Mr ZAKARYA est responsable du groupe BAO BEONEERE. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06ans et le moins âgé a 01an 24mois. Personne ne va  à l’école. Il a 03personnes en charge.
Mr est boutiquier  depuis 03ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur.
Il veut s’acheter 20 sacs de riz, 07 bidons d’huile de 20 litres.
Mr veut épargner ses bénéfices. Il ambitionne toujours acheter une parcelle et mieux entretenir sa  famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Zakarya is the leader of Bao Beoneere Group, and is married and the father of two children. The eldest is six years old and the youngest is three years old. Neither of them attends school. Mr. Zakarya has three people in his care.

Mr. Zakarya has been a shopkeeper for three years. He gets his supplies from the market in his area. He wants to purchase 20 sacks of rice and seven 20-liter containers of oil.

Mr. Zakarya wants to save his profits; his goal has always been to purchase a plot of land and better care for his family.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sacks of rice and seven 20-liter containers of oil.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos, se dedica a la sastrería, la agricultura y en ocasiones realiza trabajos como mozo para otros agricultores. Su día a día lo distribuye trabajando de 6:00 a.m.  1:00 p.m.  en el campo y de 3:00 p.m. a 5:00 p.m. se dedica a atender la sastrería, hasta la fecha ha sabido administrar su negocio por lo que no representa dificultades.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá únicamente en la sastrería, comprara hilos, telas, botones, agujas y otros materiales necesarios para elaborar las prendas de vestir, esto le facilitara a Luis cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes y tener ingresos mayores para poder cancelar su deuda.
Su mayor sueño es fundar un taller de costura para dar oportunidad de superación a su familia y que sus hijos puedan continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his partner and their two children. He works as a tailor, farmer and sometimes as a waiter. He works from 6:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. in the fields and from 3:00-5:00 p.m. as a tailor. Up until now, he has been able to manage his business without any difficulties. 

He will invest the loan on his tailoring business. He will buy thread, fabrics, buttons, needles and other materials needed for tailoring. This will help Luis meet his customers' demands and increase his income. 

His biggest dream is to start a dressmaking workshop to help his family get ahead and for his children to continue going to school.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabrics, buttons, needles and other materials needed for tailoring.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante. el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chupetes, caramelos y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ernestina manages her business of selling sweets. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman. Through this business, she is able to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her business of selling sweets.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy lollipops, candies, and cookies. Ernestina is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy lollipops, candies, and cookies.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister). She is a poultry farmer. She operates her business from home. She has been in this business for seven years. She sells on a retail basis and works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy poultry feeds and vaccines. Her major challenge is transportation of poultry feeds, and diseases that affect the quality of her products. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent. She would like to build more poultry houses in the future.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and vaccines

loans.name: Nuevo Crecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO CRECER” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), tienda de abarrotes, venta de salchipapas (comida rápida tradicional).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace cinco años por iniciativa propia, ya que deseaba contar con un negocio independiente y aprovecho el conocimiento que tenía a cerca de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de queso por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevo Crecer is starting its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer within the Copacabana regional hub. It comprises nine members, and Celia is President of the board of directors. The members of this communal bank run a variety of businesses, such as selling cheese, selling chuño (dehydrated potato), a grocery store, and selling salchipapas (a regional fast food dish).

The loan they are requesting will benefit small micro entrepreneurs like Celia. She says she has belonged to Pro Mujer for four years. She became involved through a large-scale promotion carried out by the organization in her area. She is currently in business selling cheese. She says she got started five years ago on her own initiative, because she wanted to have her own business and make the most of her knowledge about this product.

The loan she is now requesting is to increase her capital by purchasing wholesale cheese from local providers. She will then sell it in the city of El Alto. This line of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the trainings provided by the organization.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cheese.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 38-year-old married woman with four children who are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Jessica has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell for her business.

Jessica has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  es un hombre casado de 31 años, él tiene dos hijas con su familia viven en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez. 
Manuel  es una persona muy dedicada a su actividad que realiza, pues para generar sus ingresos él trabaja por cuenta propia, él es productor de banano, café y cacao,  pues gracias a sus padres él tiene esta actividad ya que ellos le donaron  terreno para poder cultivar estos productos. 
Manuel  por los años de experiencia que lleva en este trabajo, él también trabaja con la gente de su comunidad injertando café para almácigo, que es otra fuente de ingresos que tiene.  Pues Manuel para que su familia vivan en mejores ambientes, el necesita comprar materiales (block) para poder construir su casa, pues a raíz de esta necesidad Manuel solicita un prestamo, para empezar a comprar todo lo necesario. La meta de este señor es poder empezar a comprar poco a poco las materiales hasta tener todo lo necesario. El sueño de Manuel es darle una casa digna para que su familia viva en armonía.
texts.en:
Manuel is 31 years old, married, and has two daughters. He and his family live in a community in Suchitepéquez. He is very dedicated to his business, since he works for himself in order to earn an income. He grows bananas, coffee, and cacao, a business he owns thanks to his parents, from whom he inherited the land where he grows these crops. Because of Manuel's years of experience in this line of work, he also works grafting coffee seedlings, which is his other source of income.

Manuel wants to improve his family's living environment, so he needs to by construction blocks to build a house. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to start buying all the necessary materials. Manuel's goal is to give his family decent housing so they can live in harmony.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
The humid and rocky Kirege area within the Chuka area can be considered a hardship area. Even with savannah plains and little human activity, there exists a farm that stands tall, a farm with over two high-pedigreed Friesian cows, producing over 10 litres of milk. It’s quite an outstanding feat, considering the harsh terrain and other handicaps, like the lack of electricity from the national grid and being dependent on traditional methods of harvesting water.

Kiva lenders, meet Eric, the man credited with the success story of the farm. He is a 29-year-old very hardworking man, ambitious and ever-smiling. Eric is a very dedicated farmer and has so much experience in farming that he is touted to be among the best farmers in his village. Eric has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Through hard work, he has been able to support his siblings. He always provides a plate of food for them. He offers free services to farmers who are still upcoming and free Extension services to farmers in nearby villages.

Eric is seeking funds to open an agro vet shop in his village. This need arose because so many farmers have nowhere to buy animal medicine and food. Eric, being an enterprising person, wants to take advantage of the ready market that is there and make more profits. Eric is also a farmer and will benefit from the shop because he will not be going far to look for food and medicine, hence cutting down transportation costs.

Through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders, Eric is confident that this loan will help aspiring farmers like him turn their dreams into reality and that, through the training he will get, he will be able to successfully run his agro vet shop.

As Eric discloses, his determination to succeed in farming springs from the confidence that he has through his many years of farming. Eric plans to manage his agro vet business in a professional and profitable way. Through this, he will assure his parents and siblings of a secure future, and his parents will have improved living conditions.

loans.use: To start an agro vet business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his master's degree, which is very important for his personal development

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN, la socia Luz Marina tiene 58 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando como docente en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the San Valentin Communal Bank. She is 58 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children. Luz Marina divides her time between her daily activities and her job as a teacher at one of the schools in the city of Cusco. She has been working for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her job. Luz Marina wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a household appliance. Luz Marina appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy a household appliance.

loans.name: Gonda

texts.en:
Gonda is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Gonda operates a grocery-and-vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, utilizo el préstamo anterior para continuar trabajando en l agricultura, lo cual le ha dado mejores oportunidades de desarrollo en el mercado, tiene nuevos ingresos con los que puede cancelar su deuda y brindar mejores cuidados a su familia.
Nuevamente hace la solicitud a la institución y a los inversionistas Kiva de más capital que le servirá para invertir en 50 qq de  zacate picado y 8 qq de concentrado para alimentar al ganado y los cerdos que posee, espera engordarlos y venderlos con mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
With his previous loan, Lucio was able to continue his farm work. This provided him with better development opportunities in the marketplace. He used his new stream of income to pay off his debt and take better care of his family.

Lucio is submitting another request to PADECOMSM and the Kiva lenders for more capital so that he can invest in 50 quintals of shredded fodder and 8 quintals of concentrated feed for his cattle and pigs. He plans to fatten and sell his animals in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy 50 quintals of shredded fodder and 8 quintals of concentrated animal feed.

loans.name: Mwalaini

texts.en:
Mwalaini is a widowed woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Mwalaini and her children live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over five years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Pesa

texts.en:
Pesa is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 15,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Glenda Xiomara

texts.es:
Glenda, de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es fotógrafo, tienen tres hijos que viven con ellos, estudian séptimo y segundo grado, el menor todavía no estudia. 

Glenda, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero también, le ayuda a su esposo en las labores agrícolas  cuando siembran maíz.

El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de novillas, con el fin de crecerlas y en un tiempo prudencial venderlas.- Anteriormente, se le otorgó un crédito y fue para la compra de un par de novilla, las cuales ya vendió una y les dio buenas ganancias.

Glenda, desea seguir trabajando en la compra y venta de ganado y espera comprar más ganado para poder reproducirlas.
texts.en:
Glenda, age 33, went to school through the sixth grade.  She is married, and her husband is a photographer.  They have three children who live with them.  One is in seventh grade, one is in second grade, and the youngest does not yet go to school.

Glenda devotes herself to the household chores.  However, she also helps her husband with the agricultural work when they plant corn.

She needs the loan to buy heifers to raise and sell after a time.  She previously had a loan to buy a pair of heifers.  She sold them and got good earnings.

Glenda wishes to continue working at buying and selling livestock.  She hopes to buy more livestock so that they will be able to reproduce.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a hardworking mother of two children, and a devoted aunt to her niece and nephew. Sadly, Sheila’s sister passed away, and Sheila is now the primary guardian for her sister’s two young children. Sheila’s husband, like many Florida residents, has been affected by Florida’s sluggish job market and has experienced difficulty finding steady work. Sheila has been able to steadily provide for her family through working at a local school as a custodian. Due to having only one steady income for some time, Sheila and her family fell a bit behind on some bills and this affects her credit to this date. Sheila has since brought her bills current, and her husband has found steady work; however, the damage to Sheila’s credit hinders her ability to finance her new air conditioner through a bank. Sheila and her family are in need of an air conditioner to replace an old unit that no longer works before the heat of summer begins here in Florida. 

Sheila will use her loan to purchase a new high efficiency air conditioner so that she and her family of 6 can live comfortably in their home and so that Sheila can begin to rebuild her credit.

loans.use: to pay for a high efficiency a/c to replace an old broken unit.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 35 years old, a resident of Ssumba, a suburb of Wakiso, and married with three children ages one, three and five years. 

Stephen deals in the business of poultry, which he started in 2011, including both layers and broilers.   In addition to that, Stephen earns more income  from a transport business for his well being and that of the family.

Stephen is in dire need a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to purchase more feeds for his chickens, so that they can grow fat in a short time to be ready to sell. His customers are restaurants, home consumers and neighbors.  However, he faces the challenges of inadequate capital, poultry diseases and price fluctuation in poultry feeds. 

Stephen is such a determined man and so very hardworking, that can expand his business if he gets enough capital. He thanks the Kiva lenders for the good cause of fighting poverty.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds.

loans.name: Mthyola Group

texts.en:
Lukia is 48 years old and married to a farmer. She has 6 children, and four of her children go to school. She sells dry fish and is applying this loan to buy fish in bulk to reach more customers in her village.

Lukia is doing business to support her family and to be financially independent. She has successfully repaid previous loans from Micro loan Foundation.

Her ambition is to expand her business to start selling tomatoes and vegetables on top of the fish business, and to employ someone to assist when she has enough capital. She believes that the training she received on Business Management offered by the Micro loan Foundation will help her to have what she needs in her life. Lukia is able to satisfy her family's daily needs and she is self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Suni

texts.en:
Suni is 57 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her two children - one son and one daughter. She and her husband are farmers, and her husband also is a traditional doctor. She helped her husband for increased income, too.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6.500.000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank and toilet at her home, to improve access to water and sanitation for her family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for families.

Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank and toilet at her home, to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Vatana

texts.en:
Vatana is a 22-year-old, single security guard at a micro finance institution. He lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. 

He has worked as a security guard since 2014, earning an income of $6.00 a day. Previously, he worked as a phone seller. 

Vattana is also studying banking and finance at the university. Because he lacks the money to pay his first year university fees, he would like a loan. This loan will help him to go through the first year at university successfully.

As for Vattana’s dreams, he wants a good job with a good salar,y and he hopes to save money to have his own house.

loans.use: to pay his first year university fees.

loans.name: Flor De Tihuanacu Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE TIHUANACU” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de moldes de sombreros, venta de polleras, tienda de barrio, venta de carne y abarrotes, venta de comida. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al observar la carencia de este negocio en su zona y además aprovechó el conocimiento en ventas que aprendió desde niña de sus padres. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. "FLOR DE TIHUANACU” ["Flower of Tihuanacu" group ] will begin their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer [Pro Woman] at the regional hub Juan Pablo II. The group consists of eight members and is directed by a board led by president Antonia. The members of the group are involved in various business, among them: the sale of blankets, hat molds, and skirts, neighborhood stores, the sale of meat and groceries and the sale of prepared foods.

The loan they are requesting will benefit the small micro-business of which Antonia is a member. She indicates that this is the first time she joins Pro Mujer, by way of an invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her home. Currently she has a small neighborhood store. She discloses that she started this business when she observed a lack of this kind of store in her neighborhood and also because she took advantage of the knowledge of sales that she learned as a child from her parents.

The loan she is requesting is to increase capital and purchase grocery items wholesale which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services and the trainings that they offer in the institution.

loans.use: buy wholesale grocery items

loans.name: Union Progreso Y Futuro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN PROGRESO Y FUTURO” iniciará el trigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yovana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de edredones, venta de poleras, venta de calzados, venta de comida, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de celulares, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yovana es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de edredones; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al apoyar a su padre en la elaboración de estos productos, con el pasar del tiempo y con un capital obtenido en Pro Mujer decide independizarse. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Progress and Future Union communal bank is beginning their third loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II focal group. The group is made up of 8 members and is run by a board of directors, of which Yovana is the president. The businesses run by the members are varied and include quilt sales, shirt sales, sock sales, food sales, baby clothing sales, athletic clothing sales, cellular phone sales, and jacket sales.

The loan that they are requesting will benefit small businesses like Yovana's. She tells us that she joined Pro Mujer 6 years ago after a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her. Currently, she has a business selling quilts. She started her business many years ago after helping her father make quilts. With time and a loan from Pro Mujer, she decided to open her own business.

The loan that she is requesting is for an increase in capital, which she will use to purchase fabric in bulk. She will purchase the fabric from the bulk vendors in the city of La Paz and will later sell them at her store.

Her job allows her to generate income to financially support her family, since she is married. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de awayos y chuspas para mallkus. Venta de ropa militar, venta de frutas, venta de mantas de seda, venta de ropa. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un pequeño capital hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de su madre a quien apoyaba desde niña. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ESTRELLAS", began in the first Pro Mujer cycle, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. The group comprises of eight members and is overseen by a board, Rosa is the board's president. 

The businesses that are led by the members of the communal bank are varied and include the sale of: awayos and chuspas for mallkus (clothing adornments relating to Aymaran practices); military clothing; fruit; silk sheets and clothing. The loan they take out will benefit the small micro-businesses and part will benefit Rosa's business. 

Rosa indicates that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago, she entered upon the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Nowadays, Rosa has a business selling fruit. Rosa started this business with a small amount of capital after learning the trade from her mother who has supported  her since she was a child. 

The loan Rosa now wishes to take out is to increase her capital via wholesale fruit that she will aquire from the wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto. Afterwards she will sell the fruit at her own shop. 

Rosa is single with four children and this type of work allows her to support her family economically. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rosa says that she likes the health centre that the institution offers. 




El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un pequeño capital hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de su madre a quien apoyaba desde niña. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith  se dedica al negocio de guía de turismo,la socia es un amujer trabajadora y por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener una agencia de viajes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edith manages her tour guide business. She is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead through her business. Her dream is to open a travel agency.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy sound equipment. Edith is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer that will allow her to download books related to her major and thus save money on buying texts.

loans.name: Ilsa Elizabeth

texts.es: Ilsa de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ilsa is 34 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and their two children. She has a small store located at her place of residence and has managed this business for several years. Ilsa has many customers, especially her neighbors.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products. This will help her earn more income so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products.

loans.name: Miriam De Jesus

texts.es:
El olor a nacatamal recién cocinado inunda la mesa del desayuno, abriendo de un solo golpe el apetito de hasta el más  exigente paladar. Miriam desde hace 8 años, se dedica a este oficio, que poco a poco va conquistando a más clientes, tanto que en cafeterías y quioscos de la ciudad, es infaltable no encontrar el sabor de esta comida típica nicaragüense de manos de doña Miriam. 

Las expectativas  de Miriam son  prósperas y sólidas;  ella espera a corto plazo seguir creciendo y ofreciendo más productos, ya que, con el financiamiento lograra invertir en su negocio, que ahora no solo es de nacatamales, sino también de platanitos solicita el crédito para comprar maíz, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, carne, plátano la principal materia prima para elaborar sus productos. El apoyo de su familia la motiva a crecer para que, en un futuro no lejano, pueda distribuir en todas las pulperías de su región.
texts.en:
The smell of freshly cooked nacatamal inundates the breakfast table, making even the most demanding palate water. Miriam has make nacatamales for the past 8 years and has gained more customers little by little in cafeterias and kiosks all over the city. It is inexcusable not to try this typical Nicaraguan dish made by Miriam.

Miriam's goals are prosperous and solid; she hopes to continue growing and offering more products in the short term. With this loan, she would like to invest in her business, where she not only makes nacatamales, but also plantains. With the loan, she will purchase corn, peppers, onions, tomatoes, meat, and plantains, which are the main ingredients for her products.

Her family's support motivates her to grow so that, in the near future, she can distribute her products to all of the grocery stores in the region.

loans.use: to purchase corn, peppers, onions, tomatoes, meat, and plantains.

loans.name: Henry Yuvini

texts.es:
Henry, de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa es comerciante en pequeño, tienen un hijo que irá a pre-kínder.

Henry, se dedica a la agricultura desde su infancia, su padre le enseño a sembrar; en época de siembra hace 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 metros cuadrados de frijol, además, realiza trabajos de ayudante de albañil, en la comunidad y fuera de ella. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar ganado de engorde y luego venderlo.- Anteriormente, se le otorgó un crédito para el mismo destino y obtuvo buenas ganancias, es por ello que se ha dedicado al este negocio. 

El sueño de Henry es, seguir trabajando para mantener a su familia y seguir dándole el estudio a su hijo.- También, desea comprar más ganado, para que con las ganancias mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Henry, 36, has a 9th grade education.  He is married, and his wife is a small trader.  They have a son who will be attending pre-kindergarten.  

Henry has been a farmer since he was a child; his father taught him how to farm.  In the growing season he has 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 meters of beans under cultivation.  He also works as a construction assistant in the community and outside of it. 

Henry needs a loan to buy cattle to fatten and later sell.  Previously, he was granted a loan for the same purpose, and this resulted in good earnings.  This is why he is devoted to this business.

Henry's dream is to continue to work to support his family and to continue to give his son an education.  In addition, he would like to buy more cattle so that with the earnings he could improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mwanamina

texts.en:
Mwanamina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Elina Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres En Acción.
En este lugar vive la señora Elina, tiene 36 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Elina mujer es muy trabajadora que le gusta ganarse lo suyo con su labor, ella  se dedica al comercio vende ropa de todo tipo y sandalias, la mayor parte del crédito es para su marido el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres. Tanto ella como él trabaja dos días, ella vende  puerta a puerta y por pedidos, mientras que su marido vende en el mercado local en un pequeño puesto que el tiene en el lugar, así ellos se ganan el sustento diario de ella y su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar camisas, pantalones, zapatos, frutas y legumbres para el negocio del marido. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus  sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Manabí, Ecuador, which has been known for many years as the city of royal tamarinds, there is a gathering every two weeks for the members of the communal banking group "Credit for Women in Action". 

Elina lives in this town and forms part of the group.  She is 36 years old and has a common law marriage as well as two children ages 14 and 8.  The oldest studied in high school and the youngest is in primary school.  Her husband is a businessman.

Elina is a hard-working woman who likes to earn her own income through her labor.  She works in a business selling clothing of all kinds and sandals.  The majority of the loan will be used for her husband, who sells fruits and vegetables.  They both work every day.  She sells door to door and upon request, while her husband sells his goods at the local market in a small stall that he has.  In this way they earn their daily sustenance for themselves and for the whole family.  

This loan will be used to buy shirts, pants, and shoes, as well as fruit and vegetables for Elina's husband's stall.  Elina has been working with the communal banking group for 5 years and she likes it because they loans help her greatly.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, and shoes, as well as fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Delgerdavaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Delgermaa, 40 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been making and selling wooden beds for more than twenty years. Their children go to secondary school. 

She is requesting a loan of $2,700 to buy raw materials such as wood, luster, textiles and foam in large amounts in order to increase working capital. This business is the only income generator for her family, and her three children are growing bigger each day, demanding even greater necessities.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in order to increase working capital.

loans.name: Santana De Jesus

texts.es:
Santana, de 51 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen 4 hijos, pero solo 2 de ellos viven en su casa, uno trabaja y el otro estudia 1 año de la Universidad. 

Santana, es agricultor desde que era muy pequeño, su padre fue quien le enseño a sembrar y ahora, siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, a 20 minutos de su casa; desde hace 3 años, es vigilante de una iglesia y el horario es por turnos de 24 horas y lo realiza 4 veces a la semana y viaja en bus cuando va a trabajar. 

El préstamo lo necesita para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde sembrará 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, esto le ayudará, por que pagara antes de que otra persona la alquile, así tendrá producciones si todo le va bien al final de la cosecha. 

Los sueños de Santana son, mantener su empleo, que su cosecha sea buena y tener su propio terreno donde sembrar.
texts.en:
Santana, 51 years old, went to school until 2nd grade. He is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the home. They have 4 children, but only 2 of them live in their house. One works and the other is studying in his first year of university. 

Sanata has been a farmer since he was very young. His father taught him to plant and now he plants 7,000 square meters of corn in a field about 20 minutes from his home. For the past 3 years he has also been the guard at a church. The schedule is 4 24-hour shifts per week. He travels by bus to get to work.

He needs the loan to pay the rent on the land where he will plant 7,000 square meters of corn, which will help him because he will be able to pay before some else rents it, and thus he will have a product at the end of the harvest.

Santana's dreams are to keep his job, to have a good harvest, and to have his own land where he can plant.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where he will plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Antiqa

texts.en: Antiqa is 49 years old and a married IDP (internally displaced person) who lives in an IDP settlement with her two children. She is very devoted to her children and earns a living by raising different types of fruit in her large garden. Her children help her and they are able to earn a monthly income of 160 manat, but this does not cover family expenses. Residents of this settlement like to eat fresh fruit, and Antiqa has a lot of clients in the local bazar where she sells her crops. She would like to expand her business and has requested a loan for 1,500 AZN to buy seeds so she can grow more trees on her land.

loans.use: to buy seeds to increase her crop yield.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and the mother of three children, one of whom goes to school. Sarah earns a living by running a beauty salon in a shop that she rents in a local market. She has been in this business for the last seven years and works seven days a week. She is requesting a loan for 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a hair dryer, treatments and shampoo. Her major challenges includes seasonality and power shortages. Her goal for the future is to buy better salon chairs and a refrigerator so she can start selling cold drinks. Sarah lives in rented house with plumbing and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

She operates a beauty salon in a shop that she rents at the market. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from farming. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy relaxers, shampoo, rollers, treatments and oils. Her major business challenges are seasonality and power shortages. 

Her goal and aspiration is to build a permanent business premises.

loans.use: to buy relaxers, shampoo, rollers, treatments and oils.

loans.name: Majid

texts.en: Namuddu Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom  go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, and earns a living by selling firewood from her home. She has been in this business for the last seven years and now works seven days a week. She has requested a loan for 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more firewood to sell. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal is to buy a van to transport her merchandise from place to place. She lives in her own house, where her family has access to plumbing and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Cori Canastita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORI CANASTITA” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rossemary es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de material de limpieza al por mayor, venta de masitas, venta de chamarras, venta de ropa, venta de dulces, venta de salchipapas,  venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rossemary es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de salchipapa (comida tradicional rápida); da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al observa a su amiga, quien comercializa el mismo productos, con amplio comercio es por ello que decide invertir un pequeño capital en este negocio 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de kiosco para la venta) mismo que implementará en su espacio de venta para la comodidad de su clientela. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, el crédito y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
“Cori Canastita” communal bank will begin their fourteenth loan cycle in “Pro Mujer” (Pro Woman), as part of the Central regional hub of Santiago II.  It is composed of nine members and is supervised by a board of directors, with Rossemary as their president.  Businesses that are brought in front of this communal association are varied and include: sale of bulk cleaning materials, sale of pastries, sale of jackets, sale of clothing, sale of candies, sale of “salchipapas” (kebobs) and sale of cheese.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small microbusinesses, of which Rossemary is a member.  She points out that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, by invitation of her sister-in-law who is a customer of the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling “salchipapa” (a traditional fast food); she revealed that she started this business by watching her friend who sold the same products and had a successful business.  That is why she decided to invest capital in this business.

The loan that she will now request is to increase her capital.  She is buying a food stand to sell her product that will be used in her place of business for the convenience of her customers.  This job allows her to generate the resources to financially support her family since she is a single mother of one.

When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the healthcare, the loans and the training programs that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a food stand to sell her products.

loans.name: Areli Del Carmen

texts.es:
Areli, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, se encuentra felizmente casada, su esposo emigró hace 4 años hacia los Estados Unidos, en donde trabaja realizando oficios de construcción, fruto de la relación están 3 hijos entre 19 y 11 años de edad, los cuales se  encuentran estudiando, dos van a la universidad y el menor está en la escuela.

Areli, tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas en su casa, las cuales empieza hacer desde primeras horas de la mañana, hasta a las 10:00 a.m. el negocio está siendo rentable, pues se encuentra ubicado a la par de una universidad y los estudiantes son sus principales clientes, en el trabajo le colaboran también sus hijas mayores.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar otra plancha para hacer pupusas, pues la que tiene ya está muy vieja y es muy pequeña.- Además, necesita estar preparada porque ya se acerca la temporada de clases y quiere comprar insumos como leña, maíz y chicharrones.

El sueño que tiene Areli, es ir ampliando el negocio para generar mayores ganancias y también sueña con ampliar y mejorar su casa, para que junto a sus hijos puedan vivir de forma más confortable.
texts.en:
Areli, 43 years old, is an entrepreneurial woman. She studied up to the 3rd grade. She is happily married. Her husband emigrated to the United States 4 years ago, where he works in construction. From their relationship they have 3 children between 19 and 11 years old, all of whom are in school. Two go to university and the youngest is in school.

Areli has a business selling pupusas in her home, which she starts making early in the morning until 10:00 am. The business is profitable because it is located close to a university and the students are her principal clients. Her older daughters also collaborate with her in this work.

The requested loan is for buying another griddle on which to make pupusas. The one she has is already quite old and is very small. Also, she needs to be ready because the semester starts soon and she wants to buy consumable such as wood, corn and pork rinds. 

The dream Areli has is to grow her business in order to generate better earnings. She also dreams of expanding and improving her home so that she and her children can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy another griddle to make pupusas

loans.name: Sanabar

texts.ru: Санабар 58 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование-средне-специальное. Дети все взрослые и самостоятельные, живут отдельно, по хозяйству помогает супруг. С 1994 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки двух овец и лошади. Ежемесячный доход на сегодняшний день составляет около 14,400 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Санабар, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 4 коровы, 12 овец, 2 лошади. На участке мерою 1,17 Га она выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Санабар обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Санабар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а также сделать ремонт сарая.
texts.en: Sanabar is 58 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a specialized secondary education.  Her children are all adult and independent now and they live on their own.  Sanabar's husband helps her to run the farm.  Sanabar has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1994 when she bought her first livestock: two sheep and one horse.  She now makes a monthly income of about 14,400 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she has managed to develop a very strong farming business: she owns four cows, 12 sheep, two horses, and she also grows barley on 1.17 hectare of land.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy more livestock.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her cattle headcount, and also to renovate her barn.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Channo's Group

texts.en:
Channo’s group live in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Channo makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es un joven de 23 años, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Mario es un joven que le gusta trabajar para prosperar en la vida, es soltero, él trabaja fuera de su comunidad, ya que donde él vive no existe mucha fuente de empleo, Mario desde hace 5 años trabaja de mensajero con una abogada, pues para Mario no es suficiente este trabajo, ahora  él también se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios para la buena salud,  producto  denomina Herbalife, él es vendedor minorista, lo que busca Mario es tener más productos para alcanzar la meta establecido y poder ser vendedor mayorista  pero para lograr la meta él necesita comprar más productos.  Entonces la solución que encontró  Mario para alcanzar su meta es buscar un prestamo e invertir en la compra y de esa manera él venderá más para alcanzar su meta. 
Mario tiene esperanzas de conseguir el prestamo para alcanzar lo que anhela, y solo de esa manera él puede generar más ingresos, según lo que comenta Mario es un trabajo que si genera ingresos y no le consume mucho tiempo para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Mario, age 23, lives with his parents and his siblings in a community in Chichicastenango.  Mario is a young man who likes to work in order to prosper in his life.  His is single.  He works outside of his community because there are not many sources of employment where he lives.

Mario has been working as a messenger with a lawyer for five years.  However, this work is not enough for Mario.  He now also sells nutritional products for good health.  The product is called Herbalife, and he is a retail seller.  What Mario is looking for is to have more products in order to reach his established goal and be able to be a wholesale vendor.  In order to reach this goal he needs to buy more products.  The solution that Mario found to reach his goal is to seek a loan and invest in purchasing products.  This way he will sell more in order to reach his goal.

Mario hopes to get the loan in order to achieve what he wishes.  Only this way will he be able to generate more income.  According to what Mario says, it is work that generates income, and it does not take a lot of time to do so.

loans.use: to buy nutritional products.

loans.name: Shahboz

texts.en:
This is Shahboz who lives in the Vosey district. Shahboz was born in 1984 to a family of farmers. From his childhood, he was a very hard working boy and always helped his parents. He is a quiet and polite person. In the Vosey district, everyone respects him. 

Shahboz is married and has 2 children, ages 2 and 4 years old. His wife does not work. She is housewife.  

Shahboz graduated from the military academy, but today he is engaged in the transportation business. He is carrier of cargo. He has his own truck but as he said this vehicle is already old and constantly needs to be repaired which costs a lot of money.  For this reason, he has decided to take out a loan and buy a new truck. He believes with a new truck his possibilities will increase and he will be able to expand his activities. 

In the future, Shahboz has more perfect plans; one on them is to marry off his younger brother. With your support and help, Shahboz believes in his better future.

loans.use: to purchase a truck.

loans.name: Antonia Floridalva

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres En Acción.
En este lugar vive la señora Antonia, tiene 65 años, está divorciada y de esa relación que tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive en su casa. Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una Academia artesanal en la ciudad de Manta.
Doña Antonia es una mujer que siempre le ha tocado trabajar para salir adelante, desde hace más de 20 años instaló un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí cose todo tipo de ropa pero lo que más confecciona es ropa para damas  y de niños, trabaja todos los días unas seis horas por día, una de sus hijas que vive cerca de su casa le ayuda en su tarea cuando tiene mucho trabajo por entregar. En época de fiestas o entrada a clases es cuando más trabajo tiene y sus ganancias aumentan como en la actualidad. 
Este crédito lo va  emplear en comprar telas, cierres, hilos y otros materiales para la  costura. Lleva más de 13 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son  seguir mejorando todos los días.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of royal tamarinds, the members of the “Grupo De Credito Mujeres En Accion” meet every fifteen days.

In this place lives Antonia.  She is 65 years old, divorced, and from that relationship has 4 adult children, one of whom lives with her.  Several years ago she learned sewing at an Artisan Academy in the city of Manta.

Antonia is a woman who has always worked to move forward in her life.  More than 20 years ago she set up a small sewing workshop in her house.  There, she sews all types of clothing, but what she mostly sews is clothing for women and children.  She works six hours every day.  One of her daughters who lives near her house helps her when she has a lot of work orders.  Currently, at fiesta time or at the beginning of classes is when she has the most work and her income increases.

She is going to use this loan to buy fabric, fasteners, thread and other sewing materials.  She has been in the “Grupo de Credito” for more than 13 years and she likes it because with the loans she can move forward.  Her dream is to continue improving every day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fasteners, thread and other sewing materials

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул, 31 год, вдова, воспитывает сына, ему один год. Основной деятельностью Нургул является торговля овощами и фруктами на рынке, разведение скота и полеводство, чем стала заниматься с 2005 года. Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе, Нургул достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Нургул и воспитание ее сына. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Нургул имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец. Также на земельном наделе мерою 0,50 ГА, Нургул выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, а также увеличение прибыли от бизнеса, Нургул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в будущем планирует сделать ремонт в квартире.
texts.en: Nurgul is 31 years old, a widow, and the mother of a one-year-old son.  Her main activity consists in selling vegetables and fruits at the market and in cattle breeding and agriculture, which she started in 2005.  Thanks to her very hard work and constant labor, she has really managed to grow her business and she now makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  However, this amount of money is still insufficient to provide a decent living and to raise her son.  Nurgul currently owns two cows and ten sheep.  She also grows barley on 0.5 hectare of land.  In order to further grow her business, and to derive more profits from it, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC, and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her livestock headcount.  In the future, she would also like to perform some repairs in her apartment.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase her profits.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena is a mother of five. She is already 58 years old and managing a small piggery for income. She raises hogs and sells them upon achieving the desired weight. She is very patient in managing her business to sustain the needs of her family. Aside from the hog raising business, she also sells Avon products such as cosmetics and perfumes.

Now, Ma. Magdalena is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs’ sustenance.

Someday, she hopes to gain good profits in her businesses for educational purposes and her family’s emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs' sustenance.

loans.name: Bradford

texts.en:
Bradford knows a good idea when he sees one. Ten months ago, this young entrepreneur, born and raised in Georgia, decided to buy his friend’s company, Liquid Vapor World. Bradford’s enterprise now specializes in supplying the e-cigarette market with products.

“I heard about the hype and explosion of e-cigarettes and figured the earlier I got in on this business, the better,” he says. Under Bradford’s management, Liquid Vapor World has generated over $60,000 in gross revenue. This is an impressive accomplishment, and a motivation for Bradford to keep up. He’s learning that he needs to prepare for fluctuations in sales.

Bradford will use this loan to diversify his merchandise; with new products, he’ll have access to a broader customer base. He will also use the funds to build working capital, a cushion for the slower times of year.

Bradford is keen on pursuing his dream of being a successful entrepreneur. “No matter what happens, I want to have a flourishing family and be happy.”

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Renacer De Ipal Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RENACIENTES DE IPAL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Irene ,la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, gaseosas entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Renacientes de Ipal.”  This bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, in the province of La Convencion and in the department of Cusco.

The member Irene continues with her grocery store business.  She thanks those who form part of this dream through this medium and she promises to fulfill the payment of the loan at the established terms.  She continues selling necessary goods such as rice, sugar, milk and oil.  The member has spent a good amount of time with this business which is going well thanks to the determination that she puts every day into her business.  It is in this manner that she moves forward.

The member is asking for this loan to buy sugar, soda pop, among other things.

The other members work in the business of selling artisan goods, the business of selling animals, a grocery store business and a restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soda pop, among other things

loans.name: Laura Maryorie

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres En Acción.
En este lugar vive la señora Laura, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, uno estudia en universidad. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Laura es una  mujer que siempre le ha gustado sentirse independiente y ganar lo propio para bien de su familia, para esto ella se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de ropa por catalogo de varias marcas nacionales y colombianas, además de  productos Belcorp, Yanbal y Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días unas tres o cuatro horas por día, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 18 años dedicada al comercio y siempre le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, cremas, pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, etc. lleva en el Grupo De Crédito por 10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un  local comercial.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujeres en Acción communal bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province famous for being the home of the Reales Tamarindos stadium.
Laura, 55 years old, is married and has three adult children. One is attending university. Her husband is a taxi driver.
Laura has always enjoyed being independent and earning a living to support her family. She has a business selling clothing from a number of Ecuadorian and Colombian companies. She also sells beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories from Belcorp, Yanbal, and Avon. She makes her sales door-to-door, working three or four hours every day. She offers her customers payment plans, collecting every eight days. She has been in this business for more than 18 years and has always gone very successful.
Laura will use this loan to buy perfumes, lotions, pants, blouses, lingerie, etc. She has been a member of this communal bank for 10 years and appreciates the assistance the loans offer her. Her dream is to have her own brick-and-mortar shop.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, pants, blouses, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Bertha is an emerging entrepreneur; she is a single mother living with her parents in Mzuzu. Her daughter is in grade 9 and is being taken care of by Bertha’s parents. She is requesting her first loan to start running her own business. Her business will provide financial services to people in her hometown of Mzuzu.

Bertha says her community will benefit from her mobile money transfer business, because they will be able to access financial services in an environment that is not as intimidating as the banks. She says her business will be near the people, and as a result, they will save on transport costs.  

Bertha is requesting a loan in order to get the working capital she needs to get her Zoona business off the ground and start serving her community. With this loan, she will pay for her set-up costs. This loan will be used to buy a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters and some uniforms and an Internet enabled mobile phone. The loan will also be used as float for her to serve her customers. 

Starting the business is very important to Bertha. It will give her an income, and she will stop depending on her parents to take care of her and her daughter. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make the best of it.

loans.use: to set up her own Zoona mobile money transfer business by providing the funds needed to serve customers and purchasing the equipment needed for her to start transacting.

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Lucky is 25 years old. He needs a loan to start running his own business. He is the firstborn in a family of three and lives with his mother in Rhumpi. Starting his own business is very important to Lucky as it will help him earn profits to take care of his mother and two siblings.

In order to support his family, Lucky started running a makeshift grocery shop when he was 18 years old. He continues to run this business and uses the small profits to provide for his family. He has seen the opportunity to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business and is very excited about this prospect. With the Zoona mobile money transfer business, Lucky will be able provide financial services to people in the community by providing an easy way for them to move their monies. 

Lucky’s loan will be used to provide the working capital he needs to get his Zoona business off the ground and start serving his community. He is relocating to Mzimba and will set up his business there. With this loan, he will pay for his setup costs. This loan will be used to buy a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters, and some uniforms. He will also buy an Internet-enabled mobile phone, a cashbox, and chair. He will also use the funds as float to serve his customers. 

Once he starts earning a bit more money through his mobile money business, he will use the profits to transfer his sister from a local community school to a government school as he will be able to pay for her school fees. Lucky thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To set up his own Zoona mobile money transfer business by providing the funds needed to serve customers and to purchase the equipment needed for him to start transacting.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 38 years old. He is married with two children, an 8-year-old and a 13-year-old. Both of his children are in school. Clement primarily worked as an accountant until he was retrenched and he branched out as an entrepreneur. He is excited to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business because it will provide access to financial services to people in his community of Nkhotakota, who previously had to travel long distances in order to send or receive money.

Clement will work hard to ensure that the business is successful. He says his community will benefit because there are few companies in Malawi that provide financial services that actually work. He says most of the people, especially in rural communities, struggle to access proper financial services. He hopes that through his business, he will be able to create employment for young people.

Clement is requesting a loan in order to get the working capital he needs to get his Zoona business off the ground and start serving his community. With this loan, he will pay for his set-up costs. This loan will be used to buy a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters, and some uniforms. He will also buy an Internet-enabled mobile phone, a cash-box and a chair. He will use half of the funds from this loan as float for him to serve his customers. 

Clement is hopeful that the anticipated profits from his business will help him pay for his children’s school fees and provide for their basic needs.

loans.use: to set up his own Zoona mobile money transfer business by providing the funds needed to serve customers and purchasing the equipment needed to start transacting.

loans.name: Cuthbert

texts.en:
Cuthbert is an emerging entrepreneur; he is 23 years old, and has just completed training with Zoona so that he can set up is own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Salima. His business will provide financial services to the large unbanked population his community.

Cuthbert says his life will change once he starts running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business, as he will be able to provide for his basic need and send money back home to his parents and siblings. He says his community will also benefit, as they will have access to easy and safe financial transactions that will enable them to move their monies without having to wait for days to access services.

Cuthbert is requesting a loan to set up his business so that he can provide financial services to people in Salima. With this loan, he will be able to purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair and a cashbox. The loan will also ensure that Cuthbert has money to serve his customers. The kiosk will be used to serve customers in Salima, as a large number of people still do not have bank accounts. Zoona has done market research and has determined that the location for this Kiosk is ideal. Cuthbert will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in town, and a large number of families will be using his service. Cuthbert is excited for this opportunity and thanks the Kiva lenders for their help.

Cuthbert’s biggest dream is run a successful business that makes people lives easier.

loans.use: To purchase a Kiosk, a mobile phone, chair, a cash box and to provide funds needed for him to service customers

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Gerald. He is jovial and enjoys interacting with people. He is the second born in a family of six. Gerald has successfully completed training in Lilongwe, Malawi to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. He will be relocating to Balaka, a township in the Southern region of Malawi, to set up his business there. He is very excited for this opportunity.

Gerald is requesting a loan to set up his business so that he can provide financial services to people in Balaka. With this loan, he will be able to purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair and a cashbox. The loan will also ensure that Gerald has money to serve his customers. The kiosk will be used to serve customers in Balaka, as most of the people are unbanked.  Zoona has done market research in Balaka and has determined that the location for this kiosk is ideal. Gerald will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in town and a large number of families will be using his service. 

This opportunity to run his own business means a lot to Gerald. He will have some income to cater for his basic needs. He is hopeful that he will become financially stable through this business and hopes to be able to send money back home to his mother and siblings.

loans.use: to open a mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a kiosk, a mobile phone, chair, a cash box and to provide funds needed for him to service customers

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
Memory is 24 years old. She is Chichewa by tribe, and lives in Lilongwe where she is studying banking and finance part time. Memory would like to start running her business. She requires a loan from Kiva to make this happen. This loan will help Memory pay for her set up costs. She will be able to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone to be used to serve her customers, a chair where she can sit as she serves her customers, and a cash box where she can keep her cash for safety. This loan will also provide Memory with the float needed for her to serve her customers. 

Zoona has done market research in the area where Memory is going to set up, and has determined that the location for this Kiosk is ideal. Memory will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in downtown Lilongwe and a large number of families will be using her service to send and receive their monies. 

This opportunity to run her own business means a lot to Memory. She will have some income to carter for her basic needs. She is hopeful that she will become financially stable through this business, and hopes to be able to start paying for her own school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a kiosk, a mobile phone, chair, a cash box and to provide funds needed for her to service customers

loans.name: Sopani

texts.en:
Meet Sopani, he is a 22-year-old businessman. His dream is to create employment for young people in Lilongwe, Malawi. He is requesting for a loan so that he can start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Blantyre, Lunzu area, Malawi. This loan will provide the working capital needed for Sopani to start running his own business.

Sopani describes the mobile money transfer business as an easy and quick way for people in Malawi to send and receive their monies. He is happy to work with Zoona because it will give him the opportunity to run his own business and earn some profits. He dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur and opening more Zoona mobile money transfer outlets, so that he can create employment as employment in his country is scarce. 

Sopani is requesting a loan in order to get working capital in order to get his Zoona business off the ground and have the means to achieve his dreams. He will purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, some branded fee posters, and a web enabled mobile phone, a chair and a cash box. With this loan, Sopani will be able to serve customers who need to access financial services in Lunzu, Blantyre. Zoona has done market research in Lunzu, Blantyre and has determined that the location for this Kiosk is ideal.  Sopani will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in the district and a number of unbanked people in the community will have access to his services.
