Sopani thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to open a mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Matthias

texts.en:
Matthias is 24 years old. He comes from a family of six and lives with his mother in Mzuzu. Matthias works hard to support his family, most notably, he pays for school fees for his young brother who is in grade 10. Matthias has worked contract jobs as a carpenter on and off since finishing his carpentry course in 2012. He has just completed training with Zoona to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. He will be relocating to Mzimba, where he will set up his business.

Matthias’s business will allow families in Mzimba to send and receive money. Matthias is happy to work with Zoona because it will give him the opportunity to run his own business and earn some profits. He dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur and opening more Zoona mobile money transfer outlets. 

Matthias is requesting a loan in order to get working capital to get his Zoona business off the ground and have the means to achieve his dreams. He will purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, some branded fee posters, and a web enabled mobile phone, a chair and a cash box. With this loan, Matthias will be able to serve customers who need to access financial services in Mzimba. Zoona has done market research in Mzimba and has determined that the location for this kiosk is ideal. 

Matthias will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in the district and a number of unbanked people in the community will have access to his service.

loans.use: to start running his own business by providing essential funds needed to serve his customers and purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair and a cashbox

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en:
Sheena is 36 years old. She comes from a family of five.  She has a 15-year-old daughter who is in 10th grade. She and her daughter live with her mother in a household of eight. Sheena needs a Kiva loan to start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Karonga. Her business will provide financial services to people in her community.

Sheena describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. Before she heard about Zoona, she ran a small business, selling cold water and ice cubes. She would go round the community carrying her merchandise in a cooler on her head, as she did not have a shop. She is excited to start running her Zoona mobile money transfer business, as she will have a place to sit and customers will come to her to send and receive money.  

Sheena is requesting a loan in order to get the working capital she needs to get her Zoona business off the ground and start serving her community. With this loan Sheena will pay for her set up costs. This loan will be used to buy a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters, and some uniforms. She will also buy an Internet-enabled mobile phone, a cashbox and chair. Half of the funds will be used as float to serve her customers. 

The profits from her business will help Sheena to provide better for her daughter and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to start running her own business by buying a trading kiosk, a mobile phone, a cashbox and a chair as well as providing essential transaction funds for her to serve her customers

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 32 years old. Christina is the firstborn of seven children in her family. She has a son, and they live with her mother. Christina has worked in the field of data entry, but wants to be an entrepreneur. Christina is excited to have her own Zoona business because it will bring needed financial services to her community. She lives in Chitipa, the northernmost district in the northern region of Malawi, which borders Tanzania and Zambia. 

Helping her community is very important to Christina. Christina has faced challenges with regards to employment opportunities, and her Zoona business will provide her with an income that she can utilize in supporting her family. Christina is requesting a loan in order to get the working capital she needs to get her Zoona business off the ground and start serving her community. 

With this loan, Christina will pay for her set up costs. This loan will be used to buy a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters and some uniforms. She will also buy an internet-enabled mobile phone, a cashbox and chair. The loan will also be used as float for her to serve her customers.

loans.use: To start running her own business by buying a trading kiosk, a mobile phone, a cashbox and a chair, as well as to provide essential transaction funds for her to serve her customers

loans.name: Chiza

texts.en:
Meet Chiza, he is 35 years old. He is the fourth born in a family of seven. Chiza has successfully completed training in his hometown of Mzuzu, Malawi to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. He will be relocating to Rumphi, a township in the northern region of Malawi, to set up his business there. He is very excited for this opportunity.

Chiza is requesting a loan to set up his business so that he can provide financial services to people in Rumphi. With this loan, he will be able to purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair and a cashbox. The loan will also ensure that Chiza has money to serve his customers. The kiosk will be used to serve customers in Rumphi, as most of the people are unbanked. Zoona has done market research in Rumphi and has determined that the location for this kiosk is ideal. Chiza will be the main operator of Zoona mobile money transfers in town, and a number of families will be using his service. 

This opportunity to run his own business means a lot to Chiza, as he currently struggles to cater to his basic needs and lives with his young brother. By starting his own business, he will become financially stable and be able to rent his own place. He looks forward to growing his business, and thanks the Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair and a cashbox, as well as to provide working funds to serve his customers

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessings is 24 years old. When his mother lost her job, he had to lay aside his dream of going to college so that his siblings could get a chance to go to school.  Blessing has not given up hope of going back to complete his education. Today Blessing has completed training to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Mzuzu, Malawi.  

Blessing needs a loan to start his own business so that he can save money and go to college.

Blessing is excited to be one of the first people to start operating their own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Malawi, he says, “sending and receiving money in Malawi is not easy; people have to stay in long queues to access the service.’’ He hopes his business will provide an easier and faster way for people in his community and the country as whole to move their monies.

Blessing will use this loan to start up a business of mobile money transfers by purchasing a Zoona branded kiosk, which he will use to serve his customers. He will also use the money to buy a mobile phone which he will use to facilitate transactions.  The rest of the money will be used as his float: Float is the money that Blessing will use to facilitate the sending and receiving of money from his Kiosk. Blessing explains how running his own business will give him the opportunity to improve the standard of his life, and that of his family. This prospect excites him, and he cannot wait to begin operating his very own Zoona mobile money outlet. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to start up a business of mobile money transfers

loans.name: Angellina

texts.en:
Angelina is 28 years old. She was born in a family of seven and is the fifth born. Angelina has two sons. Her dream is to work hard so that she can take her children to school and give them opportunities she never had. Angelina would like to start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business to empower herself and her community. She needs to loan to make this happen.

Angelina has request a loan from Kiva in order to get the working capital she needs to get her Zoona business off the ground and start serving her community. She will use the loan to purchase a Zoona branded kiosk and a mobile phone, which she will use to serve her customers, a chair where she can sit as she serves her customers, and a cash box where she can keep her cash for safety. This loan will also provide Angelina with the float needed for her to serve her customers

Angelina’s hopes and dreams are to increase her income flow by working hard to ensure that her Zoona mobile money transfer business grows and becomes profitable. Angelina is very excited by the prospect of starting her own Zoona business and growing it so that she can continue to support her sons and see them through college. She thanks the Kiva lenders for this opportunity to change her life.

loans.use: to open a mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
Memory is 33 years old. She has two children and they both go to school. She lives with her husband in Lilongwe, Malawi. Memory runs a restaurant. She says her restaurant is special because she makes all her food without adding spices. Memory has just completed training with Zoona so that she can add mobile money transfers to her line of business. 

Memory is excited to have her own Zoona business because it will bring needed financial services to her community. Helping her community is very important to Memory. When Memory starts her Zoona business, she hopes to employ girls who have dropped out of high school due to lack of sponsorship so that she can help them raise funds and send them back to school.

Memory is requesting a loan in order to get the working capital she needs to get her Zoona business off the ground and start serving her community. The money will be used to buy a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters, some uniforms, an Internet-enabled mobile phone, a cash box and a chair. She will also use the funds to provide a working capital float for her to serve her customers who need to access financial services.

Memory says that once her business becomes profitable, she hopes to send her children to better schools and invest some of the money back into her businesses so that she can continue growing and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To get her Zoona mobile money transfer business off the ground and start serving her community by providing financial services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Angela is an emerging entrepreneur. She is requesting her first loan to start running her own business. Her business will provide financial services to people in her hometown of Blantyre.

Angela describes her business as a way to send and receive money from one place to another in Malawi. She says her community will benefit from her mobile money transfer business because they will be able to access financial services at their convenience store, as that is where she will set up her trading kiosk.  People in her community can send and receive money as they do their shopping. 

Angela is requesting a loan in order to get the working capital she needs to get her Zoona business off the ground and start serving her community. The loan will be used to purchase a Zoona-branded kiosk; a mobile phone, which she will use to serve her customers; a chair where she can sit as she serves her customers; and a cash box where she can keep her cash for safety. This loan will also provide Angela with the float needed to serve her customers. 

Angela is excited to start running her own business. It will give her an income and she will be able to provide for her basic needs.

loans.use: To start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Lorena Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres En Acción.
En este lugar vive la señora Lorena, tiene 42 años  de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y 10 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su marido es mecánico.
Doña Lorena es una mujer que le gusta ganar lo suyo para  ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante a su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos Oriflama y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  trabaja tres días a la semana y no tiene horarios fijos en sus recorridos, ella también vende en su casa, lugar en el cual  tiene una vitrina, lleva más de 12 años con su negocio con el cual se gana sus ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cremas y perfumes. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 12 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un carro para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The members of the "Mujeres En Acción" communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Puertoviejo, capital of Manabi province. Puertoviejo has long been known as the "City of the Royal Tamarinds." Puertoviejo is also the home of Señora Lorena, age 42, the wife of a mechanic, and the mother of two children, ages 11 and 10, who attend school.  

Doña Lorena is a business woman who likes to earn a living so that she and her husband can support their family. She has for over 12 years earned a living selling clothing and a great variety of Oriflama and Belcorp products, such as beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories. She visits her customers door to door three days a week, though she doesn't have a regular schedule. Doña Lorena also maintains a display case for products in her home and sells to customers there. 

This loan is for the purchase of clothing, creams, and perfumes. Doña Lorena has been a member of "Mujeres En Acción" for 12 years, and likes being a member of the group. She used her first loan to start the business and aspires to own a car so for visiting customers and making sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Jordy Wladimir

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres En Acción.
En este lugar vive el señor Jordi, tiene 21 años  de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no tiene hijos. Su mujer trabaja en un almacén.
Don Jordi es un hombre muy trabajador que para sacar adelante su hogar y pensando en formar su familia se dedica al comercio, el vende de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00 el recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus prendas y también vende en su casa si algún cliente desea algún producto, vende al contado y a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más de 4 años con su negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, entre otras prendas. Lleva 2 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado la institución. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia pues vive arrendando.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujeres en Acción village bank meet every 15 days in Portoviejo, the capital de Manabí province, long known as the home of the Reales Tamarindos stadium.
Jordi, 21 years old, is in a long-term relationship but does not have children yet. His partner works in a department store. Jordi is a hardworking man who is doing his best get ahead and thinking about starting a family. He has a business selling a variety of clothing door to door. He works every day from 8:30 a.m. to 4 p.m., going around the city hawking his clothing and also selling from his home if a customer is looking for something in particular. He takes cash but also offers payment plans and charges his customers every eight days. He has had his business more than four years.
Jordi will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, and other clothing. He has been a member of the communal bank for two years and appreciates the assistance it has offered him. His dream is to own his own home, since he is currently renting.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and other clothing.

loans.name: Juanita Zoila

texts.es: Juanita es una mujer de 54 años de edad, residente en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, ella es una apasionada de las ventas por eso hace cinco años está dedicada a la comercialización de artículos textiles para el hogar como toallas y ropa de cama, también ofrece electromenores como ventiladores, sanducheras y  cafeteras,  su surtido es muy amplio puesto que ofrece ropa y calzado para toda la familia. Su idea de negocio surgió gracias a la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, su capital inicial fueron unos ahorros con los que logró realizar sus primeras compras, ese capital se incrementó tanto que hoy en día ofrece facilidad de pago a sus clientes; vecinos, familiares y amigos,  así mismo sus compras las realiza en el vecino país de Venezuela donde compra de contado.  Juanita está aplicando a su primer crédikiva,  por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en la compra de sabanas, toallas, ventiladores y calzado. Juanita está muy optimista con ésta inversión porque ella considera que favorecerá las ventas y le generará excelentes utilidades. Juanita es madre de una hija de 34 años y un hijo de 24 años a quienes desea continuar apoyándoles en sus metas y propósitos, ella es una mujer muy comprometida y responsable, dedica cuatro horas diarias a su negocio todos los días para poder cumplir con su presupuesto de ventas y estar más cerca de su meta a futuro de ampliar la capacidad de tu negocio.
texts.en:
Juanita is a 54 year old resident of a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla. She is passionate about selling so 5 years ago she started to work selling textiles for the home like towels and bed-clothing. She also offers appliances like fans, sandwich irons and kettles. Her variety is quite broad as she offers clothing and footwear for the whole family.

Her idea for the business came thanks to the need to improve her quality of living and that of her family. Her start-up capital was some savings with which she made her first purchases. Her capital increased and today she offers installment payments to her customers; neighbors, family and friends. She makes her purchases in the neighboring country, Venezuela, and pays in cash.

Juanita is requesting her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will invest in the purchase of sheets, towels, fans and footwear. Juanita is very optimistic about this loan as she thinks it will favor her sales and generate excellent profits.

Juanita is the mother of a 34 year old daughter and a 24 year old son who she wants to continue to support his their goals and proposals. She is a very committed and responsible woman. She spends 4 hours per day at her business very day to be able to comply with her sales projections and be closer to her goal of increasing her business capacity in the future.

loans.use: to invest in buying sheets, towels, fans and footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room in her mother's wooden house.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong is a 22-year-old single student who is from Prey Veng province in Cambodia. He is studying information technology in his third year at university in the city. 

His parents are farmers who cultivate rice, corn, and beans to sell. Vong does not have enough money to cover his university fees from the third to the fourth year, so he would like to apply for a loan. 

He will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully with this loan. After graduation, he wants a good job with a decent salary to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to cover his university fees

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Gregoria , tiene 52 años,  ella tiene un hija de la edad de 13 años, sigue con la actividad de confección de  enaguas estas prendas son para mujeres de pollera, las enaguas es una prenda que se pone debajo de la pollera es de tela de encaje,  su taller se encuentra ubicado en la zona las Delicias de la ciudad de La Paz, ella confecciona según pedidos como también entrega a distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz y el Alto,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de tela, en esta ocasión solicitara el préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser ya que tiene muchos pedidos por estas fechas de fin de año, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindad ya que creció en su actividad incremento su producción y por ende sus ingresos económicos como también mejoro la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gregoria is 52 years old, she has a 13 year old daughter, and she works as a dressmaker. These garments are for women in skirts. The petticoats are worn under the skirt and is made of lace fabric. Her studio is found located in Las Delicias zone in the city of La Paz. She makes dresses on request but also sells through various shops in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. 

She says that the last loan, which she used to buy fabric, was good for her, and this time she asks for a loan to buy a sewing machine, since she has many orders for New Years parties. She is grateful for the opportunity provided for her, since she's grown in her business and increased her production, and so increased her profits and improved her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Tuyatsetseg

texts.en:
Tuyatsetseg, 31 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Last year she began a photography business and in just one year, she attracted quite a number of clients. Before this job, she was a saleswoman at a shopping mall. Her husband is a security officer at a private company. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy equipment such as a printer, a camera lens, and a tripod. These items will increase her work efficiency and income. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her photography business

loans.name: Mwabugu

texts.en:
Mwabugu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 30,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of mats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of mats for resale.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: MARIA TRINIDAD: Es una señora muy trabajadora, amable, originaria de Rosita, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos, mayores de edad. Ella es maestra y tiene más de 30 años de laborar como docente. Desde hace 16 años vive en una casita muy pequeña que solo tiene un espacio que es cocina y dormitorio a la vez. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita un préstamo para construir un corredor, para lo cual necesita comprar madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra.. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad, construir las divisiones de los cuartos, instalar ventanas, piso y verjas por mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Maria Trinidad is a hard working woman, friendly and originally from Rosita. She is 54 years old and a single mother of six children who are all adults now. She is a teacher and has been working in education for more than 30 years. She has lived for 16 years in a small house that only has one room and she would like to use this loan to build a hallway. She will need building materials like wood, zinc roofing, nails and enough to pay for labor. Her dream is to have a cement home because they last longer and to build more rooms, install windows, a new floor and wrought iron for security.

loans.use: build a hallway using wood and zinc.

loans.name: Ulduz

texts.en:
Yulduz  is 21 years old.  She is a good needlewoman. She started her activity in childhood with the help of her mother. 

Yulduz is sewing very beautiful dresses. Due to this, she provides for her family. The family consists of four people, but they have small profit. Because of this, Ulduz is trying help to her parents. 

In this activity, she has two years experience. Today she wants to sew modern dresses and  develop her business, but her old sewing machine does not allow her to do this. 

It is the basic reason why she is getting a loan. She is planning to buy a new modern sewing machine and realize her ideas and skill. She hopes for your support and kindness.

loans.use: To buy a modern machine

loans.name: Rosa Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres En Acción.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 54 años  de edad y es madre soltera de una hija de  12 años de edad la cual estudia en colegio. Vive con su hija y una hermana. Hace varios años aprendió belleza en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante sola a su hija, ella tiene un salón de belleza y en el cual realiza muchos trabajos como cortes de cabello, tinturados, maquillajes, arreglos de uñas entre otros muchos servicios que realiza. Trabaja de lunes a sábado de 09h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando sus clientes necesitan de sus servicios ya que es la forma de ganarse la vida, ella lleva más de 12 años con ese negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va invertir en comprar tintes de cabello, esmaltes, maquillajes, oxigena, y otros materiales que ella necesita, lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the communal bank "Mujeres En Accion" (Women in Action) meet every 15 days. 

In this place lives Rosa, who is 54 years old. She is a single mother, and she has a 12-year-old daughter, who is in school. She lives with her daughter and a sister. Many years ago, she learned beauty at an academy in the city. 

Rosa is a very hard-working woman who has had to work very hard to move her daughter forward. She has a beauty salon where she offers many services such as hair cuts and color, make-up, and manicures, among many others. She works Monday through Saturday from 9:00 am until 8:00 pm and sometimes until even later when her customers need her services, since this is the way she earns a living. She has had this business for over 12 years, and it allows her to move ahead. 

She is requesting a loan to buy hair dyes, nail polishes, make-up, bleach, and other materials that she needs. She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years, and she likes it because the loans help her very much. Her dream is to provide the best for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, nail polishes, make-up, bleach, and other materials.

loans.name: Agueda Zenaida

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Agueda, tiene 58 años de edad y hace varios años su compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. 
Doña Agueda es una mujer que le gusta valerse por ella misma para así  obtener sus propios recursos y con estos salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo así como también agua en bidones. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa  si sus clientes así lo desean, trabaja todos los días, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada semana. Gracias a  los créditos ella sale delante de una forma honrada. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo así como también agua en bidón. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque siempre la ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people, its agriculture and livestock, the communal bank Grupo de Credito meets every 15 days.

This is where Agueda lives. She is 58 years old. Her husband passed away a few years ago and she was widowed. But she had three children from this marriage, all of whom are now adults but one of them still lives with her.

Doña Agueda likes to be independent and to earn her own money in order to obtain the things she needs and to get herself ahead in life. She sells clothing as well as water stored in large drums. She sells her merchandise door to door and she also sells from her own home if her customers prefer. She works every day, selling her merchandise on credit and collecting every week. Thanks to the credits she gives, she is able to support herself in a dignified way.

She has been running her business this way for 10 years. This loan will be used to purchase a large variety of different clothes as well as water. She is a member of the communal bank Grupo de Credito and she likes being a member with them because they help with loans. Her dream is to continue to run a better business.

loans.use: purchase clothing and water.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 29 years old. He is not married. He sells shoes and has been in the business for four years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro inició su negocio de fritos en el año 2009, estos productos son comida típica de la costa Caribe Colombiana, elaborada con la masa de tubérculos como papa y yuca o harina maíz, los cuales se rellenan con carne, pollo, queso o huevo y luego los fríe en aceite bien caliente y quedan listos para su consumo, también ofrece productos cárnicos procesados artesanales como chorizos y cuajos que sirve acompañados de papa cocida, papa frita o bollo. Su idea de negocio se originó gracias a su cónyuge, quien consideró que este negocio sería un nuevo ingreso familiar y ayudaría a cubrir los gastos de sus necesidades básicas. Actualmente lleva seis años de estar funcionando y sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y transeúntes del sector, quienes pueden disfrutan de los deliciosos productos que prepara, todos los días en el horario de  5 a.m. a 10 a.m. Pedro está aplicando a su primer credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en la compra de harina, papas, maíz, huevos, pollo y verduras, y una estufa eléctrica.  Esta inversión promete ser muy beneficiosa para el incremento de las ventas y mejorará las condiciones de producción y tiempos de entrega.  Pedro tiene 57 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos de 23 y 25 años y una hija de 20 años de edad a quienes desea continuar ayudándoles a conseguir sus metas y propósitos.  Pedro continua trabajando muy comprometido para cumplir con su meta a largo plazo de ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Pedro started his business in 2009. He sells typical food from the Caribbean coast of Colombia. He makes dough from potatoes and yucca or corn flour and he fills them with meat, chicken, cheese or eggs and then he fries them in hot oil. He also sells cold cuts like chorizo and rennet based cheeses that he serves with cooked potatoes, french fries or rolls.

The idea for his business came from his wife who thought that a business like this would be a good source of income for the family and would help cover the costs of basic necessities. He has been open for six years and his primary customers are his neighbors and people who travel through the neighborhood. His customers can enjoy the delicious foods he makes every day from 5am to 10am. Pedro is applying for his first loan with kiva through the bank Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to purchase flour, potatoes, corn, eggs, chicken, vegetables and an electric stove.

This loan will be a big boost for him because it will help him to increase sales, improve production conditions and purchase an electric stove. Pedro is 57 years old, the father of two sons who are 23 and 25 years old and a daughter who is 20 years old who he wants to continue to help as they work towards their own life goals. Pedro continues to work in order to achieve his long term goal of expanding his business.

loans.use: purchase flour, potatoes, corn, eggs, chicken, vegetables and an electric stove.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana, de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la Universidad cuarto y quinto año, de ella dependen sus hijos, con ella viven su madre y una hermana. 

Ana, se dedica a la sastrería desde hace 21 años y aprendió este oficio por medio de un proyecto que llego a la comunidad, ahora es independiente y el trabajo lo realiza en casa; además, tiene una pequeña tienda y el horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. todos los días. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar aceite, jabón, bebidas, golosinas y granos básicos, para la tienda y otra parte del dinero la invertirá en materia prima para la sastrería como hilos, tela, y unas decoraciones.- Anteriormente, se le otorgo el crédito para comprar materia prima, para lograr hacer muchos trabajos de sastrería y esto le generó buenas ganancias.   

Los sueños de Ana, son que sus hijos sean profesionales, para que sean independientes y también, desea que su crezca para tener buenos ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
42-year-old Ana studied up until the third grade. She is a single mother and has two children, who are in their fourth and fifth years of university. Ana’s children are dependent on her. Her mother and a sister live with her.

Ana has made a living as a seamstress for 21 years. She learnt this trade through a project that came to the community. Now she is self-employed and does her work at home; she also has a small store, which is open from 7:00am to 7:00pm every day.

She needs the loan to buy oil, soap, beverages, lollies, and staple grains for her store. She will invest the rest of the money in supplies for her sewing, such as threads, fabric, and some decorations. She was previously granted a loan to buy supplies so she could do lots of sewing jobs, which generated good profits for her.

Ana’s dream is to see her children become professionals so they become independent. She also wants her business to grow so she can have a good income and support her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, soap, drinks, lollies, and staple grains for her store

loans.name: Elsa Group

texts.en:
Lalparmawi is 36 years old and widowed. She is the profile member with her hand raised. She is also the representative of the group named Elsa. She has borne three children (two daughters and a son), who are still pursuing their studies.  She resides in an area where there are fewer employment chances and less availability of drinking water. Almost all the villagers are engaged in daily wage earning. 

For Lalparmawi, being a single parent, raising three children without a husband was very hard. Ever since her husband left her, it became her responsibility to take care of her children and also manage her family household expenses. She is a good, kind hearted, hardworking, and also honest woman. She tries to support her family in the best way she can. 

She started selling used clothes, going from door to door. She has been doing her business of selling used clothes for the past five years, but the income she gets is not sufficient to meet her family household expenses and also pay her children's educational fees. 

She tries her best, working very hard, but she was unable to meet her family expenses. She was very sad thinking that she couldn’t support her family. She even tried taking loans from money lenders, but she couldn’t afford to take the loans as the interest rates were too high for her. 

She aspires to buy more stock of the used clothes so that she can earn more income for her family, but her  hope of  buying more stocks was left behind as she doesn’t have the required amount. 

She came across WSDS through one of her friends. She applied for the loan from WSDS as they provide loans at a lower interest rates compared to others. With the loans, she hopes to buy more stock of used clothes to be sold in the market so that she can earn more profits for her family and also for pay her children's educational fees in time. 

She is thankful and is looking forward to the loan. Likewise, the rest of the members also have needs  and requested the loan to start their respective income-generating activities.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of used clothes (second hand clothes).

loans.name: Rupiyamo

texts.en:
Rupiyamo is a young resident of Vose district. She is 36 years old. Rupiyamo is a wonderful wife and mother of four children. She has two sons and two daughters. Her sons are 15 and 11 years old and her daughters are 13 and 9 years old. The children are in high school. Her husband has been a taxi driver.

Rupiyamo is engaged in sewing women's clothing and blankets. She makes women's clothes and blankets to order at home. Rupiyamo started this activity in 2005. She loves her job. In this activity, she likes to sew national women’s clothes and give them to her new customers. Rupiyamo is taking a loan to buy a new sewing machine because now she has an old sewing machine and this machine does not work well to fulfill the functions she needs. Your loan will help her to buy a new multi-function sewing machine to maintain operations and improve working conditions. Now your support is very important to her.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jelly Group

texts.en:
Vuvung is a 48-year-old woman and also the representative of the group, Jelly. She is the woman pictured with her hand raised in the group picture. She is a mother to four children (two daughters and a son) who have already attained 18 years of age and above now.  

She is a widow, left with four children to take care of. Soon after her husband passed away it became her core responsibility to nurture her children and also maintain her family expenses. She had lots of burdens in her head, unable to share it with others. She tries to support her family in the best she could as she is the lone breadwinner after her husband sudden death.  Most of villagers were engaged in fair wage earning and weaving, so she too starts earning through daily wages and she also engaged in weaving. 

The income she earned was not meeting her family expenses and also her children's education fees. She was in a critical stage as she didn’t know what more to do. She did what she could, but it wasn’t sufficient for her family. She managed to open up a store by renting a place and selling readymade clothes with her hard earned money, thinking that she would earn more income for her family and also for her children's educational fees.

With the opening up of a small store, she started earning more than before, but still it doesn’t meet her family's expenses, and  with four children, for a single mother like her, it was not easy  to support four children. At times she cursed and blamed herself for not being able to earn enough income for her children. 

She wanted to expand her store by buying stocks of readymade clothes. Since clothes are one of the basic necessities for people, she usually has her business going with good demands from the customers. But due to the lack of income, she is unable to purchase stocks of readymade clothes. 

With the Kiva loan she wants to expand her shop by buying stocks of readymade clothes which would satisfy her customers and also earn more income for her family expenses and for her children's educational fees. 

She is thankful and grateful to the lenders and she wishes them "All the Best." Likewise, the rest of the members too requested the loan for their income generating works.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of readymade clothes to sell

loans.name: Santa Celeste

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su marido es agricultor.
Doña Santa con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días por ratos ya que ella no cuenta con horarios fijos para salir a sus recorridos ya que su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa, su hija le ayuda con las ventas, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más 5 años en su negocio. Gracias a los créditos ella puede comprar productos de oferta. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "3 De Septiembre" communal bank meets every fortnight in San Ignacio of the Colon Parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known for it's hard-working people who work in agriculture and raising cattle.

Santa lives here. She is 42 years old, married and from this relationship has 4 adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a farmer. Santa with the goal of having her own income and in doing this help her husband with the household expenses works selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She works every day at times as she has no fixed timetable. She goes out to sell as her method of selling is door-to-door and she also sells at her house. Her daughter helps her with the sales. She sells on credit and collects every 8 days. She has been in this business for more than 5 years.

Thanks to this loan she can buy the items on promotion. She will use the loan to buy perfume, jewellery, cosmetics, creams and other products. She has been in the communal bank for 3 cycles and she likes it as the loan help her a lot. Her dream is to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy perfume, jewellery, cosmetics, creams and other products.

loans.name: Carolina Yajaira

texts.es: CAROLINA YAJAIRA: Es una señora luchadora, originaria de Rosita, tiene 31 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos: La mayor de 15 años estudia su segundo año de secundaria y dos menores de edad. Desde hace 11 años habita en una pequeña vivienda que construyó en el terreno de su mama. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita un préstamo para comprar e instalar puertas y ventana de vidrio; actualmente la puerta y ventanas están en mal estado. Ella ya ha tenido un préstamo anterior con Pana Pana, con lo cual ha ido mejorando su calidad de vida, pues antes cocinaba en un fogón en el patio de su casita, pero ahora ya tiene un anexo para su cocina. Su sueño es completar la construcción de su casa que la quiere con un corredor de concreto, donde ella pueda descansar y refrescarse.
texts.en: Carolina Yajaira, 31, is a hardworking woman from Rosita.  She is a single mother with three children; the oldest is fifteen years old and in her second year of high school, and the two others are minors.  For eleven years she has lived in a small home that she built on her mother’s land.  With the goal of improving the condition of her home, and having a more dignified and safe home for her family, she is requesting a loan to purchase and install a door and windows; currently the door and windows are in poor condition.  She already has had a previous loan with Pana Pana that has enabled her to improve her quality of life.  Before, she was cooking on a stove on the patio of her small home, but now she has an addition for her kitchen.  Her dream is to finish construction of her home, and she wants a concrete walkway where she can rest and refresh herself.

loans.use: to purchase and install a door and windows.

loans.name: Fatmire

texts.en:
Fatmire is an Egyptian-Albanian woman who lives in the city of Elbasan, where a large number of people from this community have been situated for a couple of generations. At first they lived in the suburbs, but as years went by and governments changed, so they did too. They changed their places of living. 

Fatmire is 47 and has a 13-year-old son; she works for pay as a cleaner in a hotel/restaurant and in the owner’s house. Her husband works as well in construction. They are seeking your financial help to improve sanitation by making repairs in their washroom.

loans.use: to improve sanitation by repairing their washroom

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
A loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek will help Dila buy a milk cow and repair the roof of their family house.

Dila is a 59-year-old widowed mother of six who lives in the north rural part of the country. Agriculture is what she has been practicing forever now; “it has been my family's means of income,” said Dila. She’s got grapevines, plums and apples orchards and sells the fruit. During springtime, she plants largely beans, onions, garlic, leeks, lettuce and cabbage and sells them to the farmer’s local market. She has chickens and sells eggs and pigs and sells about 2-3 pigs/year.  In addition to what she does, she receives a little pension of about $110/month being a widow and her daughter-in-law, who lives with her, works in a shoe factory operated by foreigners and makes an income of $220/month.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and repair the roofing of their family house

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is a 40-year-old married man from the village of Alambari. He lives with his wife and two school-aged sons. The only source of income for this four- member family is from a small agricultural activity. In particular, Gia and his wife work on the family-owned agricultural land growing maize, mandarins and nuts. They sell the harvested products at the local market and generate insignificant seasonal income. The family lives under poverty as the mentioned income is hardly enough to cover even basic needs. 

Gia can’t find any stable job and decided to start his own business in order, somehow, to improve his family's living conditions. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Gia applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Gia will buy a car and start providing a taxi service. He will serve local people and generate more stable income for his family's increased needs. 

He is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his children have a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Gia is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase a car to start a taxi business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 41 years old and married with one child who is currently in school. Analiza works very hard to provide for her family.

Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like groceries, soap, shampoo, bread, canned goods, etc.

Analiza has been in this business for 12 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like groceries, soap, shampoo, bread, and canned goods

loans.name: Asela

texts.en:
Asela is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Asela is 54 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Asela has a farming fruits business in the Philippines. Asela requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Asela has been in this business for 30 years.  She would like to save enough money so she could affor her children to send to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tufa

texts.en: Tufa is a generous woman. She was born in 1962. She lives in a rural area. She is a widow with two children. After the death of her husband, she raised her children alone. It was a hard time to pass away. She wanted to behave and educate her children well. Tufa came to believe that the only thing to do was to start a business. About 19 years ago, she started a business. She buys and sells kids' clothes. Every day, a great number of customers purchase her goods. She is planning to widen her activity in order to have a better standard of living. She needs financial support to buy a new collection of kids' wear to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of kids' wear to increase her business

loans.name: Sharifakhon

texts.en: Sharifakhon is a merciful person. She was born in 1970. She is living with her family in a small town. She is married with four. She has been running a business for about 19 years. Her husband earns well, but it covers only the needs and wants of the family. Sharifakhon is a seller. She has a business buying and selling menswear and shoes. She has satisfied clients. She is planning to enlarge her business. She needs financial support to buy a new collection of menswear and shoes to widen her business.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of mens' wear and shoes to widen her business

loans.name: Ana Yadira

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 9 y 5 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en la ciudad de Guayaquil. 
Doña Ana junto al esposo  tienen una tienda de viveras en su casa,  allí venden todo tipo de productos como granos, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, también productos de bazar, papelería y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabajan todos días y sus ventas son muy buenas ya que su negocio está frente a una escuela y los estudiantes siempre llegan a comprar en su local. Tienen más de 11 años que se dedica a su tienda con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Credito 3 de Septiembre (September 3 Credit Group) meets every fifteen days in San Ignacio of the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people and dedication to agriculture and cattle raising.

Ana lives in this place. She is 35 years old and in a common law relationship from which she has four children - two adults and two of 9 and 5 years old who are in school.

Her partner works in the city of Guayaquil. Ana and her husband have a convenience store in their home. They sell all types of products like grains, oil, detergent, vegetables and fruit as well as marketplace items like stationery and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies accessories). They work every day and their sales are very good since their business is in front of a school and the students always arrive to buy from their shop. They have had this shop for more than 11 years, from which they earn something for the good of their family.

They will use this loan to restock their store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil and detergent, among other basic necessities. She has been with the communal bank from the start and likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her goals are to continue with her business and for her store to grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Tone

texts.en:
Tone is 54 years old and a mother of three ranging in age from 19 to 25; the oldest got married recently.  Kindly note that in very rural Albania, engagements and weddings are a very important part of the tradition and what is most worth knowing, is that it is 100% the parents' responsibility to cover all the expenses related to such events.
 
Tone had saved some money herself for her daughter’s wedding yet it was not enough. So she borrowed from relatives and now she owes this money to them. Tone works for the city as a flower maintenance lady while her husband worked as a police officer for the city until recently, when he was laid off. He started immediately, though, doing something similar, like a security guard.

loans.use: to pay for her oldest daughter's wedding expenses that in their rural north tradition is the parent's responsibility

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 30 years old and married with two children who still are in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Gladys runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy and sell items like soap, bread, noodles, canned goods, bread, etc.

Gladys has been in this business for two years. 

Gladys would like to save enough money so she can afford her children to send to school.

loans.use: to buy and sell items like soap, bread, noodles, canned goods, and bread

loans.name: Maty Bamba's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 26 septembre 2013 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles  vivent dans le même village plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture sous pluie. 

Madame Maty Bamba, âgée de 42 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants dont 03 garçons et 05 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires : thé vert, sucre, pâte d’arachide qu’elle achète au marché hebdomadaire de la zone pour la revente dans son village. Elle maîtrise bien cette activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de sucre à 18 500 Fr CFA, un paquet de thé vert à 3 000 Fr CFA et un seau de 20 kg de pâte d’arachide pour la revente.

Les bénéfices me permettent d’une part d’aider mon mari à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille et d’autre part à renforcer mon épargne.
texts.en:
[This borrowers' group] has been created on September 26, 2013. There is good rapport among the group member. They all have been living in the same village for decades and maintain a spirit of solidarity and mutual help. They  main business activities are retail and rain-fed agriculture.

Ms. Maty Mabma, 42 years of age (the one seated on the far right raising her hand in the photo), is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has eight children: three sons and five daughters. She sells food products: green tea, sugar, peanut paste etc, which she busy at the weekly market of her region in order to resell in her village. She manages this business well.

With her new loan, she plans to buy a bag of sugar at 18,500 West African francs, a pack of green tea at 3,000 francs and a 20-kg [44 lbs] pail of peanut paste for resale. Her revenues will allow [her] to help [her] husband with family expenses and also bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar , a pack of green tea   and a 20-kg  pail of peanut paste for resale.

loans.name: Las Palmeritas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PALMERITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Segundia, la socia tiene 43 años de edad es casada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores,  la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a  sus  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a sus negocios, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante.

La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, agricultura, venta de cereales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Las Palmeritas.  This bank is located in the district of Paucartambo, in the province of Paucartambo and the department of Cusco.

The member Segundia is 43 years old.  She is married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily occupations between agriculture and the raising of small animals.  The member has spent a good amount of time working at her businesses which are going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her businesses every day.  She wishes to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family, this being the way that she can move forward.

The member is asking for a loan to buy seeds and manure.

The other members work in the business of selling animals, selling cereal grains and in agriculture.

The member feels thankful for the loan granted and promises to carry out with her established payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca es una mujer de 46 años de edad, divorciada, tiene un hijo varón de 11 años y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, activa, constante, responsable,  y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado de la zona de ‘pampahasi’ lugar caracterizado por sus orígenes; campesino aymaras que pelearon por la liberación del yugo español y se asentaron en ese lugar como trinchera, se encuentra sobre una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas.
Rebeca es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; bistec (carne con arroz y papas), sajta de pollo (pollo picante, con chuño), pollo al horno y lechón al horno. Ella se ocupa de cocinar en el mercado durante la mañana para dejarlo todo listo a medio día; al cabo de 3 horas acaba toda la comida. “compré una cocina hace varios años para trabajar en la cocina y le di el mayor uso posible…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante con ayudantes de cocina, y desea realizar una inversión en la compra de insumos de cocina como; harina, huevos, verduras, papa, etc.,  por mayor para contar con una alacena abastecida para cocina a diario. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 17 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rebeca solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor para vender comida.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 46 years old and divorced. She has an 11-year-old son and she makes her living selling traditional food.
She is entrepreneurial, a good mother, active, reliable, conscientious, and hardworking. She plies her trade in a market in Pampahasi, an area marked by its origins: Aymara peasants who fought to escape the Spanish yoke and settled there as a sort of trench. It is on a hill in the city, with steep streets.
Rebeca has dark skin and a long black braid; she is short and wears traditional dress (hat, shawl, and petticoated skirt). Her first language is Aymara, which she speaks at home, while she speaks Spanish in general society and in the course of doing business. She lives with her son, who is currently in school. They live in a rented house that has potable water, electricity, and sewer service. She makes a living selling traditional foods such as beef with rice and potatoes, spicy chicken with freeze-dried potatoes, baked chicken, and baked suckling pig. She cooks in the market in the morning so everything will be ready at midday; she runs out of food within three hours. "I bought a stove a few years ago to work in the kitchen, and I've gotten maximum use out of it," she says. Her dream is to have a restaurant with kitchen assistants, and she hopes to invest in buying ingredients such as flour, eggs, vegetables, potatoes, and so on, so that her cupboards will be fully stocked for daily cooking. This is her first loan with the institution in the 17 years she's been engaged in this business.
For these reasons, Rebeca is requesting a loan to buy kitchen ingredients in bulk so that she can sell food.

loans.use: to buy kitchen ingredients in bulk so she can sell food.

loans.name: Virginia Maribel

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Virginia, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 1 años de edad,   el mayor  estudia en jardín de infantes. El marido es chofer. 
Doña Virginia es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y otros productos de catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale casi  todos los días a recorrer la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 4 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y otros productos de catalogo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
The loan group "Third of September" meets every two weeks in San Ignacio in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hard-working people who work in agriculture and livestock raising.

Señora Virginia lives in this place. She is 23 years old and is in a free union relationship from which she has two children, ages 4 and 1. The older one goes to kindergarten. Her husband is a driver.

Doña Virginia is a housewife who, in order to obtain her own resources and with them be able to help her husband with the household expenses, works in selling clothing of all types, shoes, and other catalog products. Her form of sales is door to door. She goes out almost every day to go through the city offering her products, and she also sells in her house, where her customers come when they need some article of clothing. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She has been in this business for more than four years, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, and other catalog products. She has been in the loan group since its beginning, and she likes it because she began her business with one of the loans. Her dreams are to have a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and other products to sell

loans.name: Susana Jaqueline

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Susana, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, una de  7 años y un bebé de 9 meses, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Susana con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar con los gastos de sus pequeños hijos  se dedica a la venta de ropa, ropa interior, zapatos, carteras, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, ella sale tres días a la semana más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más de 5 años en su negocio con el cual ayuda a su familia a salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, zapatos, carteras, entre  otros productos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de  Crédito y le gusta porque así mejora su negocio. Sus sueños darle lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
In San Ignacio of the Colon parrish, in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people dedicated to agriculture and livestock raising, the credit group "3 de Septiembre" meets every fifteen days.

In this town lives Susana, who is 29 years old. She is married and has two children, one who is 7 and a baby at 9 months. The older child is in school. Her husband is a shopkeeper. 

Susana, with the objective to use her own income to help with the needs of her young children, makes a living selling clothes, underwear, shoes, bags, and other things. She sells door-to-door or in her house, where she meets her clients. She goes out three days a week, usually in the morning, since at those hours it's much easier to do rounds. She accepts credit and collects every eight days. She's had her business for more than five years, which has helped her family to move forward. 

She will use this loan to buy clothes, perfumes, shoes, bags, and other products. She has been with this credit group since the beginning and likes it, since it helps her improve her business. Her dream is to give the best to her young children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, shoes, purses, and other products.

loans.name: Guljon

texts.en: Guljon is welcoming and pleasant woman. She is 62 years old. For 30 years she worked as a farmer. But now with her husband she engaged in livestock business. She lives with her husband, son daughter-in-law, and grandchildren in Jilikul district. Guljon adore her activity and well looking after her animals. She provides with fresh milk her family and relations. Today she decided to increase her income for this reason she wants to purchase several cattle. She believes with help of Kiva lenders, she will be able to improve her family income. Guljon will be  grateful if you support her.

loans.use: to buy a few cattle

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en: Hosiyat is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1954. She lives in rural area. She is widowed. She has had this business about twenty years. She is buying and selling clothes and shoes for kids. She has a place of a business in domestic market. She has many years’ experience in doing business. She has constant customers. She likes to do a business and gains good profit from it. She is planning to enlarge her activity. She is needed in financial support to buy more children's clothes to widen her business.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes to widen her business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresa is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Teresa has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fruits like banana, pineapple, etc to sell in her food stall.

Teresa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide and secure for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits like banana, pineapple, etc to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Mwanamisi  has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Vahide

texts.en:
Vahide wants to expand the existing space of the bar-café that she has been operating for about five years now, and the money she is requesting will be used for this purpose.  

Vahide is 62 years old and married; she’s got four children with the three oldest ones being married and living on their own and the youngest one who is 21 and still living with her and the husband. Currently, they live in a little town just south eastern part of the country. Before moving to the current location, they lived in an industrial north town where the husband worked for the government  but owning a piece of property here, made them move back. 
Vahide makes about $130/month and her husband $146/month.

loans.use: to expand the existing space of the bar-cafe she's been operating for the last 6 years

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas a la vez están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una quiere ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que la misma esta en un nivel medio de ingresos, y que debe seguir esforzándose por mejorar. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene todo tipo de prendas que sale a vender de manera ambulante, quiere seguir esforzándose es por ello que siempre da lo mejor de sí, ya que con ello también ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias, de manera a poder seguir sus ventas, y también poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Emprendedoras [Entrepreneurial Women] is in its sixth cycle with the Women's Committee program. They are also a part of the poverty elimination survey in which each one is working to improve their living conditions.

One of the women is Maria, who on her last survey had a poverty level of two, which is a medium income level and she must keep working hard to improve. She sells clothing, all types of garments, from door to door. She wants to keep working hard which is why she always gives the best of herself. This allows her also to help her family.

She asks for this loan to buy various garments so that she can continue with her sales and continue improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy various garments for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, yeast and other things.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El Sr. Ignacio tiene 24 años, está en pareja, y comenta que tiene  una hija, por quien él y su esposa se esfuerzan para poder darle  todo lo que necesita para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ignacio se dedica al macate (venta ambulante) desde varios años, anteriormente trabajaba para otra persona y como fue ganando experiencia se independizo y que gracias a eso tiene una buena clientela formada por varias ciudades.
 Ignacio pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos varios para la venta, como ser prendas, calzados, productos de mercería y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
Ignacio, 24, is in a relationship and has a daughter for whom he and his wife work hard so that they can give her everything she needs for a dignified life without hardship. Ignacio has worked for several years as a door-to-door salesman. He used to work for someone else, and after he gained experience he decided to become independent. Thanks to that experience, he has a good customer base in several cities.

Ignacio asks for a loan to invest in products for sale such as garments, shoes, haberdashery and more. This way he can continue with his sales, fighting to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy garments, shoes, haberdashery and other things.

loans.name: Villeta Poty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Villeta Poty está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo relativamente nuevo, donde las integrantes están con mucho entusiasmo de ir mejorando sus vidas por medio del trabajo unido de todas. 
La Sra. Virgilia integra este grupo, quien se destaca por su trabajo solidario con las compañeras, siempre las apoya y trata de dar lo mejor de si. Ella tiene una despensa que fue montando través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, y que ha crecido mucho con el correr del tiempo. Esta agradecida por esta  oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Virgilia solicita este préstamo para la compra de leche, aceite, fideos, arroz, entre otros productos de uso familiar que ella comercializa en su despensa.
texts.en:
This group is called Villeta Poty and it is in its second loan cycle with the women's communal bank program; it is a relatively new group whose members are very enthusiastic to improve their lives through their collective work.  

Virgilia is a member of this group who stands out for her supportive work with her fellow members; she always supports them and tries to give her best.  She has a grocery store that she set up through continuous work and effort and which has grown a lot with the passing of time.  She is thankful for the opportunity she has received to be able to improve her living conditions and help her family.  

Virgilia is requesting this loan to buy milk, oil, noodles, and rice, among other common products that she sells in her store.

loans.use: to buy milk, oil, noodles, and rice, among other products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Gnima's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place le 29 décembre 2014 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme comme les femmes des villageois environnants afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Gnima, âgée de 52 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 garçons, elle s’active dans la transformation et la vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle achète les graines non décortiquées par sac  de 50 kg dans son village et les environs, pour la revente au marché international de la sous région après transformation par seau de 20 ou 05 kg.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 04 sacs de graines d'arachide de 50 kg à 10 000 Fr CFA l’un pour la transformation et la vente.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte développer son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Established December 29, 2014, the "banc villageois" loan association consists of a group of women from the village, having joined the program along with women from surrounding villages, to make their small businesses more profitable. They are also active in rain-fed agriculture. There is a good ambience during group meetings.

52-year-old Mrs. Gnima (seated at the far right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is the married mother of four boys, and is active at processing and selling groundnut paste. She buys un-shelled kernels in 50-kilo bags from her village and the surrounding area, to be resold in the sub-region's international market after processing into 5 or 20-kilo buckets.

She intends to use the new loan to buy four 50-kilo bags of groundnuts at 10,000 CFA francs each, for processing and sale.

She plans to use the profits to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy four 50-kilo bags of peanut kernels at 10,000 CFA francs each, for processing and sale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La socia Eva  se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eva manages her business of selling beauty products such as lipsticks, crèmes, and perfumes. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Eva has been this business for several years. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell beauty products.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy crèmes, lipsticks, and perfumes. Eva is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, lipsticks, and perfumes.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and has four children in school. They own a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwanajuma has operated a business selling food to neighbours which earns her a source of income. She faces the challenge of delayed payments, hence low profits in her business.

With this loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase iron sheets and nails for construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to  purchase iron sheets and nails for construction.

loans.name: Famil

texts.en:
Famil is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents. Famil’s family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city, now he lives in Baku region.

Famil is an auto repair master. His uncle helped him open an auto repair business because his uncle has an auto repair business also. Now he wants to buy a new apparatus, which necessary in his business.
