For this, Famil has applied for a loan in the amount of 1300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Famil is very thankful to the Kiva organization for it. In the future he wants to repair his area, and in personal life he wants to get married.

loans.use: to buy new apparatus for his business.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a generous woman. She is married, born in 1990, and is living in a remote district without any children.

She is a farmer and has been in this business for three years. She keeps and sells livestock.  Saida is a hardworking, responsible, honest, generous and bright woman. She feeds the animals very well and all her clients are always satisfied. 

She is planning to renovate her house. She is seeking financial support for the repairs. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles viennent dans ce sens entamer leur deuxième cycle dans le programme. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Adama (assises à droite avec une main levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfant (03 garçons et 02 filles). Elle  s’active dans l’achat et la revente de graines d’arachide. Elle veut acheter des sacs de d’arachide non décortiqué, fait le décorticage pour la revente par kilo à un prix plus intéressant. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

 Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter pour un premier vague 05 sac à 10 000 Fr CFA pour décortiquer et revendre par kilo à 400 Fr CFA.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d'augmenter son épargne et d'aider son mari dans les tâches régaliennes
texts.en:
This group was set up during the second half of 2013. It consists of women determined to change their living conditions. Consequently they are entering their second round in the program.

They all live in the same village and maintain strong solidarity and mutual aid relationships. Their main activity is small retail business augmented by rain-fed agriculture.

Mrs. Adama (seated on the right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is a 37-year-old married mother of five children (three boys and two girls).

She is active in the buying and selling of groundnut kernels. She wants to buy bags of un-shelled groundnuts, to be shelled and resold by the kilo at a better price. She has good experience in this area having had years of practice.

She intends to use this loan to buy a first set of five bags at 10,000 CFA francs each, to shell and resell at  400 CFA francs per kilo.

Profits will enable her to increase her savings and help her husband with household expenditures.

loans.use: buy a first set of five bags at 10,000 CFA francs each, to shell and resell at  400 CFA francs per kilo.

loans.name: Sidony's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis Mai 2007,il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village et sont solidairement liées par une responsabilité de remboursement de crédit.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.*

Sidony qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée, est âgée de 40 ans et mére de 02 garçons et 02 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de légumes et de bananes,elle s'approvisionne pour les légumes en ville pour revendre dans son village,et pour la banane dans son village.
Avec l'argent du crédit,elle compte acheter 60 kg de gombo pour une somme de 45000f,50 kg de diakhatou pour une valeur de 30000f,150 kg d'aubergine pour 37500f,10 kg de piments pour un total de 20000f et 300 kg de bananes à 140f le kg soit 42000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne,assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et leur nourriture et aussi satisfaire ses besoins .
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2007. It consists of women from the same village who are jointly bound by a responsibility to repay a loan. Their main activity is small retail commerce.

Sidony, who is raising her arm on the right of the photo, is the leader of the group. She is a 40-year-old married mother of two boys and two girls.

Her activity is trading vegetables and bananas. She restocks the vegetables from the city, for resale in her village, and gets the bananas from her village.

She intends to use the loan to buy 60 kilos of okra for 45,000 francs, 50 kilos of diakhatou (scarlet eggplant) for 30,000 francs, 150 kilos of eggplants for 37,500 francs, 10 kilos of hot peppers for a total of 20,000 francs, and 300 kilos of bananas at 140 francs per kilo, for a total of 42,000 francs.

Her aim is to increase her savings, provide schooling and food for her children, and also meet her own needs.

loans.use: buy vegetables and bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: skirts, blouses, pants, T-shirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
Yrene tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida preparada por ella misma desde hace más de catorce años, es una mujer emprendedora que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como sacos de arroz, bidones de aceite, azúcar, gaseosas, entre otros, con lo que busca satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes, generar mayores ingresos en su negocio y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yrene is 46 years fold and lives with her son in Oyotun, a community where people earn their living in farming, sales and raising cattle.  Oyotun is located in Chiclayo province which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Yrene has been working   for more than fourteen years  selling food she prepares herself.   She is an entrepreneurial woman who relies on her experience in this business and has good personal and work connections in the area.   She has asked for a loan to buy raw materials for her business such as sacks of rice, large containers of oil, sugar, and soft drinks, with which she can meet her customers' wants and preferences, earn more income  through her business and thus improve her quality of life, and her family's.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business including sacks of rice, large containers of oil, sugar, and soft drinks

loans.name: Haydee Del Pilar

texts.es:
Haydee del Pilar tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su nieta en el distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Su población se dedica principalmente al cultivo de café, comercio y cría de ganado vacuno y de animales menores.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos desde hace dos años, con la ayuda de su esposo lograron construir corrales y colocarle calamina para proteger a los cerdos recién nacidos de las constantes lluvias que hay en la zona. Ella es muy conocida en el distrito, respetable y confiable, sus clientes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos y para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Haydee del Pilar is 49 years old, and in a civil partnership.  She lives with her partner  and her niece in Santo Tomas, located in Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru.   The people there mostly earn their living by rowing coffee, in sales and in raising beef cattle and small animals.

Haydee has been working at raising and selling pigs for two years.  With her partner's help she was able to build pens and use corrugated metal to protect the newborn pigs from the constant rains in the area.  She is well known in the area,  respected and trustworthy.  Haydee's customers have good things to say about her in business and personal ways.  The loan purpose is to buy a larger number of pigs and balanced nutritional food for fattening them.  With this help, she will get more income to be able to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos y para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos.

loans.name: Vân

texts.en:
Vân works in agriculture, farming food. Vân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 51 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Vân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having money to repair a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet. 

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her business to do well. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Donika

texts.en:
Donika photographed with Gezim, her husband, who was born blind at birth. She wants now to invest in three calves, and repair the stable with your financial help. 

Donika currently has four female cows and six calves. She does not sell milk because she feeds the calves that she currently has, and the ones that she will buy with the loan she is asking this time. A cow feeds about two calves simultaneously, and when calves are grown, she then sells them.

According to Dokika, she makes more money selling calves than milk, and last year following this strategy she made roughly $9,600 compared to half, $4,000.

loans.use: to buy three baby calves and repair the stable

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be open minded and faithful. 

He operates a retail shop where he sells stationery. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are regulars. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of stationery. His business goal is to open more business branches within five years. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of stationery

loans.name: Orxan

texts.en:
Orxan is 22 years old and he is single. He is living with his parents in Baku region. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Person) for over 22 years; they are from Fizuli city. 

Orxan is a music teacher. After his military service, Orxan continued his business. This is Orxan's second loan. The first loan he paid on time. 

His accordion was broken, and now he wants to repair the accordion. He needs a loan in amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Therefore he has applied to Komak Credit Union. 

In the future, Orxan wants to get married and have children.

loans.use: to repair accordion

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a Kiva borrower. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells cashew nuts. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. 

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cashew nuts. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with one child who describes herself as honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells flour, washing soap, cooking oil, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high price of products. 

Mwanatumu will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more stocks of flour, cooking oil, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to grow to become a wholesale supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to support her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, having successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: buy more stocks of flour, cooking oil, sugar and other items

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be industrious and determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells flour, washing soap, cooking oil, sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a good and secure place, and her primary customers are of different types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

Ann will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, cooking oil, milk, sugar, and other items. 

Her business goal is to expand to wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, cooking oil, milk, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest and transparent. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are of different types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power interruptions. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy barber shop equipment. His business goal is to own a company within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have more business branches. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy barber shop equipment

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be obedient, and God-fearing. He is a mechanic and repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are vehicle owners. 

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy repair equipment and pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the future he will excel. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy repair equipment and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be reliable. 

She operates a retail business where she cuts timber to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are builders.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy another power saw for timber cutting. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. 

This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another power saw

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en:
Meswalehe is a Kiva borrower. She has one child. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells cashew nuts and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a residential place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cashew nuts. Her business goal is to open a retail shop within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will live a good life. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cashew nuts

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 30,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en: Meselemani is a Kiva borrower who has four children with ages ranging from nine years to 21 years. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in her neighbourhood and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more stock of firewood. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of firewood

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man who has four children aged from five to 16 years. He describes himself to be God-fearing and honest. He operates a retail business where he sells peanuts. His primary customers are regulars and he describes his biggest business challenge to be increases in prices. David will use the 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more stock of peanuts. His business goal is to grow to become a wholesale supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits to boost his working capital. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, having repaid his previous loans successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of peanuts

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a beauty salon where he offers beauty services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area  and his primary customers are ladies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stocks of beauty products for salon use. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another beauty salon.

loans.use: buy more beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a married woman. She has two children aged six and eleven. She describes herself as being reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells cashew nuts. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of cashew nuts. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more cashew nuts

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a  married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest and God-fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells washing soap, ground nuts and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a convenient place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rain season. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of washing soap, ground nuts and other items. His business goal is to expand to wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to support his family. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of washing soap, ground nuts and other items

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married  woman and has five kids who attend school. She has owns a house that neither has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a motorcycle transport business traveling from door to door. In addition she also operates a poultry farming business which earns her another source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges include the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KSH 30,000 she wants to add on her savings to purchase another motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water and electricity. 

Fatuma has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a  married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be polite and honest. He operates a retail business where he sells onions. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are individuals. 

Joshua will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of onions. His business goal is to own a bigger shop within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will improve his family's living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions

loans.name: Sufia

texts.en: Sufia is a thirty-two-year-old married lady. She is shown in the photo with her husband. She has been successfully running a school in her community. A motivated and hard worker, she wants to grow her business. She has requested Murabaha for a PKR 30,000 loan to provide better facilities for her students, such as chairs and benches. Sufia believes that in growing her business, she can also help the children of her community have access to a good quality education.

loans.use: to provide better facilities for her students, such as chairs and benches.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is the mother of two lovely children and is a very hard-working woman. She is based in Kaptumo, a remote village in the Nandihills , an area with fertile soil famous for dairy farming. The region's staple food is “Mursik,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk. 

Hellen has been practicing mixed farming for the past twenty years. Selling eggs and milk has earned her a decent income. She also engages in another business to make ends meet. Hellen passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every morning to milk her cow. 

While this humble mom has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of having enough land to expand her dairy and crop farming. She is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land. With this loan she will be able to increase her farming and be able to produce more crops. Through this loan her cows will have a good area for grazing and also this will create enough space for practicing zero grazing. Through Kiva Field Partner Juhudi Kilimo, Hellen attended training sessions and was taught financial management skills. This will help her save more money, repay the loan fully, and improve her living conditions.

Lenders, kindly help out this Kenyan woman with a great passion in farming!

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Nyebu - Bi Yoona  -  Nyohini Group

texts.en:
Meri is a 46-year-old hardworking woman from Bimbilla, in the northern region of Ghana. She is married and has four children. Meri is the individual pictured with the hand on the paddy rice, among the members squatting.

Meri is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last 30 years. The name of the group is ‘Nyebu - Bi Yoona  -  Nyohini’. She earns a good profit from the simple business because the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality parboiled rice for the Ghanaian local markets.

Meri and ‘Nyebu - Bi Yoona  -  Nyohini’ group have asked for a loan of GHS 20,100. Meri’s share of the loan is GHS 700, which she would use to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. Meri aspires to produce in large quantities in future and earn more income, as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food, health care and education.

Meri thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Saman

texts.en: Saman is a twenty-four-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She lives in the joint family system. Her brother in law (also shown in the photo) is in the poultry business to help meet their household expenditures. He makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her brother-in-law's business, Saman contacted Kashf Foundation and has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR. He intends to use this loan amount to build a shed roof for the hens and to purchase feed for them.

loans.use: to build a shed roof for the hens and to purchase feed for them.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is thirty-one years old and lives in the village of Mundri in the Western Equatoria state region of South Sudan. She is married and has four children. For the past two years, she has been growing sorghum, which she sells in the market. She is requesting a loan of 800 SSP to buy more seeds.

loans.use: To buy more seeds

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is forty-nine years old and married. She runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices and after making embroidery patterns, she sells them in her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Naseem has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently. This will allow her to increase her net income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread

loans.name: Amber

texts.en: Amber is a thirty-six-year-old married woman with three children. The man shown in the photo is her husband. After she married, she felt that she should help her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business of clothes sales in her locality. Amber believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. She is well-known among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Amber has taken out a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase good-quality clothes in different colors to increase sales and earn substantial profits. This will lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality clothes in different colors

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is a 25-year-old married man; he has two nice kids. He loves his family a lot,  and tries to provide perfectly for them.

Vusal works in a shop as a seller.  His monthly income is 120 manat.

Vassal’s children‘s are little, so he needs much money to cover the family’s problems.

Also, he has a fruit garden. Vusal grows trees there. But there is a water problem in Agsu.

He wants to buy a water pump to irrigate his land. If he realizes his plan, he will get more crops in this business. He applies for 1,000 AZN from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate his land

loans.name: Minaya

texts.en: Minaya is married and has three children studying at university. She loves her children and is proud of them. She lives in the Baku region of Azerbaijan with her lovely family. Minaya has a few cows and she has been in the animal breeding business for 10 years. She makes dairy products (like cheese and yoghurt) that she sells at the local bazaar and to her neighbors. Today, she needs 2,300 Azerbaijan manats (AZN) so she can repair one of her cow stalls, which is broken and dangerous. She is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for their help. In the future she wants to help her children to get married.

loans.use: to repair a cow stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dishes, such as bowls, plates, and glasses to resell

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with three children and two go to school. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. 

Teddy has requested a loan of 100,000 from MCDT– SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. 

Her major challenges includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy land to start planting green bananas. 

She lives in rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 16 years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor running water.

Mesalimu has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces the major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With this loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) that she is requesting, Mesalimu wants to buy stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.fr: Mawazo est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Umoja ni Nguvu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un Chauffeur, âgée de 32 ans, mère 7 enfants, tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés dans un marché secondaire de la ville depuis 14 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en poissons. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, construire une maison et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mawazo is a merchant, the president of the Umoja ni Nguvu loan group, and a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is 32 years old, married to a driver, and a mother of seven children, who all go to school. 

Mawazo has sold salted fish in a secondary market in town for 14 years old. She started this business with funds she received from her husband.

Mawazo wishes to increase her revenue, build a house, and educate her children. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support to entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to procure fish

loans.name: Areknaz

texts.en:
Areknaz, 45, is a married woman from the village of Giulbakhi. She lives with her husband and 2 sons. The family generates income from s small agribusiness. In particular, they have pigs, and they also cultivate a plot of agricultural land and harvest fruits and vegetables. Areknaz works at the local public school, where she makes a 380 GEL monthly salary. To make the work more profitable, Areknaz decided to start trading sunflowers. 

She needs financial support to purchase special equipment for processing the sunflowers, which she can then sell at the local market. 

Areknaz has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Thank you Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start trading with sunflower and generate private income

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Vive en una comunidad que se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como carneros, patos y pollos. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de maíz y caña de azúcar. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. De esta manera Norma espera tener mayores niveles de venta y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 36 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She and her husband own a house, where they live with their children. It is located in the Zaña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru. Commerce, agriculture and animal farming are the locals’ main economic activities.

She raises and sells small farm animals, such as sheep, ducks and chickens. She also grows corn and sugar cane. She is experienced and has very good personal and professional references.

With this loan, she wants to buy more animals and feed for them. This is how Norma thinks she will increase her sales and income, which will help her to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Nancy Evella

texts.es:
Nancy Evella tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, pollos, cerdos, etc. su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales como cerdos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ventas y por ende le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy Evella is 34 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and son in the Oyotún district, located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru. Life is calm in this district and locals work mainly in agriculture, commerce and animal farming.

She raises and sells animals at home, such as ducks, hens, chickens, and pigs. She has worked with this for more than five years and has very good personal and professional references.

Nancy is requesting a loan to buy more animals, such as pigs, hens, ducks, and turkeys. With this investment, she will have a more productive business and a wider variety of animals, which will have a positive impact on her business. She will now have more animals to fulfill her customers’ demands and needs, which will help her to increase her sales and thus to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as pigs, hens, ducks, and turkeys.

loans.name: Mulangane Group

texts.fr: M'nabuloho est commerçante, membre du collectif d’affaires «Mulangane», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un enseignant, âgée de 32 ans, mère 8 enfants dont 4 étudient et 4 sont encore petits. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu par crédit dans une institution de la place. Elle est vendeuse de la braise à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 3 sacs de braises. Elle  souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: M'nabuloho is a trader, member of the business group "Mulangane", a client of IMF Hekima.  She is married to a teacher, aged 32, mother of 8 children of whom 4 are studying and 4 are still small.  She started her business with capital obtained as a loan from a commercial institution.  She has been selling charcoal from her home in a busy avenue of the town for 4 years. She is going to stock up with 3 sacks of charcoal.  She wishes to grow her business, educate and feed her children.  Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support given to entrepreneurs without recourse to banks.

loans.use: to stock up with 3 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Leticia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Leticia Elizabeth tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito La Matanza, ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora (bebida tradicional de la región). Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves como gallinas, patos y pavos. Cuenta con más de 1 año de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de maíz con el que elabora la chica de jora, así como para la compra de materiales como baldes y ollas para la elaboración de esta bebida, con esto Leticia Elizabeth espera ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leticia Elizabeth is 20 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and children in the La Matanza district, which is located in the Morropón province, Piura region of the northern coast of Peru. Life is calm in this district. Commerce, agriculture and animal farming are the locals’ main economic activities.

Leticia works making and selling chicha de jora (a regional traditional beverage). She also raises and sells animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys. She has been working with this for more than a year and has very good personal and professional references.

She is requesting a loan to buy more corn, and utensils such as buckets and pots to make chicha de jora. Leticia Elizabeth hopes that this investment will help her to offer her customers a better product, which will help her to increase her income and thus improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more corn, and utensils such as buckets and pots to prepare chicha de jora (a traditional beverage).

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana, de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato general, es acompañada y su pareja es sargento en la tercera brigada de infantería, tienen 1 niña de un mes, actualmente en su casa solo viven ellos tres y la única que depende de ella es su hija.

Diana, se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios como militar desde hace tres años, ella decidió dedicarse a esta labor ya que su situación económica no era la mejor, antes se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos y a atender a su esposo, ella recorre una distancia considerable hasta su trabajo, su medio de transporte es en bus y se tarda hora y media para llegar. Su pareja también se destaca como sargento en la tercera brigada de infantería, su horario es de lunes a domingo.

Diana, necesita el crédito para complementará el monto total por el cual está valorada la vivienda que adquirirá, el crédito mejorara la calidad de vida para su familia ya que contará con casa propia.
 
Los sueños de Diana son, montar un negocio con productos de granos básicos, para poder brindarle ese servicio a la comunidad donde ella reside, además de ello pretende estudiar un diplomado en cosmetología para poder obtener más y mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Diana is 28 years old and received her general high school education. She is in a relationship and her partner is a sergeant in the third infantry brigade. They have a one-month-old daughter. The three of them currently live alone in their house. Her daughter is the only one who is a dependent.

Diana has been providing her services to the military for the past three years. She decided to pursue this line of work because her financial situation was not the best. Diana previously spent her time working housekeeping jobs and taking care of her husband. She travels by bus and it takes her an hour and half to get to work. Her partner achieved the rank of sergeant in the third infantry brigade. Diana’s work schedule is Monday through Sunday.

She needs a loan in order to reach the total amount needed for the home she will acquire. This loan will improve her family’s quality of life since they will be able to get a house of their own.

Diana dreams of opening a business where she can sell basic grains so that she can provide this service in the community where she lives. In addition, she intends to study for a diploma in cosmetology so that she can earn more income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to supplement her existing funds so that she can purchase a house.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Yenny pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
 La socia continua dedicándose a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, la socia Yenny está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y en la educación de su único hijo ,la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas, polos entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Yenny is a member of the Communal Bank “Kanchary” which is in the city of Cusco, Peru. She continues to sell clothes for women, men, and children. Yenny is extremely grateful for Kiva’s assistance since it has helped her to strengthen her business, provide a better quality of life for her family, and pay for her only child’s education. Yenny continues to sell merchandise to customers who request her products. These people include friends, relatives, and other individuals.

Yenny is a responsible and industrious person who works in this manner so that she can help her family move forward. She is requesting a loan in order to buy sweaters, pullover shirts, and other products.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, pullover shirts, and other products.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo tiene 23 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos. Adicionalmente trabaja como jornalero agrícola por zona de residencia y alrededores. Cuenta con más de 03 años de experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El presente crédito será para la compra de cemento, madera y pintura para realizar reparaciones y mejoras en su vivienda que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, esto le permitirá a Juan Pablo vivir con una mayor comodidad lo que incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is 23 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their 2 children in the district of Oyotún, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. Life in this district is calm, and the people make a living mainly in the areas of agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Juan Pablo makes a living raising and selling pigs. Additionally, he works as an agricultural day laborer in residential and surrounding areas. He has more than 3 years experience in this business, and he has regular customers that give very good recommendations of him and his work. This loan will be used to buy cement, lumber, and paint to make repairs and improvements to his home, which is currently in bad condition. This will enable Juan Pablo to live more comfortably, which will increase the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, lumber, and paint to make repairs and improvements to his home, which is currently in bad condition.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria runs a services business providing business development and career coaching in Florida. The business has been in operation for three years and was originally started in Michigan. Victoria says the main challenges faced are limited funding opportunities that allow her to grow. She says, "I am successful when I am leading clients to discover their passions for starting their own businesses and meeting their business development goals.”
Victoria is the sole employee. 

Victoria has requested a loan "to increase the capacity for my company to market my services." This involves developing a new website, increasing marketing to target clients, and membership in professional organizations. She says this loan will allow her business to grow and better serve a diverse set of client needs. Victoria says, "My vision for my personal future is to impact people's lives through my business. I have seen people go from unemployed to employed to employing others because they made their dream a reality." She is a first-time Accion East client.	

You can see her website here: www.jirehbusinessconsulting.org

loans.use: to market her services through website development and to start a company podcast

loans.name: Hernan  Benigno

texts.es:
Hernan Benigno tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es muy pasiva y tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros. Cuenta con más de 1 año de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar su negocio así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor número de animales a sus clientes satisfaciendo de esta manera sus gustos y necesidades, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hernan Benigno is 22 years old, single, and lives with his family in a rural area in the district of Cayaltí, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. Life in this district is very calm and quiet, and the people make a living mainly in the areas of agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Hernan makes a living raising and selling young animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, and guinea pigs, among others. He has more than 1 year of experience in this business, and he has very good personal and professional recommendations in his community. 

Hernan is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of animals to expand his business, as well as to buy nutritional food for them. This investment will help him be able to take care of his customers, by meeting their needs and satisfying their preferences with a larger number of animals. This will enable him to earn more income, and thus improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals to expand his business as well as to buy nutritional food for them.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 29 years old. She is married with two children aged 6 and 8 years; both of them go to school. She has a shop and has been in a business for two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice and lotions to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and lotions to resell.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is a 31-year-old married male with two children. He has a special hire vehicle that generates income for his family. He earns a salary as well to boost his income. He wishes to educate his children to higher levels of learning, however he is challenged by high taxes and fuel costs that affect his returns in the future. 

He wants a credit facility (loan) to buy a plot for settlement.

loans.use: to buy a plot for settlement.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila is 55, and she does agriculture/livestock and operates a little variety store in the village of residence. She is a mother of four, with the youngest one being 18 years of age. The reason why she is applying for this loan is because she wants to buy a milk cow and stock up on inventory items for the grocery store. 

Currently, Dila has two dairy cows and a heifer, and sells raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. She also owns 18 dynym of agricultural land, where she plants corn in 4 dynym, beans in 2 dynym and veggies and fodder in the rest of it. In addition, she has 30 chickens and sells the eggs in her store. While she is doing so much, according to her, her husband also offers services with the tractor he owns.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and stock up on inventory items for the family-operated variety store

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
22 mujeres decidieron unirse para poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Maria es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer que se destaca por su entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante, está esforzándose para que cada día le vaya mejor en el pequeño copetín que tiene, y el cual es sostén de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para elaboración de comestibles que ella hace y que vende en su humilde copetín. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
There are 22 women who decided to join together so that they could work as a team and provide everything for their families that they were not able to have. They are participating in the poverty elimination program so that they can overcome their poverty situation.

Maria is the president of this group. She is a woman who is known for her enthusiasm and her drive to succeed. Maria strives to do her best each day at the small snack bar that she owns. This business allows her to support her family.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies for preparing the food that she sells from her modest snack bar. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received to improve her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing the various foods that she sells.

loans.name: Edilfredo

texts.es:
Edilfredo es casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad tranquila con clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad hace 05 años y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con esto Edilfredo espera brindar un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de ventas y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edilfredo is married. He lives with his wife and child in the District of Callayuc, a peaceful community that has a varied climate. The residents engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. The community is located in Cutervo Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Edilfredo is a farmer who grows primarily coffee. He has been in this business for five years and has many good personal and work-related references who are from this area. His current loan will be used to purchase compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his coffee crop. With this loan, Edilfredo will be able to provide a product of better quality to his customers. As a result, his level of sales will improve and he can achieve a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Jolie

texts.en:
Jolie is 29 years old. She is married with two children aged 1 and 2 years; they do not yet go to school. She sells shoes and has been in a business for three years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Arcadio

texts.es:
Arcadio tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en la provincia de Callayuc, ubicado en la región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Arcadio espera mejorar la productividad de su cultivo de café y ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Arcadio is 44 years old, married, and lives with his spouse and their 4 children in the province of Callayuc, which is located in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. The people in this area make a living primarily in the areas of agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Arcadio makes a living in agriculture, more specifically in the cultivation of coffee beans. He has more than 10 years experience in this business, and he has very good personal and professional recommendations in his community.

The loan will be used to buy organic fertilizers and other fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop as well as to pay for labor costs during harvest season. Arcadio hopes to improve the productivity of his coffee crop, and offer a better product to his customers. This will enable him to earn more income, and thus improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and other fertilizers to  maintain his coffee crop, as well as to pay for labor costs during harvest season.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been in produce selling since 2000 and does farming, where he earns his income. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda, and is married. He is hardworking and desires to grow his business, though he is faced with a hardship of price fluctuations hindering his returns. 

Stephen is asking for credit to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Luvano

texts.en:
Luvano is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of people taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in Skuri, Tsalenjikha district. They don't have any significant income for existence. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category and lives under poverty. The family members get social assistance from the local government. Apart from this, they have a small agricultural activity. 

Sopio decided to rent out their one room to generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,600 GEL. With the received credit, she will renovate the room to rent it out. This will give the family a chance to generate income and make better living conditions for their three children.

loans.use: to renovate one room and rent it out in order ro generate income

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian es una persona dedicada a su trabajo y a sus estudios, pretende lograr su objetivo con ayuda de la Fundación Paraguaya, con esta oportunidad que recibe. Sus padres se dedican a la confección de calzados de cuero, y por medio de este trabajo ayudan a Fabian.
Aspira a seguir desarrollando sus conocimientos a través del estudio y acceder a un campo laboral que le sea sustentable.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y gastos de titulación, para poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fabian is a person who is dedicated to his work and his studies. He intends to achieve his goal with the help of Fundación Paraguaya with this opportunity that he is receiving. His parents work making leather shoes and through this work they help Fabian.

He aspires to continue developing through his education and accessing a field of work that will be sustainable for him. He is asking for his loan to pay for his tuition and for costs to get his degree so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition and costs to get his degree.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es estudiante de la carrera  de Contabilidad, a la vez que estudia también esta trabajando, y de esta forma esta esforzándose para poder cumplir con su meta de ser una profesional exitosa.
Le gustaría graduarse, montar una oficina y aumentar sus  ingresos, para ayudar a su familia, y retribuirles todo lo que dieron por ella.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la cuota de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Laura is a student and her major is Accounting. While she is studying, she also works, and in this way she is striving to be able to achieve her goal of being a successful professional.  

She would like to graduate, open an office and increase her income so that she can help her family and repay them for all that they have done for her. She is asking for this loan to invest in in paying for college tuition so that she can continue with her education.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita  se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de pollos , la socia los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita continues to manage her business of raising chickens. The chickens are fattened and cared for before they are sold at different markets. Margarita has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell chickens.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens and feed for these birds. Margarita is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Ngama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis Mai 2007,il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles sont solidairement liées et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Sira qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 38 ans et mére de 02 filles et trois garçons.

Son activité est le petit commerce de sucre,de savons,de bouillon jumbo et des tiges de rôniers.

Elle compte acheter avec l'argent du crédit:02 sacs de 50kg de sucre à 20000f le sac,10 cartons de savon artisanal pour 50000f et 10 paquets de bouillon jumbo pour une somme de 12000f et le reste pour acheter des tiges de rôniers.

Son objectif est de participer à la dépense quotidienne et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2007 and is composed of members who live in the same village. They are joined by bonds of solidarity and do small-scale commerce. 

Sira, who is on the right in the photo raising her arm, is the leader of the group. She is married, aged 38, and the mother of two daughters and three sons. Her business is small-scale sales of sugar, soap, Jumbo bouillon cubes, and palm fronds for weaving.  

She intends to use the loan amount to buy: two sacks of 50 kg of sugar at 20,000 francs per sack, 10 cases of locally-made soap for 50,000 francs, and 10 packs of Jumbo bouillon cubes for the sum of 12,000 francs, using the remainder to buy palm fronds for weaving. 

Her goal is to help cover daily expenses and grow her savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, Jumbo bouillon cubes, and palm fronds for weaving.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONEI ,la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de carne , la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo en uno de los mercados de la ciudad, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carne.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the COMUZONEI communal bank. She continues to work in the business of selling meat. She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her scheduled payments. The borrower continues to sell in one of the city markets, and she wants to be able to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family.    

She is asking for the loan to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Presiñano

texts.es:
Presiñano tiene 56 años años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como carneros, patos y gallinas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como carneros, gallinas, pavos, entre otros así como para la compra de alimento para la crianza de los mismos, de esta manera Presiñano espera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Presiñano is 56 years old, is married and lives with his wife and children in their own home in the district of Cayaltí, located in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in the north coast of Perú.  The life in this district is calm and the population works mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle.
He works in animal husbandry and sale of rams, ducks, and hens.  His business is located in his house.  He has more than 10 years of experience and has very good personal and working references in the zone.  
The current loan will be used for buying more animals including rams, hens, turkeys, among others, as well as feed for them.  In this way Presiñano hopes to grow his business, obtain greater income, and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals including rams, hens, turkeys, among others, as well as feed for them.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 31 years old. He is not married. He sells foodstuffs and has been in a business for two years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more Irish potatoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte del Perú. En la comunidad los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la crianza de ganado, comercio en general y a la siembra de arroz.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos y bebidas, la venta la realiza en su propio domicilio lo cual le ayuda a generar más beneficios ya que no cancela alquiler. Cuenta con muchos años de experiencia en el rubro y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo será para comprar más mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, para surtir su negocio, con esto Bernarda espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 39 years old and lives with her partner and three young children in the province of Morropón, region Piura in the north coast of Peru.  The people in the community work mainly in animal husbandry, general commerce, and sowing rice.  
She works selling groceries like rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and drinks.  She sells the groceries from her house which helps her generate more benefits since she doesn't have to pay rent for her business.  She has many years of experience at the job and has fixed clients which give very good personal and working references of her.  
The loan will be to buy more groceries like rice, sugar, oil, among others to stock her business.  With this Bernarda hopes to offer a greater variety of products to her clients which will increase her sales and hence her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like rice, sugar, oil, among others to stock her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of people taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase more goats for resale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for meat resale

loans.name: Isak

texts.en:
The client Isak is 27 years old, married and has two sons. In order to earn a living he works as a master for a water supply company. He installs water inside the house, and removes, repairs and remodels anything involving water installation and sanitation. 

Currently, he works at a private company with a salary, but also is able to do contract work after his work hours for additional income. He is very busy with client demands and works from early morning until late at night. 

From the many years of work and the long hours, his equipment is old and worn out. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase new tools and equipment to make his job easier and better. His goal is to one day own his own company for water installation and supply, and he is very optimistic he will be successful in achieving that goal. 

Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment to make his job easier and better

loans.name: Heidy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Soñar no cuesta nada, y alcanzar los sueños tampoco, solo es cuestión de ser optimista y proponerse metas. Heidy es una mujer entusiasta y trabajadora, es madre de tres hijos y su esposo es de quien únicamente recibe apoyo. Desde hace 4 años es dueña de una pequeña pulpería, en un principio inicio vendiendo dulces y botanas en su casa,  ahora ofrece otros productos, entre ellos, granos básicos y productos de uso personal. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos y productos de higiene personal y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos  a sus clientes.  Heidy sueña en un futuro con ampliar su negocio y llegar a tener una gran distribuidora y  de esta forma seguir luchando por una economía mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Dreams don't come with a price tag, and making them come true doesn't either; it's just a matter of thinking positively and setting goals for oneself. Heidy is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman with three children and a husband from whom she gets her only support. She's owned a small grocery store for the past four years. At first she started out selling candy and snacks from her house and now she offers other products like basic food items and personal care products.

Heidy is asking for a loan to buy basic foods and personal care products so that she can offer a wider selection of products to her customers. She dreams of expanding her business and eventually becoming a distributor so that she can continue to work towards improving her and her family's economic situation.

loans.use: Buy basic foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a married woman and has been blessed with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mary operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mary dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her  business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
This is Bardhe (or ‘white’ in English) and Kastriot, her husband; they are in their 40s and have two children, a 20-year-old daughter who is studying in university and an 18-year-old son who is finishing his high school this year. 

As may be understood from the photo, they have been photographed inside a variety type of store that Bardhe is operating. They also have a movable booth. Kastriot worked in the neighbor country of Greece up until last Christmas when he came back to the home country for good, due to the fact that he did not have a stable job anymore. 

They are applying for this loan to stock up on inventory items for their store.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for their store

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana se esta esforzando mucho para poder cumplir su meta de ser una buena psicóloga, comenta que su préstamo anterior de kiva le fue de mucha ayuda, ya que con el pudo cubrir el pago de las cuotas de su carrera. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora, que a la vez que estudia esta trabajando.
Pide de nuevo este préstamo para poder invertirlo en nuevamente en el pago de las cuotas, agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Liliana is making a big effort to meet her goal of becoming a good psychologist.  She mentions that her previous loan from Kiva was very helpful because she was able to pay her college fees.  She's a fighter and makes sacrifices since she's also working while she studies.  
She's requesting a new loan to invest it in the payment of her university fees again.  She's grateful of this new opportunity to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONEI, el socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de artesanía, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, el socio continua vendiendo collares, pulseras entre otros, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de anillos entre otros.
texts.en:
Julio belongs to the communal bank Comuzonei.  He continues making a living selling handicrafts.  He feels grateful for the loan granted to him and he is committed to paying his established installments.  

He continues selling necklaces and bracelets, among other things.  He has been in this business a good amount of time and it is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into it every day.  He wants to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting his family. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase rings, among other things.

loans.use: to purchase rings, among other things.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a  married man. He describes himself as determined and focused. He operates a transport business where he transports clients using a tuk tuk. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area. and his primary customers are commuters. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the traffic on the roads.

Now he wants to venture into selling tuk tuk and motorcycle spare parts.  He will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase spare parts for tuk tuks and motorcycles and resell them. 

His business goal is to own a wholesale distribution within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for tuk tuks and motorcycles to resell.

loans.name: Hayda Azucena

texts.es:
El emprendedurismo y las ganas de seguir adelante es lo que impulsa a Hayda, una comerciante de 37 años, a luchar junto a su esposo por un futuro más próspero para su familia. Ella, antes era ama de casa, luego vendió cosméticos y frutas, pero desde hace 13 meses se dedica a la producción y comercialización de lavanderos. Esta idea nace porque su conyugue a través de su antiguo empleo conoció de la rentabilidad de este negocio, a él le gusto, ambos platicaron y ella decidió solicitar un primer préstamo para iniciar a desarrollar la idea. 
Hayda solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción cómo cemento, arena y alambres para elaborar lavanderos, cocinas, pilas de agua, etc. La meta de esta mujer trabajadora es invertir más en su negocio para que esté crezca aún más.  Así mismo, Hayda piensa a futuro poder optar a otro crédito para comprar un camión que le ayude a transportar a diferentes lugares los productos que vende.
texts.en:
An entrepreneurial spirit and desire to get ahead is what drives Hayda, a 37-year-old merchant, to struggle, along with her husband, for a more prosperous future for the family. She was a housewife, then she sold cosmetics and fruit, but for the last 13 months, she has dedicated herself to producing and commercializing laundry sinks. The idea came up because her husband, whose previous employment had shown him the profitability of this business, liked the idea. They discussed it and she decided to request a first loan to initiate and develop their idea.

Hayda is soliciting this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, and wire to make laundry and kitchen sinks, water tanks, etc. This working woman's goal is to invest more money in her business so that it can grow even more. At the same time, Hayda is thinking of the future possibility of another loan to purchase a truck to aid in transporting the products she sells to different locations.

loans.use: buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and wire.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman living with her husband and two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seventeen years, Mupa has operated a charcoal sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village.
