Mupa wants to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is 31 years old and single. She has operated a market for 1 year. Dativa would like to use this loan to buy more milk, sugar and juice to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more milk, sugar and juice to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Eudes

texts.en:
Eudes is a single man who lives with his mother. The family house has only 2 rooms so it is uncomfortable. 

Eudes is a mason and he has worked in this business for many years. Eudes wants to be a farmer so he needs a loan to buy seeds.  He wants to plant flowers. Eudes will plant the seeds on his sister's land.

Eudes dreams to have his own house and his own land.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es estudiante de la carrera de licenciatura en ciencias de la educación, ella esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder terminar su carrera y ser una profesional útil a la sociedad. Es una mujer muy luchadora, y comenta que en su anterior préstamo de kiva lo pudo invertir en el pago de sus gastos de transporte.
Hoy pide de nuevo ese préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Laura is a student who is pursuing a degree in Educational Sciences. She is doing her best to finish her degree so that she can become a useful professional in society. Laura is a very determined woman. She says that her previous Kiva loan was invested in the payment of her transportation expenses.

Today she is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in the payment of her degree fees. This will enable her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, el socio sigue dedicándose a ejercer su carrera, de  contador , el socio lleva buen tiempo ejerciendo su carrera el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para los estudios de su hija.
texts.en:
Felix belongs to the communal bank Comuzone I. He continues to work in his job as an accountant, which he has been doing for a long time. It is going well, thanks to the determination he brings to his work every day. He wants to continue working, so that he can continue to support his family.
Felix is requesting the loan to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi, son de una zona rural, aun en crecimiento, todas luchan por mejor ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
La Sra. Ramona es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la cría y venta o faena de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, patos y otros, y con este trabajo lucha por poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de animales de corral para la cría, como ser gallinas y cerdos. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder crecer.
texts.en:
La Esperanza is a group formed in the city of Villa Ygatimi. It is a rural zone still growing. All the members are struggling to improve their living conditions and that of their families.

Ramona is one of the members. She works raising and selling farm animals like chickens and pigs. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow.

loans.use: to buy farm animals to sell like chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
Reinerio tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pimpingos, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Su población se dedica principalmente al comercio de ganado vacuno, cultivo de café y frutales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Su esposa le apoya en esta labor preparando los alimentos para los jornaleros que realizan las actividades que requiere el cultivo de café. Ha solicitado un préstamo para dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café mediante las deshierbas, abonamiento y control fitosanitario para obtener una producción de calidad y de esta manera venderlo a un buen precio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reinerio is 29 years old and lives with his partner. They own a home of rustic materials located in the Pimpingos district of the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. The people of the region work mainly selling cattle, growing coffee and fruit crops. 

He makes a living working in agriculture, especially growing the catimore coffee variety. He has more than 3 years of experience in this business and has good personal and work references in the area. His wife supports him by preparing food for the day laborers that perform the work required for growing coffee.

He is requesting this loan to maintain his coffee fields, to clean the fields of weeds, fertilize them and have phytosanitary control to obtain a quality crop. This way he can sell to his customers at a good price which will allow him to increase his revenue and therefore improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee fields by cleaning the fields of weeds, fertilizing them and for phytosanitary control.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is married and has 3 children whose ages range from 1 to 6 years old. He describes himself as determined and focused. For the past 3 years, Victor has operated a motorcycle business, transporting customers by motorcycle. His business is located in a busy area. and his primary customers are regular commuters and visitors in the town. Victor describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Victor will use the KES 20,000 loan to service his current motorcycle. His business goal is to to own his own taxi car within 5 years. This is Victor's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service his current motorcycle.

loans.name: Ruth Esther

texts.es:
Ruth es una joven entusiasta y perseverante; alcanzar el éxito para ella es superar cada obstáculo al que se enfrenta.  Ruth cursa el último año de Administración de empresas y  estudia esta carrera porque hay muchas oportunidades de empleo. Trabaja cómo auxiliar contable y de esta forma ayuda a sus hermanos y madre, quien es costurera; todos ellos son su apoyo y es por quienes ella quiere superarse. 
El crédito que solicita Ruth le ayudará a poder culminar con sus estudios y de esta forma lo necesita para poder elaborar su tesis, pagar un tutor, y costear las impresiones de los ejemplares de su investigación bibliográfica. Además con este crédito, dice se sentirá contenta y realizada ya que logrará tener un aumento salarial en  su  trabajo al poder obtener su título de licenciada. El que persevera alcanza dice un refrán popular, por ello, las metas de Ruth son tener su título y seguir estudiando, sus planes a futuro son buscar un mejor empleo y optar por una maestría.
texts.en:
Ruth is an enthusiastic and persistent young woman.  For her, obtaining success is being able to overcome any obstacle she faces.  Ruth is in her last year of business administration.  She's studying this profession because there are a lot of job opportunities.  She works as an assistant accountant and in this way she helps her brothers and her mother who works as a seamstress.  
Ruth is requesting this loan to help her finish her degree by writing her thesis, paying for a tutor, and for the printed copies of her bibliographic research.  Additionally, with this loan she'll feel very happy and realized since she will get a raise once she obtains her license.  
He who perseveres triumphs, according to the popular saying, that's why Ruth's goals are to obtain her title and keep studying to find a better job and complete a masters degree.

loans.use: to write her thesis, pay for a tutor, and the printed copies of her bibliographic research.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a brilliant and resilient smallholder mixed-farmer from Kibulot, located in South Rift, Kenya. Even at his young age, he is still the caring family man who is committed to his wife. For the past five years, the couple's primary income sources have been milk, eggs, crops and transportation services. 

Hillary is seeking a loan to purchase a piece of land. He wants to scale up his farm and move his farming to another level. Through this loan he will be able to expand his farming and be able to grow more crops which will translate to more profits. His cow will have a larger grazing land and he will have room to build a modern dairy unit. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Hillary replied, "My family will get food and more income and thus better living."

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Vahasukore Group

texts.en:
VAHASUKORE is a group led by Donatille, who is 51 years old. The group name means “Work hard” in English. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives.

Donatille has been a group leader for 8 years, the length of time she has been in business, selling foodstuffs.  She would like to use this loan to buy more sorghum and rice to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and rice to resell.

loans.name: Bukurie

texts.en:
Bukurie is 50 and the mother of a 26-year-old. She is applying for this loan to build a fence around her yard, where she plants seasonal veggies, has grapevines, fig and plum orchards, and also keep a sow and 15 chickens for personal family needs.

Bukurie works for the city as a janitor with pay of $220/month. Fatmir, her husband, who is in the photograph with her, does not have a job at the moment. His retiree mother, who lives with them, contributes her pension of $138/month. Their son works as well for very little pay–not enough to contribute much to the family.

loans.use: to build a fence around her home yard so that uninvited guests such as animals do not trespass

loans.name: Hortencia Jeaneth

texts.es:
Hortencia  es una mujer  ecuatoriana de 39 años de edad de nacionalidad ecuatoriana  que ha culminado sus estudios primarios gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de sus padres, actualmente se encuentra soltera y vive en la casa de sus padrinos, vive ahí junto con hijo, desde hace muchos años en un sector llamado San Marcos, lugar muy reconocido porque la gente ahí se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, y Hortencia también se dedica a esta actividad, esta profesión  la aprendió de su padre, para así poder sustentar sus necesidades.
Llego a Fundación por recomendación de un vecino beneficiado, solicita un crédito para comprar más cerdos , y obtener mejores resultados.
Agradece a Kiva y a Fundacion por la ayuda que se le ha brindado para asi mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hortencia is an Ecuadorian woman who is 39 years old and who completed her primary school studies thanks to the efforts and sacrifices of her parents.

She is currently unmarried and for many years has been living in her godparents' house together with her son. They live in an area called San Marcos, a place that is well-known because the people there raise and sell small animals. Hortencia does this, too, and she learned the trade from her father so that she could become self-sufficient. 

She has come to Fundación at the recommendation of a neighbor who has benefitted from the organization. She is asking for a loan so she can buy more pigs and improve her results. She is grateful to Kiva and to Fundación for the assistance they are providing, enabling her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, grow her business, and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Erin And Steven

texts.en:
A mother of three, Erin has been practicing massage and holistic health care for more than a decade. She received her certification in 2002 and worked in several chiropractic offices and day spas, until she decided to open her own practice so that she could become her own boss and provide for her family.

Steven, her husband, just recently got into the massage therapy industry. He had been a retail manager for many years, but found that he was not being challenged enough and had reached a ceiling with his professional development. In 2012, after consulting with his wife, he decided to pursue massage therapy and completed his schooling. It was then that he knew that massage therapy and natural medicine was his calling. After putting in enough hours to build a small clientele, they decided it would be beneficial for them to work together as a husband-and-wife team.

“We love working together, and soon Steven’s sister will join our business,” stated Erin. “We are truly a family business working hard to provide a wonderful life for our children.”

Erin and Steven will use their Kiva loan to purchase new signage and equipment for their business. They are excited to build up their clientele and help people through natural healing and alternative medicine. They plan to give back to organizations that help veterans through massage and hope to expand to a larger space soon.

loans.use: to purchase new signage and equipment for their business.

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en:
Nine years ago, when Valbona was 32 years old, she lost her husband in an accident. Their children were 13 and 10 years old at the time and Valbona struggled to raise them. However, the Catholic church in their vicinity stepped in and helped the family out; they also provided Valbona with a cleaning job in the church. She earns about $150/month.

Valbona has three dynym (3,000 square meters) of agricultural land; in two dynyms, she planted olive groves about five years ago and on the remaining land, she now plants potatoes. The price of olives is about $1.20/kg. Valbona sells olives and potatoes and sometimes she sells eggs from her chickens. Valbona is requesting this loan to prepare the land for planting potatoes, to buy seeds and to build a fence around the house.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting potatoes and to build a fence around the house

loans.name: Jimena

texts.en:
Jimena is 25 years old. She has two kids: one is 3 years old and the other one is 4 years old. Jimena is married and her husband is a mason. 

Jimena sells potatoes from Tuesday to Sunday. She wakes up very early (exactly 5:00 a.m.). Jimena has been selling potatoes for one year. She wants to build a room at her house. She needs to buy bricks and cement. Jimena hopes she can finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to build a room

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Yesenia, la socia pertenece al banco comunal KANCHARY,la socia  continua dedicándose a la actividad de cosmetóloga en su salón de belleza, la socia Yesenia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y educar a sus hijos, la socia continua realizando cortes, tientes entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan para sus distintos compromisos, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, tijeras, secadoras entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Yesenia is a member of the Communal Bank “Kanchary”. She continues to work in cosmetology at her beauty salon. Yesenia is extremely grateful for Kiva’s assistance because it has helped her to strengthen her business, provide a better quality of life for her family, and pay for her children’s education. She continues to provide haircuts, hair coloring, and other services to her clients who request to have them done for various events. By working in this manner, she is able to help her family get ahead.

Yesenia is requesting a loan in order to buy dyes, scissors, dryers, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, dryers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ridber

texts.en: Ridber, 22 years old, is single and pays rent. He sells cellphone cards (used to make calls), travelling around the entire city of La Paz with his merchandise. Ridber needs a loan to buy more cellphone cards. His parents are divorced and Ridber has to take care of his two little  brothers Ridber hopes he can go to college and he expects you can help him. In the picture, Ridber is at a grocery store where he sells his cellphone cards

loans.use: to buy more cellphone cards

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
Arminda is 33 years old. She is a widow and has two kids. The family has their own house.

Arminda makes cheese every day, and she feeds her cattle. She needs a loan to buy cattle. She wants to sell more cheese at local fairs. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. They help her with the food. Maria makes cheese starting at 6:00 a.m., and she feeds her cattle.

Maria needs a loan to buy more cattle because she wants to increase her cheese production.

Maria loves her parents very much, but she hopes she can get her own place.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 41 years old. She is a widow and has two kids. The family has their own house.

Basilia sacrifices a lot to make cheese, and her sons help her. She wants a loan to buy cattle.

She hopes she can hire a couple of employees so her sons will have all the time to study.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Ana Bel

texts.es:
Dar y  servir a los demás, sin medida, es lo que le produce felicidad a Ana Bel y es por esta razón que estudia Tecnología médica, para ayudar a mejorar la salud de las personas. Está joven de 31 años, cursa el último año de su carrera universitaria. Su único apoyo es su esposo, con el cual tiene 3 hijos, a los cuales, según ella, les aconsejan que se eduquen puesto que esto es importante para el futuro de toda persona.  
Ana Bel solicita el crédito para el pago de los últimos módulos de su carrera, ya que esté le ayudará a culminar sus estudios con mayor facilidad. Las metas a corto plazo de Ana Bel son las de realizar su servicio social para colaborar en la mejora de la salud de los demás. Los planes futuros de ella son incorporarse a trabajar en el ministerio de salud de su comunidad para servir a los demás.
texts.en:
To give and to serve others freely is what makes Ana Bel happy.  This is the reason that she is studying medical technology, to help improve people’s health.  She is a 31-year-old, young woman in the last year of her university education.  Her sole support is her husband, with whom she has three children.  According to her, they advise their children to become educated since this is important for everyone's future. 

Ana Bel is requesting a loan to pay for the last courses of her university studies, as this will help her finish her studies more easily.  Ana Bel’s short-term goals are to provide a social service that contributes to the improvement of the health of others.  Her future planes are to start to work in her community's ministry of health to serve others.

loans.use: to pay for the last courses of her university studies.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in produce selling, operates a bar, and does farming for income generation.

He has great hopes of prosperity, and he is working hard towards it. David is challenged by high price fluctuation, causing instabilities in returns.

He is asking for a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Una década celebra Ana María desde que puso su pulpería.  Y es que son diez años llenos de prosperidad, donde la evolución es notoria, porque ya no es solo una tienda de abarrotes sino que también en ella se puede encontrar todo tipo de productos como lencerías, perfumes y demás cosas personales. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y la fidelidad de sus clientes.  

Ana María no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad de crecimiento, ahora con este financiamiento podrá surtir con más productos la pulpería y comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, pan entre otros, para así cubrir  la creciente demanda de su clientela, que cada día buscan más productos. Sin duda, es un negocio seguro y próspero, porque de sus ganancias, esta trabajadora mujer, pudo construir su casa y hasta hacer una habitación para alquilar.
texts.en:
Ana María is celebrating one decade of having opened her small store. And these are 10 years full of prosperity where her evolution is evident as now it is not only a grocery store but also one where you can find all types of products like lingerie, perfumes and other personal items.

Thanks to the support of her husband and the loyalty of her customers. Ana María doesn't overlook any opportunity to grow. Now with this loan she can stock her store with more products and buy rice, beans, oil and bread amongst others to cover the rising demand from her clientele who every day look for more products. Without doubt it is s safe and prosperous business. Because of her profits this hard-working woman was able to build her house and even make a room to rent out.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil and bread amongst others.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, one of whom goes to school. She takes care of two additional family members. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She is a tailor; she operates her business from a shop that she rents. She operates on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eleven years, working six days a week.

Regina has requested a loan of UGX 2,400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy materials for clothes.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy materials for clothes.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, Irish potatoes and fish. She sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and defaulters.

Joseline aspires to start to provide outside catering services. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, Irish potatoes and fish.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and 2 go to school. She has no additional family members.

Irene operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, flour, rice, cooking oil and serving utensils. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation.

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge to start selling cold drinks. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos y cuyes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua criando a sus  animalitos para luego venderlos  a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y pollos.
texts.en:
This member, Alejandrina, belongs to the communal bank "Comuzone I". The member continues to make a living raising small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. She is grateful for the loan that she has received, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms. 

The member continues raising her small animals, which she later sells to customers who want them. This way, she is able to move her family forward.

The member is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He has a private school that provides education. He has side businesses of farming and motorcycle transport that generate more income.

He wants a credit facility to improve on the school structures by renovating them. However, he is challenged by late payment of school fees from parents.

loans.use: to improve on his school's structures by renovating them.

loans.name: Dũng

texts.en:
Mr Dũng works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. 

Dũng is 25 years old and he is married with one child. He lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. This is Dũng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dũng has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Dũng faces in his business is the lack of a toilet. He is applying a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

With his business profit, Dũng hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hardworking man who grows crops for both sale and consumption. He earns a salary as well, to add to his income generation.

He hopes to build a permanent house and educate his children to university. Julius meets a problem of the general unpredictable weather changes that hinder his output.

He is requesting a loan to pay for labour to do planting on his farm.

loans.use: to pay for labour to do planting on his farm.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Mrs Hương works in agriculture farming food. Hương is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for eight years.
The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Kibeedi Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
Robert is a married man of 37 years. He sells produce, majorly maize and ground nuts, alongside farming and a bar in Kagadi, Uganda to improve the cost of living. He desires to grow his business and educate his children with the returns, despite challenges of price fluctuations affecting his expected returns.

Robert is requesting credit to buy maize and alcohol for selling at his bar.

He is a member of Kibeedi Tukurakurane group, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan, since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize and alcohol for selling at his bar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy household cleaning products.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, el esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, es una persona que se esta esforzando por cumplir sus sueños de ser un profesional exitoso para poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo nuevamente en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Eduardo is from the city of Ybycuí. He is studying for a degree in Business Administration. Eduardo is a person who strives to fulfill his dream of becoming a successful professional so that he can help other people with his knowledge. He says that his previous loan was used to pay his degree fees.

Today he is requesting a new loan so that he can invest once again in the payment of his degree fees. This will help him to continue his work. He appreciates this new opportunity he has received since it will be a great help.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, two of whom go to school. She takes care of two additional family members. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

She is a tailor; she operates her business from a shop that she rents. She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eleven years, and works six days a week.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy material for clothes and a bale of secondhand clothes.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy material for clothes and a bale of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Benah

texts.en:
Benah is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Benah operates a kiosk at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 3 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy biscuits, sweets, snacks, sugar, salt, crates of soda and juice. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and electricity.

Benah would like to get a bigger kiosk in future so that she can stock more merchandise. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sweets, snacks, sugar, salt, crates of soda and juice.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is widowed with five children; three of her children go to school. She also takes care of other family members.

Sarah sells charcoal on a retail basis. She has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.

She works from her home and sells to all categories of people at retail seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease her transportation troubles.

She resides in her own house. The family has access to electricity, and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and feeding the family. Besides her charcoal business, she generates additional income from rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is widowed with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Margret has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. She sells her clothes on a door to door basis. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from selling chicken. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

Margret would like to get a permanent business premises. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all go to school. She is not looking after any other members of her family.

She has been operating a retail shop for the last four years, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more soda, sugar, flour, cereals, drinking water, and detergents for sale.

Her challenges include transportation. Her dream is to put up her own premises from which to carry out her business. She joined MCDT because it was relatively easy to join.

She is residing in a rented house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy soda, sugar, flour, cereals, and drinking water.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother).

Saida sells used clothes and has been in this business for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings form MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She does not have any other income generating activity. She works seven days a week and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

Saida's target is to make enough profits so as to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Avelina Margot

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,colonias,pefumes entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  continua vendiendo de forma independiente, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias, cremas entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the COMUZONE communal bank. She still has a business selling beauty products, such as creams, perfumes, and others. She is grateful for this loan and she is committed to complying with the established installment payments. She is a responsible, diligent person. She still sells independently. She hopes to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

She is applying for a loan to buy perfumes and creams, among other items.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and creams, among other items.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children; one goes to school. She is not looking after any other members of her family.

She has been selling green bananas at the market on a retail basis for the last twelve years, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas.

Her challenges include seasonality and changes in prices. Her dream is to increase her stock of green bananas. She joined MCDT because of the successful members of her community who are members of SACCO.

She resides in a rented house with no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fix up her house and small business.

loans.name: Nhóm 17. - Thôn Tiến  - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mận is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children. Mận has a retail business selling cake, sweets, sugar and milk. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar and milk to sell.

Mận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Mân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Oanh is the group leader of the Nhóm 17. - Thôn Tiến  - Quảng Nham Group solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Mận lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Mận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mận has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Mận hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar and milk to sell.

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 3 Group

texts.en:
Deisy is one of the members from the group Unidas Para Triunfar (Unite to Win) 3. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic.

She makes her home here in a simple structure with her five children and her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying doing her business.

Deisy is excited to be taking her eleventh loan with Esperanza. She has been paying successfully her previous loans since she took her first one six years ago. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying cosmetic products, which she sells from different brands and different catalogs.

She will use the profits to re-invest in her business and to provide for her family. She is dreaming to have a successful business. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and makeup.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas y pollos, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de  esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank. She makes a living through her business raising young animals such as hens and chickens. This member feels thankful for the approved loan, and promises to fulfill the loan payments. She has made a living in this business for some time, and it has gone well for her thanks to the daily determination she puts towards her business, this being the way that she provides for her family.

This member is requesting a loan to buy chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank. She continues to make a living by way of her business buying and selling clothes. This member has been making a living this way for some time, and it has gone well for her thanks to her daily determination in her business. She would like to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

This member is requesting a loan to buy coats among other things.

loans.use: to buy coats among other things.

loans.name: Josefina Abigail

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Josefina Abigail; la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "COMUZONE I" communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Josefina Abigail continues to work in her business selling natural products. She is grateful for this loan and she is committed to complying with her installment payments. She has had this business for a good amount of time, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She would like to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for a loan to buy natural products.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Sofia Yrene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de chompas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias  al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma segur apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank. She still works in her business selling sweaters. She has had this business for a good amount of time, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She wishes to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for a loan to buy sweaters, among others. She is grateful for this loan and she is committed to complying with the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, among others.

loans.name: Estrella Dorada Group

texts.es:
La alta producción de caña de azúcar y hule como producto alternativo es una de las fuentes de empleo en la localidad ubicada entre cerros los cuales ofrecen una gran vista al amanecer y en la puesta de sol.

En este lugar se originó el grupo Estrella Dorada nombre que eligieron los integrantes debido a su gusto por estos astros y el panorama que suele verse en las noches despejadas. Las personas que conforman el grupo son:

Cinthia, Elizabeth -Venta De Ropa
Francisca -Servilletas Bordadas
Juan -Refrescos Y Sabritas
Rosario -Venta De Dulces
Rosina -Venta De Abarrotes

La señora Rosina es conocida por las personas de la comunidad como Rosa, tiene 59 años, está casada con el señor Edgardo y ya solo uno de sus hijos depende económicamente de ellos y se encuentra estudiando la universidad. Veinte años de experiencia en la venta de abarrotes son los que respaldan a doña Rosa quien inicio con una tienda comunitaria, gracias a ello y las ganancias obtenidas es que hoy en día tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde también ha destinado los préstamos otorgados anteriormente. Con estas pequeñas inversiones ella ha tenido la posibilidad de comprar frijol, azúcar, sopa, aceite, huevos, papel higiénico para continuar brindando servicio como de costumbre a partir de las 7:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm.

“Me siento satisfecha con lo que he logrado con mi tiendita de abarrotes” esas son las palabra de doña Rosa quien además tiene la posibilidad de seguir atendiendo a su familia, las labores del hogar, además de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y educativos de su hijo. 

Comenta que el satisfacer las necesidades en cuestión de productos básicos a sus clientes es lo  mejor, a lo largo de 20 años ha visto varias generaciones. Gracias a sus clientes, a su esmero, a la variedad de productos, buenos precios y atención al cliente continua con su tienda.

*La fotografía fue capturada a dos cuadras del ingenio (fabrica de azúcar) cercana a la cumunidad. Doña Rosa viste blusa negra y falda azul marino.
texts.en:
The high production of sugarcane and rubber as an alternative product is one of the sources of employment in this area, located between hills which provide a great view at sunrise and sunset.

The Estrella Dorada ("Golden Star") group originated in this place. The members chose this name because they liked the stars and the panorama which can be seen on clear nights. The people who make up this group are:

Cinthia, Elizabeth - Clothing Sales
Francisca - Embroidered Napkins
Juan - Soft Drinks and "Sabrita" Snacks
Rosario - Candy Sales
Rosina - Grocery Store

Rosina is known by people in the community as Rosa. She is 59 years old and is married to Edgardo. Only one of their children still depends on them financially and is studying at university. Rosa is backed by her 20 years of experience in grocery sales. She started with a neighborhood store. Thanks to her store and her earnings, she now has a grocery store where she has also allocated previous loans. With these small investments, she has been able to buy beans, sugar, soup, oil, eggs, and toilet paper to continue serving clients, usually from 7:00am until 8:00pm.

"I feel satisfied with what I have accomplished with my little grocery store." These are Rosa's words. She has also been able to continue taking care of her family and the household duties while supporting her husband with the household expenses and those of their child's education.

She says that satisfying her clients' need for basic products is the best part. Over 20 years, she has seen several generations. Thanks to her clients, her care, the variety of products, good prices, and customer service, she still has her store.

*The photograph was taken two blocks away from the sugar factory near the community. Rosa is wearing a black shirt and a navy blue skirt.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, soup, oil, eggs, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Nhóm 14 - Thôn Điền - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Thanh is 56 years old and is married with three children. Thanh is the group leader of the Nhóm 14 - Thôn Điền - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of five members. Thanh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thanh has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Diana Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Diana una mujer luchadora de 33  años es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos el mayor de 14 años y la ultima de 3 años, ella trabaja como empleada doméstica y en trabajos agrícolas en un pequeño  Recinto llamado San Bernabé el mismo que está ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos  este Recinto es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de sus maravillosas hosterías y sitios de descanso que podemos encontrar
La señora Diana solicita este crédito para invertir en emprender un negocio, una granja porcina aprendió de esta actividad por medio de un empleo que tenía cuidando una granja de cerdos, al negocio le dedicara un promedio de 5 hora diarias, durante este tiempo recibirá la ayuda del mayor de sus hijos que es el que la está ayudando en algunos gastos de la casa, con esta inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y podrá seguir ayudando en la preparación de sus hijos 
La señora Diana agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Diana, 33, is a fighting woman. She is a single mother of four children, the oldest of whom is 14 and the youngest of whom is 3. She works as a domestic employee as well as in farm work in a small area called San Bernabé. It is located in the northwestern part of Pichincha Province in the canton of San Miguel de los Bancos. This area is very popular among domestic and foreign tourists, who enjoy its marvelous inns and recreation sites.

Diana is applying for a loan to invest in starting a business, a pig farm. She learned about this activity from a job she had taking care of a pig farm. She will dedicate an average of 5 hours per day to her business. During this time, she will have the help of her oldest child, who is helping her with some household expenses. With this investment, they will improve their earnings and she will be able to continue supporting her children.

Diana is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for their support and for giving her this opportunity.

loans.use: to start a pig farm and earn an income to support her children.

loans.name: San Jose Obrero Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Jose Obrero  es un grupo nuevo, esta en su ciclo uno, las integrantes se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias, son de una zona rural aun en crecimiento, donde todas quieren un mejor porvenir para sus familias.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que a través de la cría de animales de corral que hace, está teniendo los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales para la cría, como así también de balanceados para poder seguir con su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The San Jose Obrero group is a new group and is in its first cycle. The members joined together to help their families. They are from a rural area which is still growing, where all of them want a better future for their families.

Maria is one of the members of this group. She is a very hardworking, fighting woman who earns an income to support her family by raising farmyard animals. 

Maria is applying for this loan to buy animals to raise, as well as animal feed, to continue with her small business.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 2 Group

texts.en:
Carlos is the coordinator of his group, Amor y Amistad 2 (Love and Peace). He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife. He is excited to be taking his 16th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loans and having developed his business by expanding his client base and by buying more products. 

Carlos has had his business for almost ten years. He started it with his own savings. Some neighbors invited him to join the group, and he received his first loan 7.5 years ago. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by purchasing different tropical fruits and vegetables to sell in his small stand. He will continue using his business profits to provide for his family and to invest in his business.

Carlos' group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a burgeoning tourism industry, where most of the group members sell their products in their communities and surrounding areas. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Xejuyu Vasconcelos Group

texts.en:
In the rural communities of the department of Sololá in the highlands of Western Guatemala, over 84 percent of the population lives in poverty. These impacted populations of the region are predominantly indigenous Maya “Kaqchikel” who continue to be affected by the consequences of the violence that devastated the region during the Civil War. Vasconcelos is one of these communities, where empowered and motivated women are creating brighter futures for their families through business. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Xejuyu” is made up of seven women from Vasconcelos who have just finished repaying their first Kiva loan. This investment from Kiva lenders has allowed the women to expand their businesses, reach new clients, and diversify their products.

Maria, 23 years old, is the youngest member of the Trust Bank “Xejuyu.” Of the seven members of the Trust Bank, she is the only woman who is able to understand and read and write in Spanish, making her invaluable to the group. Maria has requested a loan from Friendship Bridge to continue expanding her embroidery business, with the purchase of threads and dyes. With this loan she hopes to improve the quality of life of her two young daughters by increasing her income in order to invest in drinking water for their home. Through Friendship Bridge’s monthly educational meetings, she has learned about the importance of family planning and hygiene, including the health benefits of potable drinking water. 

Maria is excited to begin the new year with the possibility to grow her embroidery business and continue building capital. In the future, with the skills she has learned through experience, she hopes to open a “Tortilleria” or a small store to generate a more stable income. With the investment from Kiva lenders Maria will be given the opportunity to expand her business knowledge and increase her income. This loan is an important step in the direction of one day achieving her ultimate goal!

loans.use: To buy threads and dyes for embroidery business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, el socio continúa dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, él socio continua vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan apedido,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, casacas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This bank member belongs to the communal bank "Comuzone I." He continues to work in his business of selling clothing. He continues selling to his customers who make requests from him. He wants to be able to continue working so that in this way he can continue supporting his family.

He is applying for the loan to purchase pants and jackets, among other items.

He feels grateful for the loan granted to him, and he promises to make his established payments.

loans.use: to purchase pants and jackets, among other items.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita runs a grocery store and restaurant. She sells basic necessities like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She hopes to improve her life with this business. She is an enterprising women and hard working. Her dream is to expand her business. She is asking for a loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

Margarita is happy for the loan and she promises to make on-time payments.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Los negocios siempre ha sido la  primera opción para María Mercedes, y es que hace años comenzó en Costa Rica vendiendo  ropa;  ahora que regreso a Nicaragua, con ayuda de su esposo, puso una pequeña pulpería con la esperanza de ganar clientela y con las ganancias invertir en ella. 

El apoyo de su familia ha sido trascendental, así como el de los créditos, que  le han dado la pauta para seguir creciendo y ampliando su negocio. Ya que, con  este financiamiento invertirá en el abastecimiento de la pulpería y podra comprar granos básicos, bebidas gaseosas, desodorantes, analgésicos etc., Así como la compra de más productos que sus clientes solicitan. Ahora sus planes son seguir evolucionando para convertirse a corto plazo en una distribuidora o un súper.
texts.en:
Business has always been the first option for Maria Mercedes, and years ago she began selling clothing in Costa Rica. Now that she has returned to Nicaragua, she set up a little grocery store with the help of her husband, hoping to win customers and invest in it with the earnings.

The support of her family has been vital, as have the loans, which have given her a guideline for continuing to grow and expand her business. Now, with this financing, she will invest in stocking her grocery store, and she will be able to buy basic grains, soft drinks, deodorants, analgesics, etc., as well as more products that her customers ask for. Now her plans are to continue evolving to become a distributor or a supermarket in the short term.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, deodorants, analgesics, etc., for her store.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh is 53 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Lanh works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Lanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Lanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lanh hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thơm

texts.en:
Thơm is 21 years old and she is married with two children. She has her business in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thơm operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for three years.

The main hardship that Thơm faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Thơm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Thơm hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 53 years old and he is married with three children. He lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thu operates a food stall selling fruit. He has been involved in this business for three years.

The main hardship that Thu faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Thu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Thu hopes for his children to find a good job, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn enjoys gardening, and uses her land to earn an income as well. She is 56, married, and stays busy as a way to earn money for her family. She took advantage of an opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC, in part because the cooperative helps her secure capital to support her gardening activities. She is requesting a loan to buy gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Merlyn hopes to become a supplier of flowers to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools and fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Chitaracena Group

texts.en:
Just outside of Guatemala’s second biggest city of Quetzaltenango, lies the neighboring town of Salcaja. Salcaja is known for its prolific manufacturing of the region’s typical “cortes” or dresses that are worn by Maya women. A 30-minute climb up one of these dusty roads, shared by roaming animals, is the humble community of Chitaracena.  

In Chitaracena, men, women, and children work together preparing and weaving the fabrics of the region. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chitaracena,” named after their community, is made up of 12 women, many of which dedicate themselves to the production of traditional dresses. “Chitaracena” is an incredibly organized, lively, empowered and motivated Trust Bank, focused on using their business to invest in their futures. 

Claudia, a 21-year-old student studying medicine, is the youngest member of the group. Although Claudia is a new member of the established Trust Bank, she has the knowledge of an experienced business owner. Claudia plans to use her loan to buy the threads and materials needed for the production of typical dresses. She plans to invest the profits generated from the sale of her dresses in furthering her education. Claudia’s ultimate goal is to become a licensed nutritionist, paying her tuition with the income generated from her new business venture. With the guidance from her Trust Bank, Claudia will be able to convert her loan into an investment in her future. With the investment from Kiva lenders Claudia will be given the opportunity to achieve her goal and improve the quality of life in her country as a nutritionist. Thank you, Kiva lenders, for your generosity!

loans.use: to buy the threads and materials needed for the production of typical dresses

loans.name: Villa Rayanniyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANIYOC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Taray, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina, la socia continua  con su  negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, gaseosas  entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de verduras.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Villa Rayanniyoc." This bank is located in the district of Taray, which belongs to the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

One member is Señora Bernardina. She continues with her grocery store business. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule. She continues selling various types of products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other items. She is a responsible and persevering person, since this is how she is raising her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase rice and soft drinks, among other items.

The other members work in businesses of selling animals, agriculture, a grocery store, and selling vegetables.

loans.use: to buy rice and soft drinks, among other items.

loans.name: Hằng

texts.en:
Hằng is 38 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hằng operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for eight years.

The main hardship that Hằng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thắm

texts.en:
Thắm is 54 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thắm works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thắm faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom. This is Thắm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thắm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to travel for vacation internationally.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Wilman Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Wilman un hombre luchador de 53 años es casado de esa larga relación tiene 3 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad el mayor tiene 27 años y el ultimo tiene 20 años, la esposa no trabaja ella es quien le ayuda en la finca , ellos viven y tienen el negocio en el Recinto Célica el mismo que pertenece al Cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado un lugar hermoso, de clima es cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tenemos muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con amabilidad y respeto 
El señor Wilman se dedica a la producción de leche aprendió de este negocio en su niñez junto con los papas ya que fue criado en una finca ganadera ayudando a los padres, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 8 horas diarias durante este tiempo recibe la ayuda de la esposa en el ordeño de las vacas
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de una vaca productora de leche con esta inversión podrá incrementar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, el señor Wilman agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Wilman , 53, is a hard-working, married man. He has three adult children from this long-term relationship; the eldest is 27 and the youngest is 20. His wife does not work, but she helps with the farm. They live and have their business in Recinto la Celica which is in Pedro Vicente Maldonado canton, a beautiful place with a warm, humid climate, filled with kind, hard-working people. This canton is the arrival point for many tourists because there are many hostels where they can rest and be treated with kindness and respect. 

Willman is a dairy farmer and learned this trade from his parents as a child. He was raised on a cattle ranch where he helped his parents. He spends an average of eight hours a day on the job, and his wife helps by milking the cows. He is asking for this loan to invest in his business by buying a dairy cow. This investment will allow him to increase his income and his quality of life. 

Wilman is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunities provided.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so he can increase his income and quality of life.

loans.name: Diện

texts.en:
Diện is 43 years old and he is married with two children. He lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Diện works in agriculture farming food. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Diện faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom. This is Diện's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With his business profit, Diện hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his children to find a good job, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Monserat

texts.en: Monserat is growing a selection of ornamental garden plants, and finds pleasure in doing her gardening while she earns money for her family. As a member of PMPC, she is seeking a loan to buy a new variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell. In the future, Monserat hopes to supply flowers to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a businesswoman from Guipos. She is 46 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store (variety store) and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Angelina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Angelina continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start a sari-sari store (variety store) business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Marina is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Profetisa

texts.en:
In 2007, Profetisa learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. 

Profetisa tried her luck with starting a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she was able to use as capital. 

Profetisa has requested another loan to buy fertilizers, gardening tools, and corn seed preparation. This should help give her farming income a big boost. 

Profetisa continues to look for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, gardening tools, and corn seed preparation.

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Thắng is 50 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thắng operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thắng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Thắng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thắng hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhất

texts.en:
Nhất is 45 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Nhất works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2014, Nhất joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Nhất faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Nhất hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Janemar

texts.en:
Janemar has started her small-scale business and became her own boss with her sari-sari, or variety store. 

Janemar manages to keep her sari-sari stocked with enough inventory, and she continues to roll-over her capital to earn more profits. She makes good sales every day since she is the only store in their barangay. 

Recently Janemar approached Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for much-needed capital to restock her store with additional basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and repairing clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She has applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and provide better tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 46 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. She is married with 2 school-age children. 

Gertrudes manages her small eatery while at the same time selling her clothing products. She has had this business for 4 years. 

Gertrudes has requested a loan to buy kitchen utensils to expand her business and earn more income. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Collective for 1 year. 

In the future, Gertrudes hopes to build her own eatery house.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old, and lives in Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two school age children. 

She is very happy every time she plants and waters her flowers, because she earns money from them. She delivers her harvest to her customers and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan to buy a variety of ornamental plants to supply the demand of her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Josephine wants to expand her business and provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ornamental plants

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia earns an income through selling various seafood like shells and seaweeds. She also produces shrimp pastes to sell. Alicia is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to be used as additional working capital to purchase more stock of a variety of seafood to expand her business and increase her production. She is on her way to repaying her loan from her new profits. 

She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seafood to increase her inventory and sales

loans.name: Geovana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Hace un poco más de un año, uno de los planes de Geovana era establecer su propia pulpería. Ahora a sus 38 años de edad, esta comerciante ha podido evolucionar y dejar atrás la venta de vigorón y establecer esa plan que tanto deseaba gracias al crédito anterior. Ella se siente muy agradecida con MiCrédito, KIVA y con todas las personas que apoyaron en ese préstamo, puesto que le ayudó a incrementar sus ventas comprando yuca, chicharrón, azúcar y frutas para los refrescos en venta. Todo le facilitó ahorrar e invertir en la pulpería que tanto deseaba. 
Geovana quiere seguir colocando su pulpería como una de las más que ofrece variedad de productos y los de mejor calidad. La temporada escolar está por comenzar, por lo que ella solicita nuevo préstamo para comprar cuadernos, lápices, borradores, correctores, tajadores y marcadores, materiales escolares que son de gran demanda en esta época. Así mismo comprar granos básicos como arroz, azúcar y frijoles para seguir con su inversión de mercadería. Al cancelar este préstamo considera invertir en cosméticos para vender y así seguir variando sus productos.
texts.en:
A little more than a year ago, one of Geovana's plans was to set up her own general store. Now at 38, she is a businessperson who has been able to grow, and leave behind the sale of vigorón (traditional Nicaraguan dish consisting of a cabbage salad, boiled yuca, and fried pork wrapped in a banana leaf), and implement the plan she so much wished to, thanks to the previous loan. 

She is very grateful to MiCredito, Kiva, and all the people who supported her in that loan, since it helped her to increase her sales by buying yuca, fried pork, as well as sugar and fruit for the fruit drinks she sells. Everything made it easier for her to save and invest in the general store that she has wanted so much. 

Geovana wants to continue positioning her general store as one of those offers a variety of products and those of better quality. The school season is about to begin, so she is requesting a new loan in order to buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, correction fluid, marker pens and school materials, which are in great demand at this time of year. She will also buy basic staples such as rice, sugar and beans in order to continue investing in merchandise. 

When she pays off this loan she is considering investing in cosmetics to sell, and this way continue varying her products.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, correction fluid, marker pens, rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is 43 years old is married with 3 children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoá province.

In 2014, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 1 previous loan from Thanh Hoa Fund. She has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Liên faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.
