With her business profits, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle.

Hà is 37 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoá province.

In 2013, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in her business for 5 years.

The main hardship that Hà faces in her life is not having a biogas system. So, she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a biogas system.

With her business profits, Hà hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Lộc

texts.en:
Mrs. Lộc is 50 years old, and she is married with 5 children. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoá province.

Lộc operates a food stall selling noodles. She has been running her business for more than 10 years.

This is Lộc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Lộc faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Lộc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lameck

texts.en: Popularly known as ‘the land of hills’, Nyamira has a beautiful landscape made up of endless undulating hills and valleys stretching as far as the eye can see. The people who work the land are proud of its beauty. But the terrain poses a number of challenges to smallholder farmers – the most serious being soil erosion and land degradation. About 77 per cent of all cultivated land in Nyamira is on slopes classified as having ‘moderate to high erosion risk soils’. Kiva lenders meet Lameck who hails from Nyamira which is home to one of the poorest neighborhoods in Kenya. He is arguably among the most successful clients of Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. Back in 2009, Lameck practiced traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. He was doing only half an acre of maize crops per season. The returns were so meager that he could barely fend for survival. He kept doing maize farming for years without turning a profit until 2012, when he switched to tomato, poultry and dairy farming and finally, there was light at the end of the tunnel for Lameck. Today, Lameck is a fully-fledged entrepreneur. He has been provided with technical guidance, training programs and exposure visits. He has already serviced other asset-based loans fully from Juhudi Kilimo. Through these loans, he has acquired high quality dairy cows and poultry. To capitalize more on the returns from booming tomato farming, Lameck is seeking a loan of KES 180,000 to build a greenhouse and buy a motorbike. Unlike his competition, Lameck conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high quality produce. By doing this, he has created a name for himself and a demand for his produce. The motorbike will assist Lameck to transport his products to the market in a timely manner. Tomatoes and milk are very perishable and they require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price and with this loan, all that will be achieved. Your lending will contribute greatly to the actualization of Lameck's goal, which is to be the lead supplier of tomatoes. In the future, he is also planning to introduce zero the grazing method, intensify his maize farming, and start value addition.

loans.use: To build a green house and buy another motorbike

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is from Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay, in the Philippines. She and her husband have a livestock business. They raise chickens for sale either dressed or live. Recently, Wilma requested a loan to purchase nails, sticks, and hog wire to build an additional chicken cage that has wider space for her chickens. Wilma deeply wishes to sell more dressed and live chickens each week, to save enough money for future emergencies. She hopes to become a supplier of chickens in town and neighborhoods.

loans.use: to purchase nails, sticks, and hog wire to build an additional chicken cage that has wider space for her chickens

loans.name: Alberto Sr.

texts.en:
Alberto Sr. is 65 years old and married with four beautiful children. He lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past two decades, Alberto Sr. has been a farmer. He earns 20,000 PHP from each crop doing this type of business. He is a new member of PMPC. 

Alberto Sr. is requesting an amount to purchase fertilizer to increase crop yield on his rice farm. In the future, he hopes to buy another hectare plot of rice land to cultivate. Alberto Sr. wishes to improve and expand his business for the benefit of his children and even his grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer;  to increase crop yield on his rice farm

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
La elaboración de muebles es un arte, cada diseño y cada pieza se hace con mucha precaución. Unos para adornar grandes empresas y otros para amueblar pequeños hogares.  José Antonio lleva varios años en este oficio, comenzó como ayudante y ahora es dueño de su propio taller, el cual le sirve para sacar adelante a su familia. 
La fama del taller ha sobresalido, por su calidad y buenos precios.  Por eso, José solicita el crédito para poder comprar madera, clavos, barniz, entre otros productos básicos para la elaboración de sus muebles. Espera así, poder cumplir en tiempo y forma con sus clientes, para fortalecer la imagen respetable de su taller.
texts.en:
Furniture making is an art; each design and piece is made with much care. Some are to adorn large businesses and others to furnish small homes. José Antonio has several years' experience in this trade. He started has a helper and now he is the owner of his own workshop, which serves him in getting his family ahead.

The fame of the workshop has excelled, because of its quality and good prices. Therefore, José is applying for the loan to be able to buy wood, nails, varnish, among other basic products for the making of his furniture. He hopes to be able to fulfill satisfy his customers in time and form, to strengthen the respectable image of his workshop.

loans.use: to be able to buy wood, nails, varnish, among other basic products.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla has mastered her hog raising business in Liloy. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her husband in sustaining their family needs. Perla was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful for credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care her hog raising business, so also does she pay attention to her membership with PMPC.  She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always be in the running for any financing needs. Now, the loan of Php 14,900 will help her buy more piglets for additional earnings and build concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for additional earnings, and to build concrete pig pens.

loans.name: Jenina

texts.en: Jenina is 38 years old. She is a single parent with one child, and they live in Salug, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Jenina is managing her fishing business and owns a fishing boat. Jenina has employed three fishermen to work for her.  She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat to the market and neighboring towns. She earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her family (parents), especially her child's health needs and education. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to restock liters of diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and overhaul; and purchase fishing equipment and accessories. In the future, Jenina hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to restock liters of diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and overhaul; and purchase fishing equipment and accessories

loans.name: Choquequirao Inc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy ella es soltera y tiene 58 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de zapatos, la socia vende todo tipo de zapatos para mujeres, varones y niños,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y que terminen de estudiar, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agencia de viajes.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC” village bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Nancy. She is single and 58. The member works in her business selling shoes. The member sells all types of shoes for women, men and children. The member, by means of this business, wants to get her children ahead and wants them to finish studying. The member works from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM. The member already has 7 years' experience in this business and it's going very well for her. The member's dream is to have a place of business where she can sell the shoes. The member is applying for this loan to buy shoes. 

The members that are attached to the group photo had their photo taken after the meeting because they asked for permission due to work reasons.

The other members are dedicated to the clothing selling business, craft selling business, grocery store business and travel agency business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 27 years old who is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and one child. He is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Felix wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 30 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. He lives in Poblacion La Libertad, Zamboanga Del Norte. Reynaldo is engaged in fish selling and has been doing this type of work for 5 years. His fish selling is the primary source of income.

Reynaldo become a member of Paglaum MPC in July 2012. He is very thankful because, with Paglaum, he can apply for a loan of 14,900 PHP to pay a down payment on a motor for his fish vending service.

Reynaldo is very responsible for the sake of his family. From the profits of his business he can save with Paglaum for the future of his four kids.

loans.use: to pay a down payment on a motor for his fish vending service.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 55 years old and married with seven children. The family lives in Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Rosie has rented a space in the fish market where she displays her fish to sell. She has been in this business for many years already, earning a good return, enabling her to support the needs of their big family. Since she wants to generate more income, Rosie joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. She has now applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor someday and eventually a fish stockholder in the public market at nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Pampila

texts.en: Pampila is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for five years and earns a monthly net income of 3,800 PHP. Pampila is 57 years old, married and has three children. She is from the village of Overview, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Pampila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pampila has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Recently, Pampila requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventory for her store to increase stock.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store to increase stock

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is 58 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has seven children who are now adult and school age. 
Hilaria earns a living from agricultural activity, particularly vegetable gardening, and she’s been in this business for three years. She is also supported by her husband who is a farmer.  She earns approximately PHP1,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing one sack of fertilizer and a variety of seeds for her gardening business. 

Hilaria has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Hilaria hopes to have additional plots for her vegetable gardening activity.

loans.use: To  purchase a sack of fertilizer and variety of seeds

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, 37, is married and has two school-age children. Her major source of income is selling grocery items. She has been in this business for one year. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income, due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She has already taken out loans previously to purchase additional stock, and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora lives in Dimaluna, Ozamis City. She supports her four children by building houses from the ground up. 

Currently, she is applying a loan, which she will use to buy building material and paint, and pay her workers. Aurora wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work that she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials and paint, and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married with two children. She is 43 years old and lives in Delapa, Sibutad, ZDN. Jennifer is a farmer and grows palay (unhusked rice) to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years.

Jennifer has requested a loan to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizers and chemicals and to pay for the labor for flooding of rice land. Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for four years.

In the future, Jennifer hopes to harvest more palay and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs for flooding of rice land.

loans.name: Jazmina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La alegría con que te recibe Jazmina Ruiz, demuestra cuanto amor y empeño le ha puesto a su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos plásticos. Ella empezó desde muy joven vendiendo en el mercado, ahora a sus 38 años de edad tiene su propia tienda, la cual intenta mantener lo más llena posible para ofertarle a los clientes una variedad de productos; es por eso que ella solicita un crédito para comprar platos, vasos, baldes, cubiertos, entre otros productos para cumplir a la vez sus metas personales.  
Jazmina es una mujer de semblante fuerte, que dice se ha abierto paso en la vida del comercio solamente con el apoyo de su esposo, ahora su más grande motivación es su hijo de 5 años, para el cual desea una mejor calidad de vida. Es por eso que ella piensa que la oportunidad que le brinda Kiva por medio de MiCrédito es fundamental para su desarrollo. En un futuro ella desea poder llegar a más clientes, tener una mejor infraestructura y  poder ofertarle sus artículos a distintos mercados.
texts.en:
The happiness with which Jazmina Ruiz receives you demonstrates how much love and effort she's put forth to her small business selling plasticware. She started very young, selling in the market. Now, at the age of 38, she has her own store, which she intends to maintain as full as possible to offer her customers a variety of products. That is why she is applying for a loan to buy plates, glasses, buckets, cutlery, among other products to accomplish her personal goals at once.

Jazmina is a woman of strong countenance, who says she's made her way in the life of a merchant only with the support of her husband. Now her largest motivation is her son, aged 5. She desires a better quality of life for him. That is why she thinks that the opportunity that Kiva brings her via MiCrédito is fundamental for her development. In the future, she wishes to be able to reach more customers, have better infrastructure and be able to offer her articles to different markets.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, buckets, cutlery, among other products.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
Ana, de 38 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, por su situacion económica, sus padres no pudieron seguirle ayudando para que estudiara; está casada y es madre de dos hijos, uno estudia quinto grado y el otro octavo grado y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ana, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, además, hace pan dulce en su tiempo libre, en este trabajo le colaboran sus hijos.- El lugar en donde siembra su esposo, está a un kilómetro de distancia de su casa y su horario es de 4:30 a.m. Ella se levanta muy temprano a hacer los oficios del hogar, para después trasladarse a la parcela a ayudarle a su esposo y regresa a las 12:00. 

Ana, está solicitando el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, veneno y para pagar el arrendamiento de la tierra en donde sembrará 11,250 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con esto se espera un mejor ingreso económico para la familia.  

Ana, sueña poder vender a buen precio su cultivo, para lograr tener buenas ganancias, con esto ayudará a contribuir en el desarrollo integral de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old and has a high school education. Because of their financial situation, her parents were not able to continue helping her to go to school. 

She is married and mother of two to children. One is in the fifth grade and the other in the eighth grade, and her husband farms. Anna has been farming for 10 years and also makes sweet bread in her spare time. Her children help her do this work. 

The area her husband farms is a kilometer from the house and he starts his day at 4:30 a.m. She gets up very early to do the household chores so that she can then go to the parcel and help her husband, and return at noon. Anna is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay for the rent on the land she will farm (11,250 m² of corn.)

With this, she hopes for a better income for the family. Ana dreams of selling her crop at a good price, so that she can succeed in having good earnings. With this she will help to their children develop to the fullest.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the rent on the land where she will farm.

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es: Doña Carla agradece el apoyo económico brindado pues gracias al mismo ella compro fertilizantes y foliares para poder aplicar a sus cultivos y proteger el grano de café. A través del financiamiento brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con KIVA ella dio la asistencia necesaria a su cafetal lo cual permitió que mejorara las condiciones de la plantación y protegiera la planta de enfermedades y deterioros por el factor climatológico. Ella espera ser nuevamente apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva pues en esta nueva ocasión ella solicita financiamiento para nuevamente asistir su plantación de café comprando nuevamente abono, fertilizantes, foliares y demás insumos que son necesarios para asistir la plantación de café. Sus metas en este nuevo año es la limpieza de la propiedad, podar una planta vieja y sustituirla por una plantilla de café nueva, elaboración de viveros para la venta y poder aperturar un pequeño negocio en su casa de habitacion de venta de cosméticos para poder incrementar su ingreso económico.
texts.en:
Carla appreciates the financial support that she has been provided. Thanks to that support, she bought fertilizers to apply to her crops and protect the coffee bean. Through the financing provided by the cooperative COMIXMUL in partnership with Kiva, she gave the necessary care to her coffee plantation. This allowed the plantation’s conditions to improve and allowed her to protect the plants from diseases and deterioration due to climatic factors. 

She hopes to be supported once again by the different Kiva investors. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to take care of her coffee plantation again by buying manure, fertilizers, and other necessary supplies to tend to the coffee plantation. Her goals for the new year are to clean the property, to prune an old plant and replace it with a new coffee plant, to make nurseries to sell, and to be able to open a small cosmetic sales business in her home to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops in the new year.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Cụm 26 Thôn Thắng Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Chung has a retail business selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Chung is 53 years old and she is married with four children. She is the group leader for the Nhóm 10 cụm 26 thôn Thắng Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. In 2012, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chung has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Chung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Chung faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Chung hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Tekopora Group

texts.es:
Tekopora quiere decir mejor vida, y es justamente esto lo que impulsa a todas están mujeres integrantes de este grupo, ellas quieren una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.
Las señoras tienen actividades diferentes, en las que se esfuerzan y luchan por poder salir adelante. Entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Matilde, quien es una humilde modista, ella hace todo tipo de trabajos y cada día se esfuerza por ir mejorando, es por ello que está contenta con las capacitaciones que va recibiendo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con telas e hilos en cantidad, de manera a poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, y de esa forma ir mejorando cada día más.
texts.en:
"Tokopora" means "better life," and it is exactly this that drives all of these women who are members of this group. They want a better quality of life for their families.

The women have different activities in which they strive and fight to be able to get ahead. Among them Matilde stands out, who is a humble seamstress. She does all types of jobs and every day, she strives to improve. This is why she is content with the training that she's receiving.

She is applying for this loan to be able to stock herself with fabric and thread in quantity, so as to be able to fulfill the orders of her customers and, in this manner, improve more each day.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for sewing.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida joined Paglaum MPC because she was seeking financial assistance. As a farmer in Ozamis, she tried her luck and took out a loan to start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Loida feels that she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for trusting her with the money she borrowed. 

Loida is currently requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next crop season. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is a businesswoman who has chosen to live as single in Aloran. She became a microfinance member of PMPC and runs a retail store selling "nipa" thatch for house walling. Running this type of business has supported her needs and enabled her to extend help to her nieces and nephews in their education. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase more inventories of "nipa" to be weaved for "nipa" thatch and sell. Mercedes believes that having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories of "nipa" to be weaved for "nipa" thatch and sell

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella requested a PHP 3,000 loan through PMPC as starting capital to buy basic commodities for her sari-sari store. She wants to help support her family from the income of her sari-sari store in a small way.  Bella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rustica

texts.en:
Rustica is 50 years old. She is a widow with five children and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta. To earn a living, Rustica has managed her rice farm. She also engages in palay trading and a rice retailing business. She mastered doing these types of activities as she was widowed, to support their needs. 

She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in April of 2011. She is a hardworking mother who has strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family. Rustica requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase production on her rice farm, and pay for sacks of "palay" for rice retail. This will help her income and provide her children with a good and decent life. Someday, she hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of her produce and variety rice.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase production on her rice farm, and pay for sacks of "palay" for rice retail

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, age 37, is from Poblacion, Sibutad, Philippines.  She is a single parent bravely raising one child.  PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Analiza is now trying to expand her pig business and has also decided to venture into a little restaurant. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900.  She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send her child to school so it may have a stable career.

loans.use: to buy 10 piglets and bags of animal feed

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is married with four children. She is 55 years old and lives in Delapa, Sibutad. Marlyn is a farmer and grows palay to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and chemicals. Marlyn has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Marlyn hopes to harvest more palay and save for an emergency.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Carmincita

texts.en: Carmincita finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. As a widow, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in support of her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Carmincita wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: La Unión 2 Group

texts.es:
La pedrera es uno de los lugares más conocidos de la comunidad, a este lugar se le llama así pues es parte del cerro donde hace más de 10 años se solía sacar piedra para emplearla en los cimientos de las construcciones. En dicho lugar se encuentra el grupo La Unión 2 conformado por personas trabajadoras quienes han decidido desempeñar una actividad económica con el firme propósito de ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ellos son:

María Victoria - Antojitos
Selva - Carne De Res
María - Pollos Rostizados
Irayda - Cosméticos Y Piñatas
Leidy, Laura - Comida
Vicente - Albañilería
Martin - Venta De Naranjas

"Una mujer de fe, es una mujer exitosa" afirma Irayda mejor conocida como "La Tota", ella es madre soltera de una niña de 6 años. Desde hace ya 5 años, ella se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo (rímel, delineadores, maquillaje, perfumes). Además, también crea y vende piñatas, guías y coronas; trabaja en una refaccionaria y aprovecha el espacio para ofrecer naranjas, aumentando de esta manera sus ingresos para solventar los gastos escolares de su hija.  “Es mi motor principal por ella haría cualquier cosa”. 

Irayda comenta que gracias a los préstamos otorgados ha logrado brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña y esta vez necesita invertir en papel periódico, lustre, china, crepé, globos y almidón para hacer más manualidades, pero también comprará una caja de cosméticos que le han solicitado sus clientes. “Gracias a los prestamos las actividades han mejorado, pero ahora quiero poner una pequeña tienda de piñatas”.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de don Vicente quien se dedica al servicio de albañilería, detrás de los integrantes se puede observar la madera que él utiliza en su negocio. Irayda viste blusa color amarillo.
texts.en:
La pedrera [the quarry] is one of the most recognized places in the community. It has this name because it is part of the hill where, over 10 years ago, rock was extracted to use in foundations for construction. In this place is the group La Unión 2, formed by hardworking people who have decided to carry out business with the firm goal of offering a better quality of life to their family. They are: 

María Victoria – Snacks
Selva – Beef
María – Roasted chicken
Irayda – Cosmetics and piñatas
Leidy, Laura – Food
Vicente – Construction
Martin – Orange sales

“A woman of faith is a successful woman,” states Irayda, better known as “La Tota.” She is a single mother of a 6-year-old girl. For the last five years she has worked selling cosmetics by catalogue (mascara, eyeliner, foundation, perfume). In addition, she also makes and sells piñatas, garlands, and wreaths. She works in a repair shop and takes advantage of the space to sell oranges, in this way increasing her income to cover her daughter’s school expenses. “She is my main drive. I would do anything for her.”

Irayda says that thanks to the granted loans, she has been able to provide a better quality of life for her daughter and this time she needs to invest in newspaper, glossy paper, tissue paper, crepe paper, balloons, and starch to make more crafts, but also to buy a box of cosmetics that her customers have requested from her. “Thanks to the loans, business has improved, but now I want to start a small piñata store.”

*The photo was taken in the home of don Vicente who works in construction. Behind the members one can see the wood that he uses in his business. Irayda is dressed in a yellow blouse.

loans.use: to buy newspaper, glossy paper, tissue paper, crepe paper, balloons, starch, and a box of cosmetics.

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Josefina del Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, se ha entregado con todo su corazón a su pulpería y el bienestar de su familia. Como comerciante descubrió la forma de salir adelante, sin descuidar su hogar. Cuenta con el incondicional apoyo de su esposo y sus dos hijos, los que al llegar de la escuela le brindan su ayuda. A sus 41 años de edad desea hacer crecer su negocio, hasta convertirse en una distribuidora en su comunidad.
Esta fémina ejemplar ha solicitado un crédito para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, correctores, mochilas, lápices, entre otros materiales escolares para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. En esta temporada estos artículos tienen un gran auge y dejan un buen porcentaje de utilidades, por lo que no quiere dejar pasar esta oportunidad. Habiendo cursado solo la primaria Josefina es una excelente  mujer de negocios, para la cual su principal impulso es hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Josefina del Carmen is a very hardworking woman. She has given herself to her general store and the wellbeing of her family with all her heart. As a merchant, she discovered the way to get ahead without neglecting her home. She counts on the unconditional support of her husband and their two children, who upon arriving from school, offer her their help.

At her 41 years of age, she desires to make her business grow until she turns herself into a distributor in her community. This exemplary woman has applied for a loan to buy school supplies like notebooks, pens, correction fluid, backpacks, pencils, among other school supplies to offer them to her customers. In this season, these items have a large boom and they leave a good percentage of profits. Therefore, she doesn't want to let this opportunity pass. Having only finished primary school, Josefina is an excellent businesswoman, for which her main impulse is making her children professionals.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, correction fluid, backpacks, pencils, among others.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 4º grado, debido a que dependía de familia de escasos recursos y no pudieron seguir dándole un estudio mas avanzado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y es padre de tres hijos.

Juan, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde la edad de 18 años, trabajo que le enseñaron sus padres, su trabajo está a una distancia de dos kilómetros de su casa y llega caminando; su día de trabajo comienza a las 5:00 a.m y finaliza a las 12:00 p.m luego tiene que ayudar en los oficios de  la casa.

Juan, está solicitando el crédito en CREDICAMPO para comprar una vaca lechera, para que genere ingresos diarios con la venta de leche y queso y en un futuro  venderla a un buen precio, para cubrir algunas necesidades de su hogar.

Juan, sueña con poder tener más ganado y que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Juan, 34, studied until the 4th grade as he depended on his family who lacked resources and couldn't afford to provide him with a higher education. He's accompanied by his partner who takes care of the household. He is a father of three children.

Juan has been an agricultural and cattle farmer since he was 18 years old; a job his parents taught him. HIs work is 2 kilometers from his house and he goes by foot. His day starts at 5:00am and finishes at 12:00pm. After that, he has to help out with the chores at home.

Juan is requesting a loan with CREDICAMPO to buy a dairy cow, in order to generate daily income with the sale of milk and cheese, and in the future sell the cow for a good price to cover some of the household necessities.

Juan dreams of being able to have more cattle and that his children have a better future.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.en:
Constantina is a vendor from Calilic, Sibutad. She is 50 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that is adequate to support her family.

Constantina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Constantina continues to look for better business opportunities, which is proof that she has the passion and energy to successfully face challenges with courage for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Los G Group

texts.es:
En una región productora de caña de azúcar se ha formado un grupo llamado Los G, durante la temporada de zafra cuando la caña es cortada para ser transportada y procesada para obtener azúcar, quedan al descubierto algunos barrios que se encuentran ocultos. Uno de ellos es el lugar donde se ubica el grupo, cada integrante tiene una actividad distinta que además se localizan en la misma acera:

Carolina - Estetica
Brigida - Abarrotes
Cesar - Ciber
Daniela - Calzado Por Catalogo

Doña Brigida es una gran mujer, para sus hijos es el ejemplo a seguir; con el firme propósito de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa decidió iniciar desde hace ya 4 años con la venta de abarrotes con un poco de capital que sus hijos aportaron. De lunes a domingo las cortinas de la tienda se levantan a las 8:00 am y se bajan hasta las 9:00 pm, mientras Brigida se encarga de terminar las labores del hogar, su esposo es quien se encarga de la tienda.  

Con las ganancias obtenidas, el apoyo de sus hijos y la pensión de su esposo, la familia logró comprar un un auxiliar auditivo para su marido quien ha ido perdiendo el oído poco a poco. Es por esto que para Brigida es muy importante el apoyo de VisionFund porque ha podido incorporar más productos a su tienda ofreciendo con ello un mejor surtido a sus clientes. Por lo general reinvierte en los productos más solicitados: agua, aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijol, chiles enlatados, sazonadores, café, dulces, galletas, refrescos, leche, jugos, queso.

Un año antes de iniciar con la tienda de abarrotes Brigida tenía una lavandería la cual decidió cerrar por cuestiones de salud de su esposo pues no quería descuidarlo. Su mayor reto es continuar con su tienda pese a la gran competencia que hay en la comunidad y para lograrlo brinda a sus clientes un trato amable, “Mi meta será continuar con un buen historial crediticio para solicitar otro crédito y retomar la lavandería”.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el cybercafé de Cesar. Doña Brigida viste suéter rojo, falda floreada.
texts.en:
In a sugarcane-producing region, a group called Los G has been created. During the harvest season, when the cane is cut to be transported and processed to make sugar, some hidden neighborhoods are revealed. One of those neighborhoods is the place where the group is located. Each member has a different occupation, and they all are located on the same street.

Carolina – aesthetician 
Brigida – grocery sales
Cesar – cyber services
Daniela – footwear catalogues  

Brigida is a great woman. She is an example for her children. With the firm goal of helping her husband with the household expenses, 4 years ago she decided to start selling groceries with some capital that her children contributed. From Monday to Sunday, the shutters of the store come up at 8:00 AM and they don’t go down until 9:00 PM. While Brigida takes care of the household chores, her husband takes care of the store.

With the earnings she has obtained, the support of her children, and her husband’s pension, the family was able to buy a hearing aid for her husband who has been losing his hearing little by little. This is why, to Brigida, VisionFund’s support is very important, because she has been able to incorporate more products to her store, offering a better supply to her customers. Generally, she reinvests in the most demanded products: water, oil, rice, sugar, beans, canned chilies, seasonings, coffee, candy, cookies, soft drinks, milk, juice, and cheese.

A year before opening the grocery store, Brigida had a laundromat, which she decided to close due to her husband’s health, since she didn’t want to neglect him. Her biggest challenge is to continue with the store despite the high competition in the community. To overcome this challenge, she treats her customers in a friendly manner. She says, “My goal will be to continue to have a good credit history to request another loan to reopen the laundromat.”

*The photograph was taken in Cesar’s cybercafé. Brigid is wearing a red sweater and a floral skirt.

loans.use: to buy water, beans, rice, soup, sugar, ham, cheese, yogurt, cookies, Sabrita snacks, candy, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a widow from Oroquieta. She owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Unfortunately she almost lost her capital when her husband got a serious illness and passed away.  PMPC came to Lolita as a rescue to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase store inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase store inventory and use the loan as working capital

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife, 38 years old, is single. She lives with her parents in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. In order to earn income on her own and help her parents with their needs, she has found ways to attain profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store. It began with displaying a few inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar, a dozen of shampoo and soap. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in March of 2012. She became a member in good standing, which is why she has received her third loan. Now, she applied for 13,000 PHP to pay for additional merchandise for her store to draw more customers to buy in her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise for her store to draw more customers to buy in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting, and earned income as well. Delia has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Delia has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she could always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase vegetable seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings, and to pay for land preparation.  Someday Delia hopes to purchase more land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings, and to pay for land preparation

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.es:
María, de 71 años de edad, no pudo estudiar ya que sus padres eran personas de bajos recursos económicos, está acompañada, es madre de 4 hijos, pero todos están con sus familias.

María se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres desde la edad de 20 años, su trabajo está ubicado a un kilómetro de distancia, su hora de trabajo comienza a las 5:00 a.m y regresa a casa a las 9:00 a.m a seguir con el oficio de la casa.

María, está solicitando el crédito a CREDICAMPO para comprar dos vacas, con esto piensa poder mejorar la producción de leche, de esta forma ayudará a tener beneficios económicos.

María, sueña en poder mejorar su producción de ganado, para tener mejores beneficios económicos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
María, 71, couldn't go to school because her parents lacked the financial resources. She has a partner. She is the mother of four children, but they are with their own families.

María is an agricultural and cattle farmer; a job she learned from her parents when she was twenty years old. Her work is located one kilometer away and starts at 5:00am. She returns home at 9:00am, where she continues with the household chores.

María is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy two cows. With these, she thinks she will be able to improve milk production and thus, improve her economic benefits.

María dreams of improving her cattle production in order to have improved economic benefits to help out her family.

loans.use: buy two cows.

loans.name: Mirian Yeny

texts.es:
Mirian, de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta septimo grado, no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, debido a que sus padres no pudieron darle mayor estudio, está acompañada y es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales los tres están estudiando, uno está estudiando tercer grado, el segundo sexto grado y el tercero octavo grado.

Mirian, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años, trabajo que desempeña  junto con su compañero de vida, su trabajo está a una distancia de 5 kilómetros desde su casa, recorrido que lo realizan a pie y su horario comienza a las 5:00 a.m y regresan a las 12:00 p.m a seguir con sus tareas del hogar.

Mirian, esta solicitando el crédito a CREDICAMPO para comprar una bolsa de semilla, 5 sacos de abono, veneno y pago de mano de obra.

Mirian, sueña en poder tener ganancias en su cultivo.
texts.en:
Mirian, 34, studied up to grade seven. She didn't have the opportunity to continue studying as her parents couldn't afford to give her a higher education. She has a companion. She is the mother of three children, who all study: the first is in third grade, the second is in sixth grade and the third is in eighth grade.

Mirian has been an agricultural farmer for twelve years; she does the work with her life companion. Her work is five kilometers from home, a route she makes by foot. She starts at 5:00am and returns at 12:00pm to continue with the household chores.

Mirian is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy a bag of seeds, five bags of manure, poison and pay for manual labor.

Mirian dreams of being able to earn income from her crops.

loans.use: buy a bag of seeds, five bags of manure, poison and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is a farmer who dedicates himself to selling his cows' milk and producing bread. He decided to acquire a modular, resistant and flexible Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to replace the rustic, cement-based biodigester he used to work with. He is aware of the tremendous opportunity a biodigester represents, by generating not only renewable energy, but also a potent and organic fertilizer. Eugenio is looking forward to applying the nutrient-rich fertilizer on his corn field to grow it in a natural way, as well as to using the biogas to cook and heat water in the house, thereby displacing the expensive and unsustainable LP gas and chemical fertilizers. He wants to save money to keep his children in school, increase his herd of cows and buy more hogs without contaminating the environment. His children will grow up in a place where food production is no longer linked to fossil fuels.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 14-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Justino

texts.en:
Justino found out about Sistema Biobolsa through his friends, and was very interested in the opportunity to produce his own renewable energy and organic fertilizer. Indeed, the price of fossil fuel-based LP gas and chemical fertilizers is an important constraint on his finances, and significantly reduces his available income. By investing in his biodigester, Justino will not only save money by transforming his cows' manure into biogas and biofertilizer, but he will also protect the environment and improve his quality of life. Indeed, the waste he used to pile up outside the farm was contaminating underground water sources and emitting greenhouse gases, while his wife was cooking using wood, inhaling the toxic smoke on a daily basis. By connecting the biodigester to the cookstove and boiler in the house, LP gas and wood will become irrelevant and there will no longer be smoke in the house. In addition, Justino's corn field will grow stronger as he applies the nutrient-rich fertilizer on his plants, nourishing the soil in a sustainable way.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn and her husband earn a living from farming, as it is their family's primary source of income. They have a banana farm in Talairon, Oroquieta. 

Marlyn makes it a point to prepare the land so that it will generate the maximum yield possible. To ensure a good income, she is also planning to grow crops for additional earnings. She is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for irrigation costs and the purchase of a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their land. 

Marlyn hopes to increase her yield, sustain her business, and provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to pay for irrigation costs and to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow her land

loans.name: Esterluda

texts.en:
Esterluda has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in gardening and it allows her to earn money for her family. 

As a PMPC microfinance member, she is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell. In the future, Esterluda wishes to become the neighboring town's flower supplier.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell

loans.name: Nurcholpon

texts.ru: Нурчолпон 23 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. Она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Нурчолпон смогла развить свое хозяйство и полеводческую деятельность - на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 1 теленок, 12 овец, лошадь с жеребенком, а также есть земельный надел мерою 1,30 Га, на котором она ежегодно выращивает картофель, кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурчолпон обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Нурчолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en:
Nurcholpon is 23 and married with two children. She works in animal husbandry and agriculture and has been able to develop her farm and agricultural business. She currently has one calf, 12 sheep, a horse with a foal and 1.3 hectares of land where she grows annual harvests of corn and potatoes.

With the goal of further developing her business, Nurcholpon has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase livestock for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing the number of livestock on her farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Jorge Isaac

texts.es:
Él es Jorge un vendedor de comidas ambulantes, muy querido en su zona, las personas que trabajan alrededor saben quién es lo saludan y lo quieren, un aliciente muy grande para trabajar. 
Jorge es padre de 4 hijos y tiene 8 nietos, algunos de ellos los adopta casi como hijos pues sus padres no tiene el capital para alimentarlos y él solo, con su carro de supermercado que se ve en la foto que adecuo para transportar sus productos se genera el sustento para su hogar.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar dulces, frituras, galletas, refrescos.
Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Jorge is a traveling salesman and is a much loved figure in his neighborhood. The people who work here know who he is and always say hello and love him, which makes his work pleasurable. Jorge is the father of 4 children and has 8 grandchildren. Some of his grandchildren are like his own children because their parents do not have the money to feed them and care for them. And so he runs his supermarket from a stand that you can see in the photo that he uses to transport his products and make enough money to support his home. He is asking for a loan to purchase sweets, fried foods, cookies and sodas. His biggest dream is to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: purchase sweets, fried foods, cookies, and sodas.

loans.name: Enriquieta

texts.en: Enriquieta has started her small-time business and became profitable with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales since she is the only store in their barangay (village). Recently she approached Paglaum for her much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business to benefit her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

loans.name: Angelita

texts.es:
Angelita, de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, debido a la situacion económica de sus padres y no pudieron darle mayor estudio. está divorciada y es madre de tres hijos, de estos ya ninguno vive con ella, solo vive un primo con ella.

Angelita, desde hace unos 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, su trabajo está a una distancia de 3 kilómetrosy camina hasta llegar a ese lugar, su hora de trabajo comienza a las 5:30 a.m a esa hora ella comienza a realizar los oficios de la casa, luego va hasta su parcela, donde cultiva y regresa a las 12:00 a casa.

Angelita, está solicitando el crédito para comprar abono, veneno, semilla y otros insumos, para la siembra de 7,500 metros cuadrados y  ademas sacar adelante la siembra que ya tiene cultivada.

Angelita, sueña en poder tener ganancias en sus cultivos y poder tener un mayor ingreso económico.
texts.en:
Angelita, 54, studied up to grade six, due to her parent's economic situation and they couldn't afford to give her a higher education. She is divorced. She is the mother of three children, of whom none live with her, but a cousin does live with her.

For 30 years, Angelita has been an agricultural farmer; a job she learned from her parents. Her work is three kilometers away and she walks to get there. Her work schedule starts at 5:30a.m., which is the time she starts her household chores, afterwards, she goes her parcel of land where she cultivates and comes back home at 12:00p.m.

Angelita is requesting a loan to buy manure, poison, seeds and other items she needs in order to sow 7,500 square meters and also to care for the plants she has already cultivated.

Angelita dreams of generating earnings with her crops and receiving a bigger income.

loans.use: buy manure, poison, seeds and other items.

loans.name: Salud Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SALUD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Nancy Nicanora ella es soltera y tiene 61 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de tejidos , la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos . La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos . 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de productos de belleza. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members are part of the communal bank “SALUD” [Health]. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the Cusco province in the Cusco department. 

Nancy Nicanora is a member who is single, 61 years old, and has 2 children. She works in her fabric sales business. She sells different types of fabric. She works from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM. She has been in this line of business for 8 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her fabric sales business. She is requesting the loan to buy fabric.

The other members work in businesses such as clothing sales, artisanal goods sales, grocery sales, and beauty product sales. 

The member appreciates those who play a part in her dream through this medium, and she promises to make the loan payments during the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Thắng is 60 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Thắng operates a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp sauce. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Thắng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

In the future, Thắng hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 55 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is separated from her husband, and she has three adult children. Alma has been selling food supplements for five months, as a new line of business. She earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month from this business activity, which helps her to meet some of her needs. She has applied for a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of food supplement products for resale. Alma has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Alma hopes to become a major supplier in her area.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of food supplement products for resale.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en: Mely is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three adult children. Mely has been engaged in farming and in selling dried fish for ten years. Mely earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has applied for a loan to be used in purchasing commercial fertilizers and stocks of dried fish for her business activities. Mely has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Mely hopes to expand her dried fish vending business.

loans.use: to buy commercial fertilizers and stocks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: La Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Cerca del cerro donde los habitantes del lugar acudenn a pastorear su ganado o para reunir leña, un grupo de mujeres trabajadoras decidió solicitar un préstamo para iniciar o invertir en sus actividades, al grupo le pusieron por nombre “La Virgen De Guadalupe” por la fe de las integrantes. Hoy en día el grupo prevalece y está integrado por:

Laura -Transporte
Alejandra, María -Comida
Celia-Calzado Por Catalogo 

Desde hace 4 años que regresó a su lugar de origen después de haber cumplido el sueño americano, Laura ha trabajado en equipo con su esposo quien se dedica acarrear caña en temporada de corte mientras ella vende chiles rellenos, tamales, gelatinas, pasteles (por pedido), accesorios, ropa para niño y además renta tres máquinas de videojuegos que tiene en casa.

Para Laura, los préstamos han significado una gran diferencia en su vida ya que ha podido invertir y mantener todas las actividades que le ayudan a obtener las ganancias suficientes para solventar los gastos de sus dos hijas, una de 6 años y otra de 2.

El dinero prestado siempre lo ha invertido en sus negocios y en el mantenimiento del vehículo que utiliza su esposo para transportar la caña. Esta vez necesita comprar diesel, aceite, una batería (para el vehiculo) cinchos para asegurar la carga (caña), ropa y accesorios, para dar continuidad a las actividades.

“Soy la multi-actividades pues siempre ando vendiendo, reinvirtiendo las ganancias para obtener más ingresos, el trabajar en equipo con mi esposo es agradable, decidí estas actividades pues así no descuido a mi familia y estamos siempre juntos”. Laura hizo mención de algo muy importante pues tiene en mente iniciar con una pequeña papelería en un futuro.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el camino transitado por quienes van en busca de leña o a pastorear animales, Laura viste suéter gris y short negro.
texts.en:
Near the hill where the area’s inhabitants go to herd their livestock or to gather firewood, a group of hardworking women decided to request a loan to start or invest in their businesses. They named the group “La Virgen de Guadalupe” [The Virgin of Guadalupe] because of the members’ faith. Today, the group still prevails and its members are:

Laura – Transportation Business
Alejandra and María – Food Business
Celia – Footwear Catalogue Business

For the past 4 years, since she returned to her homeland after having achieved the American dream, Laura has worked in a team with her husband. He makes a living by transporting cane in the cutting season, while she sells stuffed peppers, tamales, gelatins, pastries (to order), accessories, and children’s clothing. She also rents three video game machines that she has in the house.

For Laura, the loans have made a big difference in her life, since she has been able to invest in and maintain all of the businesses that help her to obtain enough income to take care of expenses for her two daughters, one who is 6 years old and one who is 2.

She has always invested the money from the loans in her businesses and in maintenance for the vehicle that her husband uses to transport cane. This time she needs to buy diesel, oil, a battery (for the vehicle), metal bands to secure the cargo (cane), clothes, and accessories to be able to continue the businesses.

“I am always engaging in multiple businesses, since I am always selling, and reinvesting my earnings to obtain more income. Working with my husband is very nice. I decided on these businesses because, this way, I don’t have to neglect my family and we are always together,” she says. Laura mentioned something very important: she is thinking of starting a small stationary shop in the future. 

*The photograph was taken on the road travelled by those who go to look for firewood or to herd animals. Laura is wearing a grey sweater and black shorts.

loans.use: to buy diesel, oil, a battery (for the car), metal bands to secure cargo (cane), children’s clothes, tupperware, and knick-knacks.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: Venus is 52 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She does not have dependents. Venus sells processed foods, particularly longganisa (spicy sausages) and dried fish. She’s been engaged in this business for four years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from this type of business activity, which helps to meet her needs. She has applied for a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of longganisa and dried fish for resale. Venus has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, Venus hopes to establish her own longganisa and dried fish stall.

loans.use: buy additional stocks of longganisa (spicy sausage) and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde lives in Aloran, Philippines. She has been widowed for twenty years. To earn a living, Matilde manages her rice farm and raises hogs. Since she has been going this for two decades, she is a master at her job.

Matilde joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative to access insurance and credit. She is hardworking and determined to pursue her goals in order to sustain her needs. Matilde is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase production on her rice farm. She also plans to purchase additional piglets, animal feed, and vitamins. This will greatly help her boost her income. 

Someday, she hopes to buy a parcel of land to expand her rice farming activities and venture into the rice-retailing business. Matilde is now helping to support her grandson in obtaining a college education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, piglets, animal feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Aniliza

texts.en: Aniliza is 24 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as sugar, soft drinks, and shampoo, to sell. Aniliza has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from direct selling fruit juice drinks and personal products. Aniliza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as sugar, soft drinks, and shampoo, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Bebsie

texts.en: Bebsie is 30 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a  business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Bebsie has borrowed and repaid a loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for two years and also earns an income from selling pre-paid mobile phone loads, as a water retailer, and from providing motorcycle transport. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Margesis

texts.es:
Con el sueño de poder pagar sus estudios profesionales, Margenis una joven de 21 años de edad monto su negocio de comidas, donde fuera de su casa prepara fritos como empanas, buñuelos, pasteles, entre otros, ella es una mujer soltero, muy trabajadora y comprometida que en base a trabajo quiere mejorar su situación económica y ser la primera integrante de su familia que estudie una carrera.
Margenis con su negocio ira pagando su matrícula, y se auxiliara en los demás gastos como alimento, transporte y aportara para la casa, pero de momento su negocio no genera tantas ganancias por lo que se le ocurrió la idea de diversificar su oferta y lo quiere hacer a partir de un crédito el cual invertirá en bebidas, y otros insumos como carnes, arepas, e ingredientes para realizar nuevas preparaciones.
texts.en:
With the dream of paying for her professional studies, Margésis, a young 21-year old, started her own food business outside of her home. She prepares fried foods, like empanadas, buñuelos (a sweet fritter) and pastries, among others. She is single, hard-working and committed to the fact that at the base of this work, she'd like to improve her economic situation and be the first person in her family to study a professional career.

With her business, Margésis will pay her tuition and her other expenses, like food and transport and will bring home some income. However, for now, her business doesn't generate enough, which is why she came up with the idea to diversify her offerings. This she will do with the loan she is requesting, which she will invest in drinks and other supplies, like meat, arepas and ingredients to create new prepared foods.

loans.use: buy drinks, meat, arepas (cornmeal bread stuffed with meat or veggies) and condiments. She's looking to generate resources to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Hernan De Jesus

texts.es:
Hernán es un hombre sonriente, activo e inteligente que aprendió del negocio de taller de mecánica gracias a un amigo que le enseño los gajes del oficio, es padre de 2 hijas ya mayores de edad y su propósito para este año es mejorar las condiciones de vivienda y actualizarse en temas de mecánica ya que su conocimiento y procedimiento es muy empírico.
Con la ayuda de un crédito quiere comprar herramientas, pulidora, taladro, y juego de llaves ya que no cuenta con estos objetos que son tan necesarios en un taller.
Este crédito le permitirá ir cumpliendo sus propósitos de este año poco a poco e ir acoplando su negocio para brindar un mejor y más óptimo servicio.
texts.en: Hernán is a happy man, active and intelligent. He learned to run his mechanic's garage thanks to a friend who trained him. He is the father of 2 daughters who are adults now. He hopes to improve his living conditions and to up date his mechanic's knowledge this year since he has mostly on the job training. With the help of the loan, he wants to purchase hand tools, a polishing machine, a drill, a wrench set and other necessary items. The loan will help him to achieve his goals for the year little by little and to supply his business so he can offer a better service.

loans.use: purchase hand tools, a polishing machine, a drill, a wrench set and other needed items.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es un joven soltera de 23 años de edad, responsable, juiciosa y comprometida que se dedica a la venta de suvenires, los cuales distribuye en eventos, ferias o incluso en latas horas de la noche.
Al estar próximo festivales y eventos simbólicos donde se usa esta prenda típica, Daniela quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de inventario de sombreros, intentando sacar el mayor beneficio de estos y buscando ayudar en su hogar para que se mejores su condiciones y poder montar un almacén de suvenires que es su gran propósito para este año 2015
texts.en: Daniela is a young woman who is 23 years old. She is responsible, judicious and dedicated to her souvenir business. She sells souvenirs at events, festivals or in late-night celebrations. As the festival season approaches, she will be able to sell her products. She wants to ask for a loan in order to purchase inventory, especially hats, trying to take advantage of demand and hoping to improve her living conditions and to open a souvenir store, which is her ultimate goal for 2015.

loans.use: purchase hats to sell at festivals and cultural events.

loans.name: Esmeralda De Jesús

texts.es:
Esmeralda, de 60 años de edad, no pudo estudiar debido a la situacion económica de sus padres, es viuda y madre de tres hijos, de ellos nadie vive con ella, solo una nieta que recién acaba de terminar el noveno grado.

Esmeralda, se dedica a la agricultura, desde hace 20 años, después que su esposo murió, tuvo la obligación de hacerle frente a la situación para sacar adelante a su familia.- Tambien, se dedica a la venta de tamales de elotes, camina alrededor de 3 kilómetros desde su casa, su hora de trabajo comienza a las 5:30 a.m a hacer los quehaceres del hogar, luego se traslada a su parcela y regresa a las 11:30 a.m a su casa a seguir con los oficios.

Esmeralda, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y para pagar el arrendamiento del terreno para sembrar 7,500 metros cuadrados.

Esmeralda, desea que la cosecha sea buena y tener buenos ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 60, was not able to study due to her parents economic situation. She is widowed and a mother of three children. None of them live with her. 
Her granddaughter lives with her who just finished ninth grade. 

Esmeralda has worked in agriculture for the past 20 years. After her husband died she had to cope with the obligation of taking care of her family. 

She also sells corn tamales. 

She walks about 3 km from her house. She starts working at 5:30 am doing chores around the house, then she goes to her parcel of land and returns at 11:30am and keeps working. 

Esmeralda is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for the lease of the land so she can sow 7,500 cubic meters. 

Esmeralda hopes for a good harvest and to make a good income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for the lease of the land.

loans.name: Roribel

texts.en:
Roribel sends you thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had strenghened her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers are more likely to buy items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result fin her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Roribel also wants to give her children a better life in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Elvie Grace

texts.en:
Elvie Grace is 36 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like coffee, milk, sugar, etc. to sell.

Elvie Grace has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like coffee, milk, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from retail food, and direct selling Avon and personal products. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, potatoes, arepas [savory corn pastries] and a bigger barbecue.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Ella es María una mujer que entrego todo para que su familia progresa, durante su juventud fue muy trabajadora y comprometida, pero por el nacimiento de sus dos hijas realizo un retiro laboral para cuidarlas y criarlas.
Al ver hoy a su familia, ya sus hijas son grandes quiere reactivar su propia economía con un negocio de venta de mercancía como accesorios y ropa para hombre y mujer, con la ayuda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de indumentaria para hombre y mujer quiere solventar las necesidad económicas presentes en su hogar y darle a su hija mayor el dinero para pagar la matrícula universitaria. 
Ayuda a una ex trabajadora a seguir apoyando a sus hijas para que sean una profesionales.
texts.en:
She is María; a woman who gives her all so her family can move forward. During her youth, she was hard-working and committed, but with the birth of her two daughters, she retired from work to raise and take care of them.

Seeing her family today, her daughters are grown, and she'd like to reactivate her own income by opening a business. With the help of a loan, she'd like to sell merchandise, like accessories and clothing for men and women. She'd invest the loan in clothing for men and women.

She'd like to solve the present economic needs of her household and give her eldest daughter the money she needs to pay for her university tuition.

Help an ex-worker continue supporting her daughters so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: buy a variety of clothing for men and women, like shirts, skirts, coats and pants.

loans.name: Wilfredo Andres

texts.es:
Wilfrido es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio monto un negocio de café internet, como es un negocio que está en constante actualización, donde sacan nuevas máquinas y nuevas películas que cada día tienen un costo más elevado.
Wilfrido necesita actualizarse e ir pidiendo lo que sus clientes solicitar, de momento necesita un Xbox y un tv de alta definición para que disfruten más el juego y por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de estos dos equipos y con el resto del capital comprara surtido de papelería para tener buen material para trabajar el resto del año y atender la temporada escolar.
Su objetivo es complacer a los clientes, brindarles un espacio sano de distracción y generar ingresos para su hogar propio.
texts.en:
Wilfrido is a very responsible an hard working man who with much effort and sacrifice started an internet cafe. 

As this is a business that constantly needs to be updated, where new machines and movies come out every day, it has a higher cost. 

Wilfredo needs to stay up to date and get what his clients request. Currently he needs an Xbox, a high definition TV so they enjoy the game more. 

He is requesting a loan to buy these two pieces of equipment. 

With the rest of the money he will buy paper goods to have good materials for the rest of the year and to handle the school year. 

His goal is to keep his clients happy, provide them with healthy space for distraction and generate income for his own home.

loans.use: to buy a TV and an Xbox so he can offer a new service at his internet cafe.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.
