Fatima has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As the widowed parent of seven children, Letecia works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring shop in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store. Letecia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional materials like thread, needle, fabrics, etc. for her tailoring shop.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like thread, needle, fabrics, etc. for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
A married parent of two children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a bakery. She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ada Isabel

texts.es:
Humildad, fortaleza, emprendedurismo, son los valores que acompañan a doña Ada Isabel, que con la venta de tortillas, frijoles y nacatamales  ha podido sacar a delante a sus hijas. Ella es un ejemplo de lucha  y perseverancia,  pues ahora es propietaria de un molino donde a diario prepara las deliciosas tortillas, que no pueden faltar en la mesa de los nicaragüenses.

Con el crédito otorgado, doña Ada, invertirá en la compra de maíz, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, arroz, frijoles, que son la materia prima para preparar sus productos. Así, espera poder aumentar sus ventas y ofrecer más productos como rosquillas, cuajadas y queso.  Con las ganancias, quiere construir su vivienda y seguir proporcionando un hogar seguro y digno para sus hijas.
texts.en:
Humility, strength, and entrepreneurship are the values that accompany Ada Isabel. By selling tortillas, beans, and tamales, she has been able to help her daughters get ahead. She is an example of struggle and perseverance. She is now the owner of a mill where, everyday, she prepares delicious tortillas, which are a must at the table for Nicaraguans.

With the loan, Ada will invest in the purchase of corn, sweet pepper, onions, tomatoes, rice, and beans, which are the raw materials needed to prepare her products. This way, she hopes to be able to increase her sales and offer more products such as donuts, milk curds, and cheese. With the earnings, she wants to build her home and continue providing a safe and respectable home for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy corn, sweet pepper, onions, tomatoes, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 72 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like noodles, sardines, soap, etc. to sell.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 20 years and also earns income from rice retailing. Virginia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles, sardines, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel, de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, debido a la situación económica, no pudo continuar estudiando, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es padre de dos hijos.  

Fidel, se dedica a la venta de pan, este trabajo lo realiza de hace seis años, oficio que aprendió debido a que no tenia una fuente de ingreso segura.- La venta de pan la hace en motocicleta, también, trabaja en la agricultura, su día de trabajo comienza a las 4:00 de la madrugada y finaliza a las 4:00 p.m, a esa hora regresa de su parcela cultivada.

Fidel, está solicitando el crédito en CREDICAMPO para comprar dos vacas lecheras, esto ayudará a mejorar su situación económica.
 
Fidel, sueña en poder tener su casa propia donde poder vivir y poder cancelar el crédito sin ningún problema para seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Fidel is 29 years old and studied up to the third grade.  Due to the economic situation, he couldn't  continue studying.  He is married and the father of two children.  His wife looks after the household.

Fidel works selling bread.  He has done this work for six years, a trade that he learned because he didn't have a secure source of income.  He sells the bread by motorcycle.  He also works in agriculture.  His work day begins at 4:00 in the morning and ends at 4:00 PM.  At that time he returns to his cultivated piece of land.

Fidel is asking for this loan from CrediCampo to buy two dairy cows.  This will help him to improve his economic situation.
 
Fidel's dream is to be able to have his own home where he is able to live and to be able to pay off the loan without any problem in order to continue working with this institution.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Mathius

texts.en:
Mathius is a hardworking man, age 40, hailing from the village of Nyarubungo Bukiro, Kashari in the Mbarara district. He is a repeat borrower who has borrowed over 10 loans from UGAFODE. Mathius started in a group and later graduated to getting individual loans, which have helped him meet his needs like finishing his house, buying a new motorcycle, and also improving his agriculture business.

Mathius is one of the best farmers in Kashari who benefits from government programs related to agriculture and has managed to put his children in good schools. But sometime back, his plantation was affected by hail storms and he could not yield quality bananas. They are currently replanting and the plantation needs manure in order to regain its lost glory and have good yields. So, Mathius has come to UGAFODE for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy manure like cow dung and mulch to spread on his banana plantation. This will help him to increase his yield and sales. He is grateful to UGAFODE for the consistency in financial support.

loans.use: To buy cow dung and mulch to spread on his banana plantation

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a hard-working lady, age 27, from Kisenyi in the Kakoba division of the Mbarara district. She got married at the age of 20. Joan and her husband were together for some years and produced four children (twins and two others). Later, her husband was in an accident and died, so she had no source of income. But her husband had bought a banana plantation, which Joan is trying to improve so as to have income to educate her children. She later saved some money and built a commercial house such that she could earn income to meet her family needs.

Joan is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to add manure and mulch and to employ labor to increase matooke output. She is a hardworking young woman committed to changing the status of her family.

loans.use: To buy organic manure and mulch and to hire labor

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en:
Almaz is a 43-year-old married woman with two beautiful kids and she lives in Sabirabad. Her children are school boys. She is a cheerful woman. Her husband works in a local bazar. Almaz has been growing vegetables and fruits on her land. She sells her crops to her neighbors and all her neighbors prefer to buy from Almaz. She easily makes contact with clients and sells cheaper than others. Her monthly income is 170 manat, which isn't enough to allow her to live well. She wants to improve her business, but a lack of water makes her business unproductive.

Almaz decided to solve her problem by buying a water pump and laying water to her garden. For this, she applied for a loan of 1500 AZN from Kiva. This is her first loan.
 
   .

loans.use: to buy a water pump to water her garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Marziyya

texts.en:
Marziyya is a 54 year old woman. She is married and has two children, one boy and one girl. They live in Sabrabad. Her husband is an old man who sometimes falls ill. That is why Marziyya works alone in the family. It is difficult for her to provide for her family by herself. She is a hardworking woman. All her life she has been working in the agriculture sector. Marziyya has  been growing peach and apricot trees on her land  for a long time. Her monthly income is 140 manat. It is not enough for her to buy food for her family. Now she needs to construct a water canal on her land. She wants to increase her harvest.
She applied for 1500 AZN from Kiva. It is her first loan. Marziyya hopes lenders help her.

loans.use: to construct a water canal on her land.

loans.name: Irada

texts.en:
Irada is 46 years old and she is married with two children. Her husband is a gardener. Her kids study at school. They live in an old house with no bath house. Irada works as a cooker in a wedding hall. She cooks tasty meals. Her monthly income is 160  manat.
She only buys food with this money. She always wants to repair her home.
She feels it is hard to solve family problems with less money. 
Irada needs to construct water for her home and build a bath house. In the summer it is more difficult to live without a bath house.
She requested 800 AZN from Aqroinvest Credit union. It is her first loan.

loans.use: to construct water for her home and build a bath house.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all her children go to school.
She takes take of one additional family member.

Rebecca sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges includes seasonality and transportation.

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land . She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maurin Cris

texts.en:
Maurin Cris is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Maurin Cris has been in this business for two years and earns more income from buying and selling pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a 51-year-old widow with nine children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Melinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melinda has been raising pig for six years and also earns income from buying and selling frozen products. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Milca

texts.en:
Milca is 62 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like rice, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

Milca has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like rice, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Bunyoro Tourism And Environment Conservation Progr Group

texts.en:
Charles is a married man of 51 years who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He earns his income from photo taking and farming. Charles is hoping to grow his business and educate his children despite the challenges of unexpected weather and seasonal changes hindering his dream. 

Charles intends to use this loan to buy maize seeds for planting. He is a member of the Bunyoro Tourism and Environmental Conservation Program where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds for planting

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is a married man, aged 38 years, with three children. He lives in Kyenjojo Uganda. John Bosco is a hard working man who deals in buying and selling of produce, mainly beans. He also owns a public address music system as a source of additional income to meet his personal needs. John Bosco faces challenges of a small capital base and poor roads that hinder his business growth. His dream is to own a big and fully stocked produce store to meet the demands of his customers.

Johnbosco needs a loan to buy more beans to sell for better discounts from his suppliers.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a hardworking, married man.  He is 42 years old, has six children, and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in produce in a rural area to meet his family's needs. He faces challenges of price fluctuation and a small capital base. 

Sulaiman is requesting a loan to buy more stock of G nuts and beans to sell in order to educate his children using the proceeds.

loans.use: to buy more stock of G nuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika is age 27, married, and she has three children. She lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Monika is a hardworking lady who mainly deals in trading produce and is a commercial farmer. She operates her business in a rural area where the cost of rent is low and transports her produce to urban centers for selling. She faces challenges of a low capital base and price fluctuations. Monika is requesting a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a retailer aged 32 years with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop selling a variety of household items. He started this business to look after his family, however, he is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital. Moses is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise like soap and sugar to sell and become a whole seller in his trading center.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who does business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional basket of vegetables to sell in her business.

Nelsie has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional basket of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 36 years old, a resident of Kazo (a central a suburb of the Wakiso district), and he is married with seven children, all of whom attend school.

Fred deals in a business of plumbing materials. His previous loan of UGX 3,000,000 helped him to boost his business and increase his sales and profits. He also repaid it well. Now, Fred wants another loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy more stock for his business to meet the demands of his customers and also increase his profits. His customers are people from various areas. He faces challenges of inadequate capital and competitors in the market. Fred is an experienced and hardworking man who wants to provide a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy pipes to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz Eliana

texts.es:
Un nuevo año significa nuevas cosas y así lo toma la señora Yomaira quien cree mucho en agüeros, ella mediante un crédito quiere solventar una necesidad latente en su peluquería la cual es Pintar, remodelar, cambiar luces, decoración, y adecuaciones en el baño.
La razón de este cambio es que ha visto en su negocio esta necesidad y ya que se envuelve en un medio donde tiene que demostrar a través de su imagen la calidad de trabajo que necesita hacer, pues todo entra por los ojos.
Con este préstamo espera tener un gran impacto en cuanto a mejora de ventas, mayor flujo de clientes, tener sostenibilidad del negocio al no dejarse vencer por la competencia, y mejorar su punto de venta.
Con tu ayuda Yomaira puede hacer ver su salón de belleza más estético para su público, aumentando sus ventas para llevar más recursos a su hogar donde esperan sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
A new year means new things and this is how Yomaira is thinking about it. She believes in omens. 

Through a loan she wants to improve her salon by painting, remodeling, change lights, redecorate and update the bathroom. 

The reason for wanting these changes is that she wants to update her surroundings in order to show the quality of her business since these changes will be very visible. 

With this loan she hopes to have a big impact on improving her sales, more clientele, a sustainable business which does not get beat by her competition and improve her point of sales. 

With your help Yomira can improve the aesthetics of her salon to the public, increase her sales so she can bring more income home to her two children.

loans.use: to paint, do remodeling, change lights, decorate and make adjustments to the bathroom.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man who owns a salon and a video library business and is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. His business serves both rural and urban people. He hopes to build a house using the profits from his business. He is faced with a challenge of buying modern equipment for his salon business so as to attract more customers and meet their demands. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy salon equipment like a hair cutting machine, among others.

loans.use: to buy salon equipments like a hair cutting machine, among others.

loans.name: Francisco Miguel

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 56 años que inicio empíricamente y por necesidad económica su tienda donde oferta productos de la canasta familiar, se encontrada desempleado y preocupado y con uno pequeños ahorros compro suministros y con el paso del tiempo fue abasteciendo conforme se veían los resultados.
Tiene una familia conformada por 3 hijas y su pareja, un sueño marcado de mejorar su negocio y su vivienda propia y un gran  espíritu  por trabajar, pues este hombre labora entre 12 y 14 horas solo para generar los recursos necesarios para el sustento de su familia.
Francisco Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en productos lácteos, arroz, huevos, mantequilla, queso, refrescos, frijol, sal, panela etc.
texts.en:
56-year-old Francisco opened his convenience store where he sells basic products due to his financial needs. He was jobless and worried, and with his small savings bought supplies to open the store. Over time, he increased the stock as he started seeing results. 

His family is formed by his partner and their three daughters. His dream is to improve his business and his home. He has a hardworking spirit, as he works between 12 and 14 hours per day to make the necessary income to support his family. 

Francisco is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as dairy products, rice, eggs, butter, cheese, soft drinks, beans, salt, brown sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, rice, eggs, butter, cheese, soft drinks, beans, salt, and brown sugar, as his business is growing.

loans.name: Kitooro Nateete Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a group member and group executive of the Kitooro Nateete group. She is 33 with two children ages one and six. She is married and lives in Nateete central.
She runs a cosmetics shop at the market, a business she has been running for seven years. She decided to take the loan to increase capital in the business of which she has experience.
In the business, she is faced with challenges of competitors dealing in the same business. With the experience in the business and with plans to expand it she will beat this competition. The client is the one with her hand raised in the photo.
The group members are grateful for the support. The sixth person on the right is the UGAFODE CREDIT OFFICER in charge of the group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and both go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 9 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, and flour. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, and flour.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is a 25 year old man. He is married and has two sweet kids. He lives in a small house with his family. His wife works in a kindergarten as a nurse. Arif   has been repairing cars for three years.
Arif is a good car master. His monthly profit is 180 manat. But this income is not enough for him. He has a water problem at his home. They carry water with a bucket from a neighbor.
Arif wants to construct water for his home and make a fence. He needs to support his family so he has requested 1100 AZN from Kiva. It is his first loan.

loans.use: to construct water for his home and make a fence.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 49 years old and lives in Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is earning a living through buying and selling various commodities to the local community. As a mother, she believes education is a key to succeed in life.  Edna hopes to provide her family needs, especially her children's education. With the loan of Php 15,000, she will be able to pay for the tuition and graduation costs of her daughter. She wants all her children to finish their studies and have stable jobs.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition and graduation costs of her daughter

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en: Antonina is married and lives in Oroquieta, Philippines. She is married with four children. Antonina is engaged in the retailing business where she buys merchandise in bulk for retail. She has had this business for more than a decade and has employed two people for this business. She requested a loan to pay for the pawned cocoland for her desired farming project. The income from her business will be the pay off to the loan she requested from PMPC. She has been a member of PMPC for a year already. In the future, Antonina hopes to have a good standard of living for her family and adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to pay for the pawned cocoland for her desired farming project

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is has been a widow for 13 years. She has three children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for many years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase additional stocks and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en: Nely is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is a widow and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Nely is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Nely continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en:
Peruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and three go to school. She is not looking after any other member of her family.

She operates a food stall at the market . She sells on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years, working seven days a week. Her challenges include seasonality. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes. Her dream is to increase on the stock of food she sells. She joined MCDT because it is not costly to join the organization.

She rents a house with access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.
.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a hardworking mother from Oroquieta. She is married and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Eva has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Eva hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production).

loans.name: Sumayiya

texts.en:
Sumayiya lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children and 5 of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member.

Sumayiya sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and start farming to supplement her income. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sumayiya

texts.en:
Sumayiya is a single mother of four children and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

She has the business of a restaurant and has been in this business for 1 year. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a fridge so she can start selling cold drinks. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters.

She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a fridge

loans.name: Nancy Maria

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer del campo, criado con sus buenas costumbres y creencias, es una mujer de tan solo 33 años de edad, pero con una gran responsabilidad sus 7 hijos de 12, 10, 16, 14, 7 años que son difíciles de mantener pues no posee un trabajo que le brinde suficiente capital para vestirlos, darles educación, alimentación digna, pero con su venta de alimentos realizada a fuego de leña  haga logrado valerse para que por lo menos tenga la oportunidad de estudiar y comer.
Para entregar sus productos tiene que realizar largos desplazamientos, cargando en bolsas que pueden regar sus alimentos, también para ir por los insumos es bastante difícil pues lleva a sus hijos mayores y entre todos traen todo en incomodas bolsas.
Nancy quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de un carreta para transportar sus almuerzos y traer los insumos desde el mercado, con el resto del capital quiere comprar materia prima para realizar alimentos.
texts.en:
Nancy is a country girl. She was raised with good manners and beliefs. She's only 33 years old and has a big responsibility: her seven children. Her children are ages 12, 10, 16, 14 and 7 and it's been difficult to financially support them as she doesn't have a job that brings in enough to dress them, educate them or feed them in a dignified manner.

But with her business of selling prepared foods cooked over firewood, she has been able to find validation and at least give them the opportunity to study and eat.

To deliver her prepared foods, she needs to cover long distances carrying bags which can spill the food. Also, to go and buy the ingredients is difficult enough, so she takes her oldest children with her, to help her bring everything back in bags that are uncomfortable to carry.

Nancy is requesting a loan to buy a cart to transport her prepared foods and groceries from the market, and with the rest of the capital she'll buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.use: buy a cart to transport her prepared foods, and the groceries to make them, as she has to cover long distances and this would save her the physical effort.

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.es:
Belarmina es una trabajadora, comprometida, nacida con en una familia humilde, es madre de 5 hijos, y junto con su pareja conforman una familia muy unida en la que todos se apoyan.
Una tienda ubicada en su hogar representa los ingresos, es atendida por Belarmina en la mañana, y por su pareja en la tarde noche.
El aliciente de esta tienda es que es una de las pocas ubicadas en este sector, pues es muy completa y acuden a comprar todos sus productos, pero todavía les falta, necesitan 8un congelador para iniciar a vender productos de refrigeración como carnes frías, leche, quesito, jugos, refrescos etc., por lo que solicita un considerable monto para la compra de un refrigerador, una nevera, y surtido para así poder brindarle a la comunidad un servicio más completo.
Su propósito es que sus hijos estudien para que no les toque la vida de bajo recursos que en el momento están pasando.
texts.en:
Belarmina is a hard worker who is engaged. She is born into a humble family and is a mother of 5 children. 

Along with her partner they make up a very united family where everyone supports each other. 

She earns an income through a store located in her house. Belarmina works there in the mornings and her partner works there in the afternoons and nights. 

The attraction of this store is that it is one of the few stores located in this neighborhood. It is a very complete and they buy all their products but they are still missing some products.

They need a freezer so they can start selling refrigerated products such as cold cuts, milk, cheese, juices, sodas etc. 

They are requesting a substantial amount to buy a refrigerator, a freezer and supplies in order to offer the community a more complete service. 

Her goal is that her children study so that they do not face a life of poverty which is currently what is happening.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, a freezer and supplies in order to offer the community a more complete service.

loans.name: Istmenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Istmenia es una mujer de gran corazón, carisma de 56 años de edad, es soltera, sin hijos lo único que tiene es este pequeño que llena de alegría su corazón y el cual adopto como suyo.
No cuenta con una pensión solo con sus habilidades culinarias para generar el sustento de ella y del pequeño,  su principal actividad es cocinar fritos, como pasteles, empanadas, papas rellenas, arepas de carne salchichón, chorizo.
Su negocio nació por necesidad económica, ante la poca suerte de conseguir un empleo, pero tuvo gran suerte pues al estar trabajando en su hogar fue que llego esa criatura que ha llenado de gozo su vida.
Istmenia se ha trazado el objetivo de generar recursos para darle una buena calidad de vida al pequeño, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina que de momento necesita, comprar materia prima para realizar los alimentos descritos anteriormente, los insumos serian carne, harina, aceite y  variedad de vegetales.
texts.en: Istmenia is a woman with a big heart and charisma. She is 56 years old and single. She did not have children of her own; she only has this small adopted child who fills her heart with happiness. She does not have a pension. It is only with her cooking abilities that she generates income for her and her small child. Her main job is to make fried food such as cakes, "empanadas", stuffed potatoes, sausage and meat "arepas" (flour cakes). She started her business because of financial need, since she was not able to find a job. However, she was very lucky that while she was working at home she got this baby who has filled her life with happiness. Istmenia's goal is to generate resources in order to give a good quality of life to her child. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients which she needs to prepare the above mentioned foods. These ingredients are meat, flour, oil and a variety of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, flour, oil, vegetables for making empanadas, cakes, donuts, among others.

loans.name: Noong Het 11 Group

texts.en:
Sinh, 43, lives in an old Thai traditional house with her husband and her two sons, along with a daughter-in-law and a grandchild. Agricultural production is the main activity that generates income for her family, which includes cultivating rice and raising pigs, chickens and buffalo. Her first-born son has learned to earn a driving license for an excavator while the second one stays at home and supports the family with agricultural production. 

Sinh wants to expand their animal husbandry to improve her family's income so that she could afford to upgrade the house and send her second child to the vocational school. This is the first time she has received a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use it to buy piglets and food for the pigs. Sinh hopes the investment will help her gain high profit. In the picture, she stands on the first row, at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs.

loans.name: Dembe Nateete Group

texts.en:
Jawe is a group member and group executive of Dembe group. She is 51 years old with four children aged 27, 25,16,and 10 years. She is a widow and lives in Nateete central.
She runs a restaurant at the Nateete market which she has been running for eight years. She decided to take the loan because of her family and to increase capital in the business. She will use the loan to buy utensils and food items for the restaurant.
The competitors dealing in the food business are one of her major challenges but with her experience in the business and with plans to expand, she will beat all the odds to progress. 
The client is the one with her hand raised in the photo.

loans.use: to buy utensils and food items.

loans.name: Jhan Carlos

texts.es:
El empuje, ganas de trabajar, de progresar que resalta el joven Jhan, de tan solo 19 años, padre de una hermosa hija de 2 añitos de edad, y se dedica a la ebanistería en un local que el mismo construyo y en el cual trabaja.
Sus conocimientos de Ebanistería los aprendió de su padre y con él busca sacar a su familia adelante siendo su propósito que nunca les falte nada.
Jhan quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de madera, rociadores, lijas, taladro que necesita para su negocio, donde espera que florezca en este 2015.
Su sueño es poder tener una vivienda propia y vivir feliz junto con su hija y pareja.
texts.en:
The drive, the desire to work and to progress makes the young man Jhan, only 19 years old, stand out.  He is the father of a beautiful 2-year-old-daughter.  He does cabinetmaking/woodworking at premises that he built himself and from which he works.

He learned cabinetmaking from his father and with him he looks to support his family, his purpose being that they never lack for anything.

Jhan wants to ask for a loan to buy wood, sprays, sandpaper, and drill that he needs for his business that he hopes flourishes in 2015.

His dream is to be able to have his own home and to live happily with his daughter and his partner.

loans.use: to buy wood, sprays, sandpaper and drill to supply his cabinetmaking workshop

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is married with six children and two go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother).

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 1 year. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from selling chicken. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

She would like to get a permanent business location to stop moving from one place to another selling her merchandise. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 4 children and all of them attend school. She is also looking after her father.

She has been selling green bananas at retail at the market for the last 4 years, working seven days a week. She also does some farming and sells the farm produce in order to earn more income. 

Ruth has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas. 

Her dream is to upgrade from retail to wholesale, supplying other kinds of farm produce from her own farm. She joined MCDT because of timely loans.
 
She and her husband live in a rented house with access to electricity but no access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children.

She has been selling green bananas, tomatoes, cabbages and onions at retail in the market for the last three years, working seven days a week. She also does some farming and sells the farm produce in order to earn more income. 

Rosemary has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas, cabbages, tomatoes and onions.

Her challenges include thieves and seasonality. Her dream is to upgrade from retail to wholesale, supplying other kinds of farm produce from her own farm. 

She joined MCDT because of timely loans.
 
She lives in a rented house where she has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cabbages, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Sauya

texts.en:
Sauya lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and one of them attends school. She has no additional family members.

She and her husband live in a rented house with no access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

Sauya has been selling fish at retail in the market for three years, working seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to stock more fish. Her major business challenges are transportation and the perishability of fish.

Her dream is to buy a fridge to keep her fish fresh. She joined MCDT because of timely loans.

loans.use: To stock more fish.

loans.name: Kalicha

texts.ru: Калича, 55 лет, замужем, 4 детей. Образование - среднее. На протяжении 22 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, у нее есть 2,0 ГА земельного надела, где выращивает кукурузу и клевер. Всю самостоятельно выращенную продукцию, она реализует. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 35 овец и 2 лошади. Калича на сегодняшний день успешный предприниматель, она получает ежемесячную прибыль около 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калича обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. На доходы от кредита Калича планирует улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Kalicha is 55 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary education.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for the past 22 years.  She currently has three cows, 35 sheep and two horses.  She also owns two hectares of land on which she grows corn and clover, and she sells her entire crop production.  Kalicha is a successful entrepreneur.  She makes a monthly income of about 25,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy some heifers to increase her cattle headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to purchase heifers in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Almakul

texts.ru: Алмакул, 53 года, замужем, 4 детей. У Алмакул средне-специальное образование, она занимается торговлей кондитерских изделий, напитков, мыло-моющие изделия, игрушек и прочего в арендованном торговом павильоне. На сегодняшний день она имеет очень хороший бизнес. Прибыль от деятельности Алмакул составляет примерно 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товара для увеличения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита Алмакул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Almakul is 53 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary specialized education.  She rents a retail outlet in which she sells confectionery items, beverages, toys, soaps, cleaning products and other goods.  Her business is currently doing very well, and she makes an income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy more merchandise and increase her inventory.  Almakul is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase products for retail in order to increase her inventory and attract more customers.

loans.name: Joel Isai

texts.es:
Joel, de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, es casado, su esposa se dedica a oficios domésticos, actualmente tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos estudian y la otra hija está recién nacida, solo ellos viven en casa y todos dependen de él.

Joel, es un albañil muy experto, desde hace 10 años se dedica a este oficio, aprendió la albañilería a causa de la situación económica de su familia, anteriormente, él se dedicaba a la agricultura, sembraba maíz, frijoles, maicillo y algunas hortalizas. Su trabajo casi siempre es lejos de su casa, ya que le contratan de otros lugares para construcción de viviendas.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar hierro, bloques, clavos y madera para ampliar más su vivienda, el crédito mejorará su calidad de vida ya que el construirá y tendrá más espacio para convivir y jugar con sus pequeños.

Joel, sueña en el futuro poder tener una vivienda más grande, también sacar adelante a sus hijos para que estudien, hasta que sean profesionales, también, apoyarles a construir sus viviendas cuando ellos formen su hogar.
texts.en:
Joel is 35 years old and studied through the eighth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the household duties. They currently have four children, three of whom are in school. The other daughter was recently born. Joel and his family live at home by themselves and all of his children are dependent on him.

Joel is an expert bricklayer and has been in this trade for 10 years. He learned masonry as a result of his family’s financial situation. Joel previously worked in agriculture. He grew corn, beans, sorghum, and a few vegetables. His work always takes him far from home since he is able to obtain house construction jobs in other places.

This loan will be used to buy iron, blocks, nails, and wood so that he can expand his own home. It will also improve his quality of life since he will be able to build and provide more space where his young children can live and play.

Joel dreams of having a larger home in the future. He also wants his children to succeed in their studies so that they can become professionals. In addition, he wants to build homes for them when they start their families.

loans.use: to buy iron, blocks, nails, and wood so that he can expand his home.

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзада успешно погасила свой кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Бизнес Айзады приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере примерно 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 12 овец. Она по-прежнему выращивает в парнике экологически чистые помидоры, перец и капусту. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку клеенки для парника и семян овощей. Айзада является лидером группы "Замир", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их четверо. Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Aizada successfully paid off her last loan. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who offered her financial support. Her business brings in a monthly profit of about 20,000 KGS, and she currently has two cows and 12 sheep on her farm. As before, she grows organic tomatoes, peppers and cabbage in a hothouse.

With the goal of further developing her business, Aizada has again turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase vegetable seeds and oilcloth for her hothouse. She is the leader of the Zamir group, which besides herself includes three other people. She plans to put profits from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and oilcloth for her hothouse in order to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Fama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011,il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village,elles sont solidairement responsable du remboursement de leur crédit.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Bigué qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 28 ans et mére de 06 enfants dont 04 garçons,le plus âgé a 16 ans et le plus petit a 10 mois.

Son activité est le commerce sucre,de riz,d'huile et des ingrédients comme le piment et les oignons.

Elle compte acheter avec l'argent du crédit:01 sac de sucre à 16000f le sac,01 sac de riz à 14000f,01 bidon d'huile à 15000f,04 sacs d'arachide à 10000f le sac,des ingrédients pour 20000f.

Son objectif est de faire de l'embouche bovine,augmenter son épargne et contribuer à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011. It is composed of women living in the same village. They are cooperatively responsible for repaying their loan. Their main business is retail. 

Bigué, to the right with her arm raised in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is twenty-eight years old, married, and a mother of six children, including four boys. Her oldest is sixteen and her youngest ten months old.

Her business is the retail of sugar, rice, oil, and such ingredients as peppers and onions. With her loan money, she plans to purchase one bag of sugar (16,000 XOF), one bag of rice (14,000 XOF), one container of oil (15,000 XOF), four bags of groundnuts (10,000 XOF per bag), and other ingredients for 20,000 XOF.

Her objectives are to fatten cows, increase her savings, and contribute to her children’s school expenses.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, and such ingredients as peppers and onions.

loans.name: Urbano De Jesus

texts.es:
Urbano hoy está cumpliendo un sueño, este trabajador, luchador, responsable y sonriente hombre, campesino que a sus 43 años de edad se ha desempeñado como mayordomo en finca tiene gracias a interactuar la oportunidad solicitar un monto para iniciar sus propios cultivos que serán Hortalizas.
Se sienten muy feliz pues será una gran oportunidad  de tener su propia tierra que levantara y engrandecerá para dejarle una herencia a sus tres hijos.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos y semillas inicialmente esperando que le vaya muy bien en su camino.
No le niegues la oportunidad a este campesino que se convertirá en un proveedor más de los alimentos que gozan los colombianos y personas en el exterior en la comodidad de su casa.
texts.en:
Urbano is now fulfilling a dream. This hard-working, striving, responsible, and smiling man, a farmer who at the age of 43 has worked as a foreman on a farm, has the opportunity, thanks to Interactuar, to apply for an amount [of money] to begin his own plantings, which will be vegetables.

He feels very happy because it will be a great opportunity to have his own land, which he will establish and enlarge in order to leave an inheritance to his three children. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of compost and seeds initially, hoping that it will go very well for him on his path.

Don't deny the opportunity to this farmer to become another provider of the food that Colombians and people in other countries enjoy in the comfort of their homes.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost, because he will have the opportunity to raise his own crops.

loans.name: Warlen

texts.es:
Warlen es un Joven de 24 años de edad, criado con buenas enseñanzas como el trabajo duro, la honestidad y la humildad, siempre ha mostrado gran interés por el emprendimiento, le gusta ayudar en lo que pueda y le gusta el dinero, por eso siempre busca de finca en finca, de potrero en potrero a ver que puede hacer.
Su sueño es tener un negocio propio y ante él está la gran oportunidad de cumplirlo con la ayuda de un monto iniciara una venta y cría de aves, construirá y adecuara un estadero para que soporte este clima raro, comprara el cuido para alimentarlos, y comprara pollos para iniciar.
Este crédito le dará la oportunidad a un joven, inquieto y soñador de ser autónomo y luchar por una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Warlen is a 24 year old youth who was instilled with good morals like hard-work, honest and being humble. He has always shown great interest in entrepreneurship. He likes to help when he can and he likes money so he's always looking from farm to farm and paddock to paddock looking for what he can do.

His dream is to have his own business and his big opportunity to do this in front of him. With the help of a loan he will start selling and raising chickens. He will adapt a coop so they can withstand the climate, buy feeders for the food and buy chickens to start. This loan will give an opportunity to a busy youth who dreams of being independent and struggling for a better quality of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: to start his own business raising and fattening chickens, investing in adapting a coop, buying food and chickens.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad, de 64 años de edad, es madre soltera, estudió hasta segundo grado, actualmente ella vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales le ayudan en un pequeño negocio que tiene.

Soledad, inició la venta de panes y refrescos hace dos años, lo cual le ha beneficiado mucho, ya que su principal fuente de ingresos.- Además, se dedica a la agricultura.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales de construcción, porque está ampliando más su pequeña vivienda, esto le permitirá vivir mejor a ella y a sus hijos. Además, tendrá más espacio para tener su negocio.

Sus sueños son, terminar de arreglar su casa y que sus hijos logren tener mejor estabilidad y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Soledad is 64 years old and she is a single mother. She studied through second grade. She currently lives with her two children, who help her with her small business. Soledad started selling breads and sodas two years ago, which has helped her a lot since it is her main source of income. She also works in agriculture. She needs the loan to purchase building materials because she is building an addition to her small house. This will allow her and her children to live better as well as have more space for her business. Her dreams are to finish fixing her home and to achieve more stability and a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: José Maria

texts.es:
José, de 22 años de edad, es un joven dedicado al trabajo, comprometido a garantizar el bienestar de su familia, trabaja arduamente; solamente logro cursar sexto grado de educación básica, luego tuvo que trabajar todos los días y se le dificultaba trabajar y estudiar, por esa razón tuvo que dejar los estudios. Actualmente, vive con sus padres y seis hermanos.

José, cuando tiene tiempo libre, trabaja en actividades agrícolas, ayudándole a su padre en los cultivos de maíz y frijol.- Desde hace cuatro años, comenzó a trabajar en una tienda de productos lácteos, él y otro compañero de trabajo, son los encargados de la elaboración de quesillo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales de construcción, ya que necesita terminar su casa, su padre con mucho esfuerzo ha podido comenzar la construcción, pero por  falta de recursos no ha continuado, por eso José, ha decidido solicitar el crédito y  terminar la construcción. 

José, sueña con ver terminada su vivienda, dándoles mejores condiciones a sus padres y hermanos, también desea continuar sus estudios y poder sacar un técnico en elaboración y manejo de productos lácteos.
texts.en:
José at 22 years of age is a youth dedicated to work and committed to guaranteeing the well-being of his family through hard work. He only managed to complete Grade 6 of Primary education, then he had to work every day. It was difficult to work and study so for this reason he had to quit his studies. He currently lives with his parents and 6 siblings. José in his free time, worked in agriculture, helping his father to grow corn and beans.

Four years ago he started to work in a dairy product store. He and another worker are in charge of the production of cheese. He needs a loan to buy construction materials as he needs to finish his house. His father with a lot of effort was able to start construction, but has not continued for lack of resources.

So José has decided to request a loan and finish the construction. José dreams of seeing the house completed providing better conditions for his parents and siblings. He would also like to continue his studies and get a technical diploma in making and managing dairy products.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic materials and continue forward with her business, hoping to improve the condition of her house with the earnings.

loans.name: Libia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Libia es una tierna, amigable, carismática y muy adorable abuelita con gran sentido por la familia y responsabilidad que desea reiniciar su labor de tendera, pues supero algunas dificultades de salud y familiares.
Ella es madre de 5 hijos y siempre fue muy criticada por ellos pues no le gustaba que le ayudaran, se sentía feliz generando su propios recursos y ganándose su propia comida.
Solicita un préstamo que le permita reactivas su negocio, comprando vitrinas y surtido trazándose el objetivo de volver a ser autosuficiente para sostenerse.
Libia es sola y vive con su esposo, la tienda significara para ambos su medio de sustento la atenderán los dos y se compromete a pagarles muy cumplidamente pues está consciente de la gran oportunidad que le podrían estar dando.
texts.en:
Libia is a loving, friendly. charismatic, and very adorable grandmother with a great regard for her family and a great sense of responsibility. She wants to re-initiate her work as a shopkeeper, since she has overcome some health and family difficulties.

She is the mother of five children, and she was always much criticized by them since she did not like them to help her. She felt happy generating her own resources and earning her own food.

She is applying for a loan that will allow her to reactivate her business, buying display cases and stock, and planning the goal of returning to being self-sufficient in order to sustain herself.

Livia lives with her husband. The store signifies for both their means of sustenance. The two of them will tend it, and she promises to make her payments fully, since she is conscious of the great opportunity that they would be given.

loans.use: to re-initiate her business and buy display cases and stock for the family basket, after overcoming her health problems.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011,il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Fatou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 24 ans,est mariée et mére de 03 enfants dont 01 garçon.

Son activité est le commerce de sucre,du riz,de l'huile,du lait et des bombons.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 04 sacs d'arachide de 50kg à 11000f le sac, 01 sac de riz pour 12500f,01 sac de sucre à 18000f,01 bidon d'huile à 14000f,1 carton de lait pour 2000f,des bombons pour 10000f.

Son objectif est de constituer assez de bénéfice pour pouvoir acheter un cheval pour aider son mari dans les travaux champêtres,acheter une paire de bœufs et aussi une machine à cultiver.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011. It is composed of women living in the same village. Their main business is retail. 

Fatou, to the right with her arm raised in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is twenty-four years old, married, and a mother of three children, including one boy.

Her business is the retail of sugar, rice, oil, milk, and candy. With her loan money, she plans to purchase four 50-kilo bags of groundnuts (11,000 XOF per bag), one bag of rice (12,500 XOF), one bag of sugar (18,000 XOF), one container of oil (14,000 XOF), one box of mild (2,000 XOF), and 10,000 XOF worth of candy.

Her objective is to make enough profit to be able to purchase a horse (to help her husband with farm work), a pair of oxen, and a farming machine.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, groundnuts, oil, milk, and candy.

loans.name: Adam's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juin 2008,il est composé de membres qui habitent la commune de Tamba et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Bernadette qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 41 ans,elle est veuve,elle a 08 enfants dont 04 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de jus de bissap,de jus de pain de singe,du miel.

Ainsi avec son financement,elle compte acheter un congélateur pour 300000f,05 bidons de 20l de miel à 25000f le bidon,du bissap,du pain de singe et du sucre pour une valeur de 75000f.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in June 2008. It is composed of members who live in the town of Tamba. Their main business is retail.

Bernadette, who is to the right raising her hand in the picture, is our highlighted borrower. She is 41 years old, widowed, and a mother of four daughters and four boys.

Her business is the retail of hibiscus juice, bread fruit, and honey. With the loan, she therefore plans to purchase a freezer for 300,000 XOF, five 20-liter containers of honey at 25,000 each, and hibiscus, bread fruit, and sugar, for an amount of 75,000 XOF.

Her objective is to pay for her children’s schooling and the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, honey, hibiscus, bread fruit, and sugar.

loans.name: Bintou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis Mai 2007,il regroupe des femmes qui habitent le même village,elles sont solidairement liées pour le remboursement de leur crédit.

Bintou à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 49 ans,elle a 06 garçons et 05 filles.

Elle compte acheter avec le crédit:50 kg de choux à 1000f le kg,50 kg de carottes à 1000f le kg, 06 kg de poivres à 5000f le kg,04 kg de piments à 2500f le kg,25 tiges rôniers de 4 métres à 1600f le métre.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants,augmenter son épargne et contribuer aux dépenses liées à la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2007. It gathers women living in the same village. They are cooperatively responsible for repaying their loan.

Bintou, to the right with her arm raised in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is forty-nine years old and a mother of six boys and five daughters.

With her loan money, she plans to purchase 50 kilos of cabbage at 1,000 XOF per kilo, 50 kilos of carrots at 1,000 XOF per kilo, six kilos of black pepper at 5,000 XOF per kilo, 4 kilos of hot peppers at 2,500 per kilo, and five stems of palm tree at 1,600 XOF per meter.

Her objective is to pay for her children’s school expenses, to increase her savings, and to contribute to food-related expenses for the family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, black pepper, hot peppers, and palm tree stems.

loans.name: Augustine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juin 2008,il est composé de membres qui habitent dans la commune de Tamba,elles ont comme activité principale,le petit commerce.

Anastasie qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 45 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 filles dont 01 garçon.

Son activité est le commerce de miel,elle s'approvisionne au niveau du marché central de Tamba et revend à la capitale.Elle vend aussi du tissu traditionnel.

Elle compte acheter avec le crédit 03 bidons  de 20 litres de miel à 30000f le bidon et dépenser 60000f pour acheter des tissus traditionnels destinés à la revente.

Avec le bénéfice,elle compte aider son mari à la retraite et aider ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in June 2008. It is composed of members who live in the town of Tamba. Their main business is retail.

Anastasie, who is to the right raising her hand in the picture, is our highlighted borrower. She is 45 years old, married, and a mother of four daughters and one boy.

Her business is the retail of honey. She procures her supplies from the local market in Tamba, and retails in the capital. She also sells traditional fabric.

With the loan she plans to purchase three 20-liter containers of honey at 30,000 XOF each, and to spend 60,000 XOF to purchase traditional fabrics intended for retail.

With her profits, she wants to support her retired husband and to help her children.

loans.use: to buy homey and traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija y tres nietos. Ella es una mujer que se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable. Juana se dedica a la venta de delicioso pan dulce de forma ambulante. Juana desea terminar de construir su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra  de lámina galvanizada, madera, polines, ventanas y balcones, para finalizar la vivienda y poder mudarse lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter and 3 grandchildren. She is a woman that is characterized for being hardworking, entrepreneurial and responsible. Juana earns a living selling delicious sweet bread as a street vendor.

Juana wants to finish constructing her home, which is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, beams, windows and gates to finish the home and move in as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, beams, windows and gates to finish her home.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijo de 5 años y 10 mese de edad. Salvador trabaja en una empresa de chatarra desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y mantiene la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, etc. dado que desea repara el techo del corredor de la vivienda. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Salvador is 30 years old, married, ad the father of two children, ages five years and ten months. The family lives in a home that Salvador and his wife own. Salvador has for years worked for a scrap metal business in a job that has allowed him to earn a living and support his family.  

Salvador is applying for a loan from FUSAI so he can invest in the purchase of galvanized sheeting, wood, and other materials and supplies for repairs to the roof on his home. He hopes that he can rely on this loan and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase galvanized sheeting, wood, and other materials and supplies.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: Fermin tiene 51 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y dos hijos. Fermin se gana la vida por medio de la prestación de servicios de seguridad desde hace mucho tiempo. Fermin desea reparar el techo de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, hierro, etc. y de esta forma dar inicio a la reparación del techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Fermin is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a home that he owns. He has for many years made a living providing security services. 

Fermin wants to repair the roof on his home. He's therefore applying for a loan form FUSAI to purchase galvanized sheeting, wood, iron, and other materials and supplies so that he can start the roof repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting, wood, iron, and other materials and supplies for repairs to the roof on his home.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un joven hombre de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pizza.
El es emprendedor, independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘El torno’ un área rural caracterizada por agrupar a productores campesinos de carne, leche, verduras, granos, etc., y comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de vender esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente de aproximadamente 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Fernando es de tez morena, baja estatura, usa el cabello corto y es negro, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que son jubilados, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de pizza, las más populares son; la pizza de hawaiana a base de piña y cherry, la de jamón la de queso, negocio que realiza en un cuarto  en frente de su casa donde instaló un horno industrial y todo lo necesario para su negocio. “mi pizzería está en marcha me falta una ayuda para seguir creciendo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una pizzería conocida,  el desea realizar la compra de una moto para realizar entregas a domicilio y contar con más clientes y ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Fernando solicita un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta para realizar entregas a domicilio.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 22-year-old, single young man without children. His business is making and selling pizzas. 

He is entrepreneurial, independent, responsible and hardworking. His business is located in El Torno, a rural area characterized by groups of local producers of meat, milk, vegetables, grains, etc. and wholesale distributors that are responsible for selling the products in various markets throughout the city, which has a very humid, tropical climate. It has an average temperature of 30°C all year. 

Fernando has a dark complexion, is short statured and has short, black hair. His native language is Guaraní, which is spoken in the area. He also speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for his business. He lives with his parents, who are retired, in their own home built of brick with a corrugated iron roof, running water, electricity and a sewage system. 

His business is making and selling pizzas, the most popular of which are a Hawaiian pizza with a base of cherry and pineapple and a pizza with ham and cheese. He runs his business out of a room in front of his house where he installed an industrial oven and everything he needs for his business. “My pizzeria is underway and I need help to keep it growing,” shared Fernando. 

His dream is to have a well-known pizzeria. He would like to purchase a motorcycle to make home deliveries in order to have more customers and sales. This is the first loan with the institution in two years that supports this activity.   

It is for this reason that Fernando is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to make deliveries.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to make deliveries.

loans.name: Zhazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул, 36 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. Жазгул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Жазгул имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы. На земельном участке мерою 1,30 Га она выращивает экологически-чистые помидоры, капусту, редьку, вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Жазгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и пленки для парника. Жазгул является одной из четырех участников группы "Замир". Доходы от кредита Жазгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhazgul is 36 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  As the main source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry and agriculture in 1995.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns two cows.  She also grows organic potatoes, cabbage and radishes on 1.3 hectare of land.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS) from her activity.  Having realized that this business could be profitable, Zhazgul turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy seeds and plastic sheets for her greenhouses.  Zhazgul is one of the four members of a group called "Zamir".  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and plastic sheet for her greenhouses, in order to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos cliente de la institución de 43 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos de 24, 22, 18, y 16 años, y su negocio es la producción y venta de queso.

El  es una persona trabajadora, humilde, perseverante. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Igachi’ a una altura de 3735 metros sobre el nivel del mar, distante a 65 kilómetros de la ciudad de la paz.
Carlos es de tez morena, cabello negro, estatura mediana, ojos obscuros, su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su rutina comienza desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada, incluso antes de que los gallos anuncien la alborada, en esta localidad de la zona del municipio de ‘Batallas’, trabajar el insumo lácteo hasta darle esa consistencia característica, es una tradición que es compartida por gran parte de los habitantes. Con pocas ganancias y bastante esfuerzo, diariamente lucha para sacar sus productos frescos a la calle, son muchos los gastos que tiene que hacer para llegar al producto final. El proceso comienza con la leche recién ordeñada, los envases para almacenar el queso se elaboran con materiales de Totora, propia del lugar. “La elaboración de quesos es una actividad que me enseño mi madre y es el principal sustento de mi familia”, comenta Carlos.
El principal problema de Carlos es la poca producción de leche, la época lluviosa fue muy corta y no ayudó a que aumentara el pasto para alimentar a las vacas. Esto repercutió de manera directa en la obtención de la leche, la provisión diaria es insuficiente para aumentar la producción de queso, dependiendo de la época del año, el pasto desmejora y esto merma la producción de leche.
Es por esos motivos que Carlos solicita un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheras, aumentar la producción de queso y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children ages 24, 22, 18, and 16. His business is the production and sale of cheese. He is a hardworking, humble, and persevering person. He performs his work en the community of Igachi at an elevation of 3,735 meters above sea level and 65 kilometers from the city of La Paz.

Carlos is dark-skinned with black hair, average height, and dark eyes. His native language is Aymara, and he uses Spanish for business. His routine begins in the early hours of the morning, even before the roosters announce the dawn. In this area of the town of Batallas, working in dairy products to develop this characteristic of consistency is a tradition that is shared in large part by the inhabitants. With little earnings and plenty of effort, he strives daily to bring his fresh products to the street. 

There are many costs that are incurred to arrive at the final product. The process begins with the fresh milk. The containers to store the cheese are made with totora, a native plant. Carlos says, "Making cheese is a process that my mother taught me, and it is the principal nourishment for my family." 

The main problem for Carlos is the little production of milk. The rainy season was very short, and did not help to grow more grass to feed the cows. This had direct repercussions in obtaining milk, and the daily supply is insufficient for an increased production of cheese. Depending on the season of the year, the grass spoils and this decreases the production of milk.

For these reasons Carlos is requesting a loan to buy dairy cows to increase his cheese production, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Zamirbek

texts.ru: Замирбек успешно погасил свой кредит,использовав его по назначению, он благодарен Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ему в финансировании. В хозяйстве Замирбека есть 1 лошадь и 3 коровы.  Его ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на использование кредита на покупку семян дыни, капусты и помидоров, также удобрений и клеенки для теплицы.  Замирбек является участником группы "Замир", в котором кроме него состоят еще 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Замирбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие его бизнеса.
texts.en: Zamirbek used his previous loan as intended and successfully paid it off.  He thanks Kiva as well as all the lenders who helped him to get this financing.  Zamirbek currently owns one horse and three cows.  He makes a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow his business, he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  He will use this loan to buy seeds (of melon, cabbage and potatoes), fertilizers and plastic sheets for his greenhouse.  Zamirbek is one of the members of the "Zamir" group, which comprises three additional members.  Zamirbek is planning to reinvest the earnings from his loan into further developing his business.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, and plastic sheets for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Andres is 26 years old and is the third of the four children in the family. His mother Narcisa, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Andres is studying for a bachelor of science in criminology and is currently in the fourth year of this four-year course.

Narcisa is borrowing PHP 13,006 to pay for the tuition fees of her son Andres for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

Andres plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Yahir Andres

texts.es:
Yahir es un joven de 22 años, alegre entusiasta, que con su negocio de cría y venta de pollos logra sacar su familia adelante, sus padres, sus hermanos y generarse el sustento para sus gastos propios, una enorme responsabilidad para un joven que aún quiere vivir muchas experiencia y locuras en su vida. 
Yahir presenta un problema importante en su negocio y es este el motivo que lo lleva hoy a solicitar un préstamo pues quiere contrarrestar la enfermedad que está acabando con sus pollos, adecuando su negocio  y comprando un alimento de mayor calidad.
En pocas palabras el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en tres cosas, en cuido de calidad, adecuar su estadero de pollos para tener en óptimas condiciones saludables, y por ultimo al realizar las adecuaciones ganara un importante espacio que quiere aprovechar para surtirlo con más pollos.
texts.en:
Yahir is just 22, enthusiastic and happy that his business raising and selling chickens allows him to provide for his family - his parents and siblings. The business also provides income for Yahir's own expenses, but he bears a tremendous responsibility for such a young man. Nonetheless, Yahir wants to experience many things and many joys in his life. 

Yahir is facing a serious crisis that threatens his chickens and is therefore applying for a loan. He wants to stop the disease that is killing the chickens, purchase a higher quality feed and improve his business. 

In brief, Yahir needs the loan so that he can invest in three things. The first two are quality feed and improvements to the chicken house to ensure healthy conditions. The last thing he will do with the funds from the loan, once he's purchased higher quality feed and improved the chicken house, is purchase more chickens.

loans.use: to make modifications to the chicken house and improve the climate as his birds are dying, and to purchase feed and more birds.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
