María es una mujer de mil batallas, incontables son los aprietos por lo que esta mujer campesina ha pasado para generar el sustento y mantener su familia, que la conforma su hijo.
El pasar del tiempo fue muy difícil ella no tenía tierras, ni animales, solo una pequeña choza donde oferta alimentos, frituras, bebidas, dulces, con el pasar del tiempo una empresa Colombia le regalo el establecimiento hecho en metal que ahora se ve en la foto.
María quiere recibir lo que nunca tuvo a lo largo de su vida que fue apoyo, una persona en quien refugiarse en momentos difíciles como este, que no cuenta con capital para abastecer su negocio.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de frituras, dulces y refrescos, esta ayuda permitirá a esta mujer seguir ejerciendo su actividad y buscar lo mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
María is a woman fighting a thousand battles.  The challenges that this rural woman has faced in order to support and sustain her family have been uncountable.  She is alone with one child.  

Survival has been very difficult as she had no land, no animals, and only a small lean-to where she sold food, chips, drinks, and sweets.  Over time a Colombian business gifted her with the metal stand that can be seen in the photograph.

María wants to receive what she has never had throughout her long life, which is support, someone who she can count on in difficult moments like these, when she does not have the capital to resupply her business. 

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase chips, sweets, and soft drinks.  This loan will help her to continue with her business and to look for the best for her family.

loans.use: to purchase chips, sweets, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Cristian Esmir

texts.es:
Carismático, bromista, buena gente un hombre muy chévere así es Cristian un barbero de 24 años de edad, que lucha y trabaja hasta 12 horas en el día para constituir su negocio entre la competencia.
Inicio su negocio como necesidad económica ya que en su hogar estaba pasando por necesidades y como hombre debía afrontar la responsabilidad y sus habilidades para realizar los cortes los aprendió en capacitaciones y un amigo que lo instruyo muy bien.
El sueño de su vida es poder darle a su madre una vivienda propia y trabaja juiciosamente para lograrlo, quiere mejorar su negocio, ser lo suficientemente grande para darles empleo a otras personas siendo este su propósito para este año.
Cristian solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa, tenis, gorras, para ofrecer en una vitrina que tiene en su Barbería.
texts.en:
Charismatic, lighthearted, a gentleman and very cool – This is Cristian, a 24-year-old barber that struggles and works up to 12 hours a day to establish and set his business apart from the competition. 

He started his business out of necessity since he had needs at home and as a man felt he should take on the responsibility. He learned his haircutting skills in trainings and through a friend who taught him very well. 

His dream in life is to be able to give his mother her own home and to work fairly to earn it. He wants to improve his business so that it is large enough to employ others, a goal of his this year. Cristian is asking for a loan in order to buy an assortment of clothing, tennis shoes and hats to sell in a display case that he would have in his barbershop.

loans.use: to buy a display case for shoes, shirts and hats for his barbershop and the related merchandise.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Alicia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing/fish vending business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing/fish vending business

loans.name: Ma. Angeles

texts.en:
Ma. Angeles is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Angeles is 47 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Ma. Angeles has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Angeles requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Angeles has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Ma. Angeles would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas works hard to support her family. Felicitas is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Felicitas requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Felicitas has been in this business for 5 years now.

Felicitas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jovelyn is 40 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jovelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Jovelyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Lolita has been raising livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 32 años de edad, padre de dos pequeños de 6 y 8 años de edad que viene de una larga tradición de lecheros, con un principio y regla increbrantable la cual es si el animal se muere es mejor enterrarlo que sacrificarlo para carne pues aprecian muchos a estos hermosos seres que representan la actividad economía que ha sostenido a su familia tantos años. 
Pensando en sus animales Juan quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar una máquina de ordeño portable la razón es que estas máquinas son menos perjudiciales para los animales sacan mejor provecho y es más estimulante para ellas.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old and the father of 2 children of 6 and 8 years of age. He comes from a long tradition of dairy farmers. They have an unbreakable rule by principle which is to bury any cows that die rather than sacrifice them for meat since they appreciate so much these animals that represent their economic livelihood and have supported their family for so many years. 
Thinking of his animals, Juan is requesting a loan to buy a portable milking machine because it is less disruptive for the animals, has better yield, and is more stimulating for them.

loans.use: To buy a portable milking machine to make the process easier and more pleasant for the cows.

loans.name: Pisgah Group

texts.en:
Ms Ngulnem is a 59-year-old widowed woman. She is the profile member with her hand raised in the picture. She is also the representative of the group ‘PISGAH’. She has two children (sons) who are well educated and well mannered. She resides in Lamka, which is situated in Manipur, one of the seven sister states of India. Most of the people in that area are engaged in daily labor, knitting, weaving and many more. 

Ms Ngulnem is a very hardworking woman. Even though her husband passed away, she didn't lose hope but she alone thought of doing her best for her children and for her family management. She decided to take care of her children herself. She came across many hardships as she was the lone breadwinner of her family. She engaged herself in daily wage earning and other work like selling readymade clothes in the markets. Sometimes she also sells her goods from door to door. She is a very dedicated woman. She is not the kind of woman who just gives up but keeps on trying until she gets what she is looking for. 

With the little income she saved, she rented a place and opened a small store for selling readymade clothes. She thought by opening a store, she could earn more income than before for her family. Her business was going smoothly but the problem is that with the profit she gets, she has to maintain her family expenses, pay her children educational fees, buy more items to sell in her store in order to satisfy the customers and make the business keep going. But unfortunately the profit was not enough for all these. 

With the Kiva loan, she wants to buy stocks of readymade clothes like shirts, long pants, skirts, shorts, etc. to make more profit. She is looking forward to the loan and she exclaimed with joy and said, "Soon I’ll make enough profit to meet my household expenses and pay for my children educational fees and make my business progress." She thanks the lenders and WSDS  for their outstanding work. Likewise, the remaining members are hopefully waiting for the loan to start their respective money-generating activities.

loans.use: To purchase stock of readymade clothes (shirts, shorts, long pants, skirts etc)

loans.name: Katiny Paola

texts.es:
Esa ventana que se ve en la foto, será el principio de un cambio radical en la vida Katiny, pues en ella depositara sus esperanzas para tener una vida más digna para ella y sus dos hijos de 5 y 8 años de edad, y es que esa ventana será donde se acerquen sus clientes a comprarle productos de la canasta familiar, todo nació, gracias a la incursión de Interactuar en zonas de alto riesgo y de difícil acceso, ofreciéndoles una mano a los empresarios con buenas ideas pero sin recursos de iniciar su negocio.
Katiny quiere iniciar una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar y aprovechando esa ventana que tiene en su hogar adecuara el espacio,y con ayuda de un prestado comprara vitrinas, estanterías y surtido en abarrotes, granos, y productos de refrigeración que ubicara en su nevera personal.
Apoya a esta mujer de bajos recursos para que tenga un medio de sostenimiento para su familia.
texts.en:
The window seen in the photo will be the start of a radical change in Katiny’s life since into it she will deposit her hopes for having a more dignified life for herself and her two children of 5 and 8 years of age. This window will be where her customers come to buy basic necessities. All of this came about thanks to the incursion of Interactuar into high risk and difficult to access areas. They offered a hand to the businesspeople with good ideas but without resources to start their businesses.

Katiny wants to start a store with basic necesseties and taking advantage of the window that she has in her home, she will make the space suitable. With the help of a loan she will buy display cases, shelves and stock groceries, grains and refrigerated products to place in her personal fridge. Support this low income woman so that she can have a means of sustaining her family.

loans.use: to start her dream of having a business to support her family. She will buy display cases, shelves and stock groceries, grains and refrigerated products.

loans.name: Martha Group

texts.en:
“My favorite part in weaving is when I finish and sell my own woven clothes,” said Manthianniang, the profiled member of the group. Weaving is very common in the area where she dwells and most of the supplies go throughout the state for sale. 

Manthianniang, 32 years old, is pictured with her hand raised. She lives in Churachandpur village where people strive for better employment opportunities. Like others, Manthianniang also engages herself in weaving so that she can support herself and her family. She weaves traditional wraparounds, namely puandum, gungal and senior (all local name) worn by womenfolk of her tribe. Her husband is a daily laborer and they both earn a thin income, which is barely adequate for a family of three. She has a daughter who goes to school. They live within the limit of the income derived from her weaving and her husband’s earnings. 

She wishes to buy a weaving machine just like the one in the photograph, which is work efficient for producing abundant clothes for sale. She said it will increase her income and help her live more adequately. The loan will help her buy a weaving machine of her dreams. She will be able to produce more clothes for sale and help with her family maintenance adequately. She gives thanks to Kiva for being a part of making her dreams come true. She now feels enlightened and will continue to work harder. All the other members are very proactive and expect progressive changes in their businesses with the help of the Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy a weaving machine that will help her work more efficiently.

loans.name: Kideihsak Group

texts.en:
“My only dream is to buy a small plot of land that I can call my own and live with my five children,” narrates the featured member, Mansonching, a 38- year-old widow. She is an honest and sincere person pictured with her hand raised. They live in a village in the outskirts of Churachandpur town in a rented house. 

She works hard to provide the requirements of her children be it their basic needs or educational fees. With five dependent children, she manages the household requirements with much difficulty. In order to meet her family's needs, she weaves traditional wraparound skirts and at the same time supplies weaving materials including yarn to weavers in her neighborhood and sells the finished products. They share the income she gets by selling the finished goods to customers. Normally she sells 4 to 5 products weekly. 

Mansonching hopes and wishes to own a plot of land in her village someday from her savings. She is self-reliant although she has been the only source of family income and she is an inspiration for other woman. She wanted to save more money by engaging herself in a bigger weaving business and fulfilling her long-awaited dream to buy a plot of land. The loan will be used to buy more yarn to supply to weavers in the neighborhood so that she can increase the number of products for sale. It will help her save more money. She is very happy to avail the loan and sends her warm wishes to the lenders. The other group members are also competent in their business endeavour. They are confident they will make extravagant changes in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy threads and yarn to supply to the weavers.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 55 years old and married with five children.

Remedios works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell.

Remedios has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from food vending.

Remedios aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, shampoo, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Richelle works hard to support her family. She has a cellular phone shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.  Richelle is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her cellular phone shop business.

Richelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.

loans.name: Ronora

texts.en: Ronora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Ronora has been in this business for six years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 60 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Rufina has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rufina has been farming corn for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old and married with seven children.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Marilou has previously borrowed, and paid back, five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marilou aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Erine

texts.en:
Erine is 54 years old and married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family running a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy canned goods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, coffee, juice, and cooking oil to sell.

Erine has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Erine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, coffee, juice, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la pesca artesanal, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientes fijos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de 2 redes de mayas y un nuevo bote para poder seguir con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 46 years old and lives in his own home along with his life companion. He has been a small scale fisherman for the past 15 years. Wilfredo sells his products at different markets and he already has established customers. With the income he earns from his sales, he is able to cover some of his household expenses.

Wilfredo is requesting a loan in order to buy two mesh fishing nets and a new boat so that he can continue his work. As a result, he will have a better income.

loans.use: to buy two mesh fishing nets and a new boat.

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian viene de una familia humilde, es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, vino desde la ciudad de Encarnación buscando un mejor futuro y una mejor vida.
El es estudiante del tercer año de la carrera de contabilidad, esta poniendo lo mejor de si para poder ser un profesional exitoso y útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Cristhian comes from a modest family. He is from the city of Caaguazú, having moved there from Encarnación in search of a better future and a better life.

Cristhian is a third-year student who is pursuing a degree in Accounting. He is doing his best so that he can become a successful professional who is useful to society.

Cristhian is requesting this loan so that he can pay his degree fees. This will enable him to continue his studies just as before. He appreciates the opportunity he has received to fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Ana Luz Argentina

texts.es:
Ana, tiene un negocio que consiste en la crianza y engorde de cerdos, tiene 56 años de edad, vive con su suegra y un hijo, con edades de 90 y 27 años respectivamente; atiende su negocio a tiempo completo desde hace 10 años, por el momento no representa dificultades en realizarlo.
Utilizará el capital para comprar cerdos pequeños para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos a un mejor precio, tendrá más ventas e ingresos, de esta manera tendrá una situación financiera que le permita suplir las necesidades en su hogar como alimentación y medicinas.
Sus sueños son fortalecer y hacer más grande la granja de cerdos.
texts.en:
Ana has a business that involves raising and fattening pigs. She is 56 years old and lives with her mother-in-law and her son, who are ages 90 and 27 respectively. Ana has been managing her business full-time for the past 10 years. At the moment, she is not experiencing difficulties with her business.

Ana will use this capital to buy piglets that she can fatten and sell later at a better price. As a result, she will have more sales and income. Her financial situation will allow her to provide for household needs, such as food and medicines.

Her dreams include strengthening and expanding her pig farm.

loans.use: to buy piglets that she can fatten and sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Media Luna Group

texts.es:
Rocio es una mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 8 y 13 años y una hija mujer de 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de plásticos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘el tejar’ caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas; cientos de comerciante se acomodan lado a lado para ofertar ropa, comida, carnes, frutas, etc., de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-15 grados centígrados y durante todo el año.
Rocio es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla con la familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie, la primera de la derechoa, viste de negro). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la venta de comida y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, lideró una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de carne de pollo, 
venta de flores, servicio de té, taller de costura, venta de productos cosméticos, elaboración de colchones y  venta de chamarras, para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus labores. Su negocio es el comercio de plásticos, como; baldes, vasos, cubiertos, cajas, etc., negocio que realiza durante todos los días de la semana durante el día. “mi mercadería es bastante accesible por eso tengo buenas ventas y genero buenos ingresos…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de plásticos reconocida. Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos mediante la compra de productos plásticos por mayora para satisfacer la demanda del mercado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año y medio que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rocio solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos plásticos por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Rocio is a 30-year-old woman who is married. She has two sons (ages 8 and 13) and a six-year-old daughter. Her business involves selling plastic goods.

Rocio is a good mother who is enterprising, independent, responsible, and hardworking. She conducts her business in the District of El Tejar, which is known for all types of informal trade. Hundreds of merchants can be seen side-by-side selling clothes, food, meats, fruit, and other products. The weather is cold and dry. The temperature can vary between 5 and 15 degrees centigrade during the day throughout the entire year.

Rocio has a dark complexion, long black hair, dark eyes, and a short stature. Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family. However, she speaks Spanish so that she can integrate into the general culture and conduct business. In the photo, Rocio is the first person standing on the right, dressed in black. She shares her life with her husband who is a food merchant and her children who are in school. They live in a rented brick house that has running water, electricity, and sewage services. Needing to expand her business, Rocio decided to lead a Communal Bank. Her group includes businesspeople who sell chicken, sell flowers, provide tea service, operate a sewing workshop, sell cosmetics, produce mattresses, and sell jackets. Rocio’s business involves selling plastic goods such as buckets, tumblers, cutlery, crates, and other items. She conducts her business every day of the week. “My merchandise is quite affordable, so I am able to generate good sales and earn a good income,” says Rocio. Her dream is to have a plastic goods store that is well-known. She wants to expand her inventory of plastic goods by purchasing in bulk so that she can satisfy the demand in the marketplace. This is her first loan cycle with Emprender and she has been in business for a year and a half.

For the reasons previously mentioned, Rocio is requesting a loan in order to buy plastic goods in bulk so that she can satisfy the seasonal demand.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods in bulk so that she can satisfy the seasonal demand.

loans.name: Verma June

texts.en:
Verma June is 35 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Verma June has borrowed, and paid back, 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with four children.  Josephine works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Josephine has borrowed, and repaid, 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Josephine aspires to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: En 2002, Yawa âgée de 40ans, mariée avec en charge 05 enfants(04 scolarisés) revend des céréales(haricot, maïs...) de façon ambulante et à domicile. Elle demande un troisième crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle souhaite maintenir, élargir son activité et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Yawa is 40 years old, married, and has five children under her care (four go to school). Since 2002, she has worked selling cereals (beans, corn, etc.) from her home and by traveling around. 

Yawa is seeking a third loan to buy goods in order to better respond to her customers' needs.

She wishes to maintain and expand her business and ensure her family's development.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi un jeune de 28ans est revendeur de pièces détachées depuis 2013. Il exerce son activité à KPALIME une ville de Lomé et s'approvisionne à LOME et au GHANA. Manquant un peu de fonds pour renforcer son activité, Koffi demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des pièces détachées afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Il souhaite faire prospérer son activité et que sa famille bénéficie des produits de son travail.
texts.en:
Koffi is young man, 28 years old, and has worked selling spare parts since 2013. He works in Kpalime, a town in Lomé. He procures his goods in Lomé and in Ghana. 

Lacking a bit of funds to strengthen his business, Koffi is seeking his first loan through WAGES to buy spare parts in order to better respond to his customers' needs.

Koffi wishes to prosper in his business so that his family can benefit.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Conducteur de taxi moto depuis 2007, Kodjo un jeune homme de 27ans demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter une nouvelle moto afin de détendre son activité. Il souhaite à l'avenir, avoir plus de moto et avoir une famille épanouie.
texts.en:
Kodjo is a young 27-year-old man who has been driving a taxi motorcycle since 2007. 

He is seeking his first loan with WAGES in order to buy a new motorcycle which will help him grow his business.

Kodjo wishes to have in the future more motorcycles and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Basman Jose

texts.es:
Basman es un joven de 22 años que inicia su camino como emprendedor en un terreno ha logrado comprar gracias a mucho trabajo que realizo durante su juventud.
La importancia de su trabajo y negocio radica en que significa el sustento para su hogar, donde sus padres y hermanos dependen mucho de él.
Por tal motivo Basman acude a ustedes a que lo apoyen en su proyecto prestándole dinero que invertirá en la compra de abonos, riegos, semillas, pesticidas y fungicidas, con los que podrá mantener e iniciar nuevos cultivos, buscando siempre mejorar las condiciones de vivienda y que sus hermanos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Basman is a 22-year-old young man who began his path as an entrepreneur through land he was able to buy thanks to working hard during his youth.

The importance of his work and business is rooted in the fact that it's his sustenance for his household, where his parents and siblings depend on him a lot. 
Because of this, Basman comes to you for help with his project: to loan him money that he will invest in buying compost, irrigation, seeds, pesticides and fungicides. 

He'll be able to maintain and start new crops with these inputs. He's always looking to improve his living conditions so his siblings can go to school.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of compost, seeds and pesticides to maintain and start other crops.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis es un joven emprendedor, con buenos proyectos y aspiraciones que involucran su núcleo familiar, a sus 2 años tiene un negocio de modistería el cual aprendió solo ante la necesidad económica que surge en su hogar, el cual es muy humilde.
Sus excelente trabajos y buenos acabados llamaron la atención de empresarios que le sugieren que iniciara a maquilar, que ellos le daban mercancía para iniciar sus confecciones y es algo que lo llena de emoción y alegría pero ante todo de responsabilidad.
Luis no tiene capital, pero quiere iniciar lo más pronto posible pues significara un cambio muy importante en su vida al poder contratar familiares para trabajar, y un aumento en sus ganancias.
Necesita un crédito con urgencia para la compra de una maquina fileteadora y recubridora pues sin ellas no podrá poner en marcha en lindo proyecto que cambiara enormemente su vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a young entrepreneur with good aspirations and projects involving his immediate family. For two years, he's had a dressmaking business which he taught himself just because of economic need that developed in his home, which is very humble.

His excellent work and good finishes drew the attention of businesses who suggested he begin manufacturing. They gave him merchandise to start his creations. This fills him with emotion and joy, but above all, responsibility.

Luis doesn't have capital, but wants to begin as soon as possible because this signifies an important change in his life: to be able to employ family members to work and increase his income.

He needs a loan urgently to buy an overlock sewing machine and coating machine, because without them he won't be able to put this project, which will change his life significantly, in motion.

loans.use: to buy coating and overlock sewing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell on foot in the streets, and invest in a cart to make transportation more enjoyable if money is left over.

loans.name: Sana1 Group

texts.fr: Azeta est responsable du groupe Sana1 qui est formé de 6 femmes battantes. Ces dames exercent plusieurs activités qui leurs permettent de s'occuper de leurs différentes familles et de faire face à leurs propres dépenses( habillements, soins médicaux,..).Azeta est une femme mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 sont scolarisés. Cette brave dame fait le soumbala, un produit burkinabé pour vendre. Le soumbala se produit à l'aide des grains de neeré. Il est très consommé par les burkinabés et dans l’Afrique de l'ouest. Ce produit a beaucoup de vertu et est conseillé pour les patients qui souffrent de l'hypertension. Cela fait 20 ans que Azeta produit le soumbala. Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour produire plus de soumbala pour vendre. A l'issue de ses ventes, ses bénéfices lui permettront de continuer ses activités, de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Azeta is the leader of the Sana1 group, which is made up of six strong women. These women have various types of work that allow them to take care of their families and to cover their various expenses (clothing, health and medicine, etc.).

Azeta is a married woman with six children, of whom four go to school. This brave woman makes soumbala, a product of Burkina Faso, to sell. 

Soumbala is made from locust seeds, and it is eaten often in Burkina Faso and in west Africa. Soumbala has a lot of virtue and is advised for patients with hypertension.

Azeta has made soumbala for 20 years. She needs this loan to make more soumbala to resell. 

Earnings from her sales will allow her to continue her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy locust seeds to make soumbala

loans.name: Hezam Group

texts.en:
Hezam group is made up of five women who are friends and neighbors. They live in different parts of Hodeidah, Yemen which has a hot climate and is noted for its beautiful sea. 

The members are friendly people; kind and warm-hearted, who charm visitors. They are hard workers who work every day to improve their household economies and to get their families ahead. They have asked for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Zenab, the leader of the group, is 50 years old and married with six children.  She lives with her family in a poor quarter in Hodiedah. Making ice-cream in the streets is her only source of income. 

The profits from this humble business are small. She works hard to increase her business, but most of what she earns goes to cover the necessary expenses of her children. 

As a result, she applied for this loan from AMB in order to purchase sugar, tangs, drinks, and other ingredients to make ice-cream and sell it in the streets.

Zenab hopes to open a small shop in her area to sell ice-cream and sweets to children.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make ice-cream to sell in the streets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more perfumes and incense to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Yurley Adriana

texts.es:
Yurley, es una mujer emprendedora de 30 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2005, monto su negocio ofreciendo accesorios para celulares, con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 

Yurley se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como accesorios, protectores de pantalla, equipos de diversas gamas, entre otros, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yurly is a hard-working 30-year-old woman who, for some time, has had various jobs but always with the desire in her mind to enter into the commercial area.  This was how, in the beginning of the year 2005, she started her own business offering cell phone accessories, with which she has had great success during its years of operation.

Yurley is characterized as a hard-working, nice woman with vision for and desire to get ahead.  This is why she is inspired to request a loan, to invest it in the purchase of merchandise like accessories, screen protectors, an assortment of cell phones, among other things, in order to improve the business’ image, which will attract more clients and offer them a variety of products that satisfy the needs and likes of everyone who visits the business.

In this way, she will be able to earn income to continue supporting the household economy and save up to open other branches of her business, thus she will have a more prosperous future in which she will be able to noticeably improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy various accessories, screen protectors, an assortment of cell phones to have a wide variety of products to offer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement as well as doors and windows to renovate the house and to prepare it for living.

loans.name: Jacent

texts.en:
Jacent lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 1 child, and she also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food. 

She sells yellow bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 3 years and she works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more yellow bananas. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals are to educate her children to university level and to increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy bunches of yellow bananas.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31-year-old married man from a village near Hebron city. He is a father of one son and one daughter. Ahmad works as a taxi driver where he gets a low and unstable income. He also works as a farmer on his own land where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables. Ahmad takes care of his land and crops to ensure he has a good quality products.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seedlings for his farm. By taking this loan, the farm productivity will increase and also the income.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
Sameh is a 22-year-old single man from Nablus city. His father works as a construction worker in different workshops. He gets a low and unstable income due to the demand. 

Sameh studies Information technology in a local university. He wants to complete his studies and find a job as soon as possible so he can help his family with part of their expenses.

Sameh took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Sameh will be able to do his homework and reports using special programs. 

Sameh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Sixto Jesus

texts.es:
Sixto es un hombre de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
El monto un centro de videojuegos desde hace 2 años.
El tiene 29 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.
El solicita un apoyo económico para comprar videojuegos nuevos para sus clientes. 
Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Sixto is a man who has good ideas and a creative mind: he is always trying to find activities to increase his family's income.
He started a video game center 2 years ago.
He is 29 years old and has all the pieces in place so that he can face the challenges that life has in store for him.
He is requesting a loan to buy new video games for his customers. 
He will use this money to invest in his business and attract more customers. In this way he will increase his usefulness and profits in a positive way.
His greatest dream is to have a big internet cafe with good profits and to generate employment.

loans.use: to buy video games for his customers who greatly appreciate this business for the entertainment it offers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: bricks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, and labor to construct a room for a kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to rebuild his greenhouses.

loans.name: Jose Wilmar

texts.es:
Jose un humilde agricultor que cada mañana sale a trabajar en su campo, dedicado en pleno a su trabajo, este hombre solo piensa en progresar y entregar un buen producto pues sabe que muchas personas lo consumen y por ello cada gota de sudor que sale de su frente es el empeño que pone para que su productos salgan puros y de calidad, 
Como todo buen agricultor, quiere siempre implementar arreglos y mejoras para a sus cultivos pero sabe que estos arreglos o implementaciones son muy costosos por esta razón solicita un crédito para comprar abonos, riegos y fungicidas para adecuar sus campos con el único propósito de mejorar su manera de cultivar, hacer más fácil su trabajo y darle al cliente final un producto de calidad
texts.en:
Jose is a humble farmer who goes out to his fields every morning. He is fully dedicated to his work. This man only thinks of progressing and delivering a good product as he knows that many people consume his produce and, for this reason, every drop of sweat from his brow marks his commitment to growing produce that is pure and of high quality. 
As he is a good farmer, he always wants to implement additions and improvements for his crops but also knows that these addition are very expensive. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, irrigation materials, and fungicides to prepare his fields with the single goal of improving his manner of cultivating crops. This will make his work easier and give his final customers quality produce.

loans.use: to buy expensive supplies such as fertilizer, irrigation materials, and fungicides.

loans.name: Fysal

texts.en:
Fysal is a 42-year-old married man with six children, living with his family in a rented house in Sana'a city, Yemen. Fysal's wife works as a house wife and he is the breadwinner of the family. 

The house where Fysal and his family live lacks of a lot of the necessary home appliances and house ware. Fysal doesn't have enough money to improve the living conditions inside of the house. 

For this reason, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary home appliances and house ware for the house.

Fysal hopes to buy a piece of land and build his own house on it.

loans.use: To purchase some of the necessary home appliances and house ware for the house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase sugar, food oil, flour and other things to make sweets and to purchase perfumes and incense.

loans.name: Al- Salam Group

texts.en:
These are the seven members of Al-Salam group. All of them live in a poor area in Hodeidah city, Yemen. The whole group took out a loan of 350,000 YER.

Wohda is the group's coordinator and is 25 years old. She has two children and lives with them in a small house which it is necessary to expand. The small house consists of only two rooms, one kitchen and a very small bathroom. 

The family feels very inconvenienced by this situation and they feel ashamed if any visitor comes to the house. The income of the husband is not enough to do the necessary expansion of the house. As a result, Wohda applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase bricks to build another room to expand the house.
 
Wohda hopes to see her family lives in better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase bricks to build another room to expand the house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a lot of livestock, such as cows and goats

loans.name: Beatriz Marlene

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 28, 17 y 5 años y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘la Mutualista’ un área comercial ubicada en el centro de la ciudad caracterizada por agrupar a la mayor parte de oficinas de empresas, universidades e instituciones. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Beatriz es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y sus seis hijos, el mayor es independiente y los 2 menores estudian en la escuela viven en una casa alquilada con dos habitaciones, baño y cocina, cuentan con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, en un puesto en la calle al aire libre cubierta con sombrillas y cocina platos como; el majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, plátano frito), el pipián (basado en carne de res ó en pato), el locro carretero (carne deshidrata y yuca), el cogote relleno (cuellos de gallina relleno) y el rapi (carne, arroz, urucú). “Cada comida es cocinada una vez a la semana, los clientes ya conocen el menú diario…” comenta. Su sueño es convertirse en un restaurante. Ella desea realizar la construcción de un techo para darle mayor comodidad a sus clientes y que su negocio sea mejor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 11 años que lleva con esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Beatriz solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un techo y convertirse en restaurante.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a 49 year old married mother of three children (ages 28, 17 and 5).  She has a business selling traditional foods.  She is a great mother and businesswoman.  She is independent, happy responsible, hardworking and has a great attitude.  She works in the "Mutualista" zone, a commercial area located in the center of the city.  It is known for having many offices, universities and institutions.  It has a warm, tropical and humid climate with an average temperature of 21-35 degrees celsius during the day.  

Beatriz is of dark complexion, medium stature, long black hair, and dark eyes.  Her native tongue is Guaraní but she also speaks Spanish based on the culture and the business she runs.  She lives her life with her husband who works in transportation, and their children.  The eldest son is independent and the two younger children attend school.  They live in a rented, two-bedroom house with a bathroom, kitchen, clean water, electricity and sewer lines.

She has a business selling traditional foods from an open-air street stall that is covered by umbrellas.  She cooks meals such as: el majadito de charque (beef jerky, rice, fried plantains), el pipián (a beef or duck based dish), el locro carretero (beef jerky and yucca), el cogote relleno (stuffed chicken necks) y el rapi (beef, rice and urucú).  Each dish is cooked once a week and her customers already know the daily menu.

Her dream is to turn it into a a restaurant.  She hopes to build a roof to provide better comfort to her customers and for her business to improve.  This is her second loan, in 11 years of owning the business, with the institution.  For these reasons, Beatriz is seeking a loan to build a roof and convert her stall into a restaurant.

loans.use: to build a roof and open a restaurant.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 28-year-old married woman from Jenin city. She is a mother of two sons. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. Diana has a barn for raising sheep. Her husband helps her in the barn work. 

Diana took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy feed for her sheep. By taking this loan, Diana will be able to improve her business. 

Diana appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy feed for her sheep.

loans.name: Betty Margarita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 4 De Noviembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 7 y 1 años de edad, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es ebanista,
Doña Betty como buena esposa que es para ayudarle a su esposo realiza el crédito para que el invierta en su negocio, el tiene un pequeño taller de ebanistería, allí él le da forma a la madera y elabora todo tipo de muebles, camas, cajoneras, literas, juegos de comedor, puertas entre otros productos, el realiza sus obras por pedidos de sus clientes aunque también en ocasiones entrega en Manta a una mueblería de esa ciudad, el lleva más de 7años con su taller y con eso el lucha para que nada les falte a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pintura y otros materiales más para elaborar sus obras. Lleva seis años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede ayudarle a su marido. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The loan group called  4 De Noviembre meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a town known for its great diversity of typical products such as, for example, the Panama hats that are known within and beyond the country.
Betty lives in this place. She is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children from this marriage who are 12, 7, and 1 years old. The two eldest are in high school and elementary school. Her husband is a cabinetmaker. 
Betty is a good wife and helps her husband so she is requesting a loan to invest in his business. He has a small cabinetmaking workshop where he gives form to the wood and makes all types of furniture: beds, chests of drawers, bunks, dining sets, and doors among other things. He works to order for individuals and sometimes delivers items to Manta, a furniture store in the city. He has run this workshop for 7 years and it is how he ensures that his family isn't wanting for anything. 
This loan will be used to buy wood, paint, and other materials for his work. Betty has been in the loan group for 6 years and she likes it because the loans enable her to help her husband. Her dream is to give her kids the best in life.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, and other materials.

loans.name: Solome

texts.en:
Solome lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, all of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other member of her family.

She has been selling green bananas and cassava at the market for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas and cassava. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to increase the stock so as to increase on her savings. She joined MCDT because it is not costly to join the organization.

She lives in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas and cassava.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and four go to school. She is not looking after any other family member.

She has been selling fruits and vegetables from the market at retail for six years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy avocado fruits, sweet bananas, watermelon, pineapples, oranges. Her challenges include thieves and their short life span. Her dream is to acquire land and plant avocado trees and other fruits. She joined MCDT because of low interest charged on loans and to save. 

She stays in a rented house with no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy sweet bananas, watermelon, pineapples, oranges.

loans.name: Laura Estela

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 4 De Noviembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Laura, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 19, 12, 10 y 7 años de edad, los tres menores  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo cría chanchos. 
Doña Laura para poder salir adelante junto a su familia  y con esto ayudare a su marido con los gastos que ocasiona la crianza de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de alimentos,  los fines de semana ella instala un pequeño local en su casa allí vende desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas, además  en los otros días ella prepara y vende empanadas, sanduches, sodas y varias cosas más.  Ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en la cría de chanchos, ella  lleva más de siete años y es gracias a esto que no les falta nada a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres que ella necesita para preparar los alimentos y  alimento para chanchos. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The loan group 4 De Noviembre meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a town known for its great diversity of typical products such as, for example, the Panama hats that are known within and outside the country.
Laura lives in this place. She is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children from this marriage who are 19, 12, 10, and 7 years old. The 3 oldest are in high school and elementary school. Her husband raises pigs.
Laura works selling food so that she and her family and can be successful and to help her husband with the expenses of raising their kids. At the weekend, she has a small stall in her home where she sells breakfasts, lunches, and snacks. On the other days, she makes and sells empanadas, sandwiches, sodas, and various other things. She has been doing this work for more than 7 years and, thanks to this, her children don't lack for anything. She will also give part of the loan to her husband to use for raising his pigs. This loan will be used to buy the supplies that she needs to prepare her food and also for food for the pigs. She has been in the loan group for 2 years and she likes it because the loans help her a great deal. Her dream is that her children will finish school.

loans.use: to buy supplies and food for pigs.

loans.name: Yuri Alexandra

texts.es:
Yuri es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo brindándole una educación de buena calidad.
Yuri vive en unión libre con su pareja y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo, con gran esfuerzo ha superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.
Actualmente Yuri tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Yuri is a hardworking woman who has been able to get her child ahead and provide him with a quality education thanks to her daily effort. Yuri lives in a common-law marriage with her partner.  For a long time, she has been selling personal use products via catalogs.  Through a lot of effort, she has been able to overcome the many obstacles that she has faced.  Currently, Yuri has a few large orders from her clients but because she does not have a lot of working capital, she is seeking a loan to purchase the products and fill her customers' orders.  

Her biggest dream is to get ahead in her business and offer her son a better quality of life and more financial stability.  She knows that through Interactuar's help, she will be able to achieve this.

loans.use: fill her current outstanding orders for personal use products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheeting, wood, and tiles for completion of the hallway in her home as well as shoes and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lamps and a reception desk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items such as bread, flour, cooking oil, milk, coffee, and other goods for her store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man from the city of Nablus. His father has a car paintshop and has a low and unstable income because of fluctuations in demand. Mohammad studies accounting at a local university. He wants to complete his studies and find a job as soon as possible, to help his family with part of their expenses. Mohammad took out a US Dollar loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university charges for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to complete his studies faster.

loans.use: to pay his university charges for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university charges for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, iron, windows, etc. to finish installing a roof and windows in her home.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás es un hombre de 50 años de edad que se esfuerza cada día para poder sostener a su familia apoyado en su negocio de venta de productos básicos actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, además para mantener la estabilidad económica en tiempo de zafra se dedica a la corta de caña por las mañanas logrando obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Él vive junto a su grupo familiar en vivienda propia desde hace 15 años, por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecho de poder contar con un lugar donde vivir gracias a su esfuerzo de años. Nicolás siempre buscando la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida desea invertir en su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos económicos en la temporada navideña, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, bebidas frías y calientes, sachet de champú, detergente, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, etc.
texts.en:
Nicolás is a 50-year-old man who works hard each day to sustain his family, supported by his business selling basic products, work he has done for 3 years, in order to maintain the economic stability in the period after the sugar cane harvest. He works cutting cane in the mornings, managing to get more income. He has lived with his family in his own house for 15 years, for which he is happy and satisfied to be able to have a place to live thanks his years of effort. 

Nicolás, always looking for a way to improve his quality of life, wants to invest in his business to get more income in the Christmas season, so he asked FUSAI for a loan to invest in sweets, cold and hot drinks, shampoo packets, detergent, rice, beans, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to invest in candies, cold and hot drinks, shampoo packets, detergent, rice, beans, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Alan Martin

texts.es:
Alan es un responsable, organizado, padre de familia su pequeño de  6 años de edad y su princesa de 3 años son sus amores, su razón de ser y su aliciente para seguir trabajando y luchar por un mejor futuro donde no lleguen a pasar ninguna necesidad.
Genera sus recursos gracias a una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar ubicada en una zona rural, siendo en muchos metros cuadrados la única de su tipo.
En la tienda de Alan, se encuentra huevos, arroz, panela, chocolate, refrescos, cervezas, frijoles, lentejas, pastas, atún, productos lácteos entre otros.
Es una gran responsabilidad para Alan tener su tienda pues sabe que muchos vecinos acuden a está.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar abarrotes granos y productos de aseo personal para beneficiar sus vecinos y seguir en lucha juntando ahorros para comprar su vivienda propia
texts.en:
Alan is a responsible and organized father; his little 6-year-old boy and 3-year-old princess are his loves, his reason for being, and his incentive to continue working and fighting for a better future where they aren't in need. 

He earns his income thanks to a store selling basic pantry items located in a rural zone, and which is, for many blocks, the only store of its type.

In Alan's store, one can find eggs, rice, panela, chocolate, soft drinks, beer, beans, lentils, pasta, tuna, dairy products, and more.

It is a big responsibility for Alan to have his store since he knows that many of his neighbors turn to it.

He asks for a loan to purchase basic groceries and personal hygiene items to benefit his neighbors and continue to struggle to save up to purchase his own house.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, rice, panela (jaggery), chocolate, soft drinks, beer, beans, lentils, pasta, tuna, and diary products to stock his business.

loans.name: Orladis Dayana

texts.es:
Orladis es una empresaria en desarrollo, que se dedica a la venta de verduras y antojos para pequeños como dulces, galletas, chocolates, frituras etc.
Y que por falta de capital no ha podido transformar su pequeño negocio en una tienda de abarrotes.
Gracias al apoyo de interactuar quien llego hasta su zona a ofrecerle su ayuda Orladis puede aspirar a un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, granos y así cumplir su sueño es que es ir evolucionando hasta llegar a una tienda de abarrotes y sabe que con interactuar y Kiva lo podrá lograr.
Su vida personal es un poco difícil, debe mantener a sus dos hijos ya como cabeza de familia pues se separó de su marido y ante todo quiere demostrarle que no lo necesita y que es lo suficientemente acta para no dejarlos pasar necesidades y darles estudio.
texts.en:
Orladis is a developing entrepreneur, who works selling vegetables and snacks for children such as sweets, cookies, chocolates, fried snacks, etc. And, due to the lack of capital, she hasn't been able to transform her small business into a grocery store. 

Thanks to the support from Interactuar which has come to her zone to offer Orladis its help, she can aspire to a loan that she will invest in the purchase of groceries and grains, and in this way achieve her dream which is to continue evolving until she has a grocery store and she knows that with Interactuar and Kiva, she can achieve it. 

Her personal life is a little difficult; she has to support her two children as head of the family since she separated from her husband and above all she wants to show him that she doesn't need him and that she is sufficiently able to prevent them from being in need and to provide them with an education.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and in this way achieve her dream of having her grocery store.

loans.name: Mildre Lorena

texts.es:
Mildre es una mujer muy pujante, con ganas, trabajadora y un ejemplo de toda una guerrera, se dedica a  la cría de cerdos una actividad que le dedica 12 horas al día pues además se alterna en actividades en finca y casas todo para mantener a sus dos hijos que viven con ella, es separa de su esposo y nunca le faltaron pantalones para realizar los dos papeles y aún en enfermedad se levantaba para trabajar y darle a sus hijos un bocado de comida.
Mildre quiere solicitar un préstamo que le permita impulsar su actividad, invertirá en la compra de cuido para cerdos, con los cuales podrá engordarlos y hacer que crezcan más rápidamente siendo muy beneficioso pues el cerdo se paga por Kilos y entre más pesen más ganancia representara para esta mujer que sea como sea hará que sus hijos ingresen a la universidad.
texts.en:
Mildre is a very driven woman who is eager and hardworking and a model of a warrior. She raises pigs, an activity she works at 12 hours a day. She also alternates her farm activities with home activities to support her two children who live with her. She is separated from her husband and she has never lacked the backbone to undertake both roles. Even when she was sick, she would get up to work and give her children something to eat.  

Mildre wants to ask for a loan to get her activity ahead. She will invest in buying food for the pigs in order to fatten them and make them grow faster. This is beneficial because the pigs are sold by the kilo and the more they weigh, the more profits there are for this woman. However she has to, she will make sure her kids get into college.

loans.use: to fix her sties and keep her business running, because it has fed her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 4 De Noviembre.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.
Doña María con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta además y vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, Trabaja todos los días ya que así como sale también vende en su casa, ella  deja a crédito y  cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que les permite salir adelante ya que su marido no tiene un trabajo fijo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 7 años  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es seguir adelante
texts.en:
In Los Bajos of Montecristi, a city known for having diverse local products to sell, for example, woven straw hats known throughout the country and outside as well, every  fifteen days the members of the loan group "4th of November" meet.
This is where Maria lives, who is 54 years old, married, and from her marriage has seven children who are  now grown.  Three of her adult children still live with her. Her husband works when work is available.

Maria, wanting to earn something herself and thus help her husband with supporting the home, works at sales, selling every kind of clothing.  Her mode of sale is to go from door to door, and she also sells clothes in her home where she has a small shop.  She works daily since she sells at home as well as when she goes out; she will sell on credit and collect money every eight days.  She has been working at this for more than seven years and gains enough to get ahead now that her husband does not have steady work.  Maria will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.  She has been in the communal bank group for seven years and likes being a member because she started her business with the first loan.  Her dream is to keep on going ahead with her work.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and feed because her business is a little rundown and needs strengthening to be competitive

loans.name: María Carlos

texts.es:
María, de 59 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, ya que en esa época la escuela le quedaba demasiado lejos, está acompañada, su compañero de vida, trabaja como vigilante en una institución y tiene nueve hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos están en  el extranjero, con ella solamente vive su compañero de vida.

La actividad que ella realiza es el cultivo del café, también se dedica a la sastrería, trabaja todos los días, su trabajo lo realiza en su casa de habitación.

El crédito lo necesita para pagar la mano de obra que le ayudará a podar la finca para que esté preparada para la próxima cosecha, esto le permitirá tener mejor cuidado sus cultivos.

Su mayor sueño es, volver a ver a sus hijos, porque ya tiene muchos años de no verlos.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and only studied until second grade because the school at the time was too far away.  She lives with her life partner and has 9 children, All of them live by themselves and two of them live abroad.  She works cultivating coffee and as a tailor.  She works everyday from her home.    
She's requesting the loan to pay for the labor to clear her farm so it can be ready for the next harvest.  This will allow her to take better care of her crops.  Her greatest dream is to see her children again because she hasn't seen them in many years.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to clear her farm so it can be ready for the next harvest.

loans.name: Fátima Narcisa

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive La señora Fátima, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres  hijos mayores de edad, dos  de ellos aun vive con ellos y una estudia en universidad. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Fátima es una mujer que le gusta valerse por ella misma para así  obtener sus propios recursos y con estos contribuir con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana en sus recorridos, su hija le ayuda vendiendo a sus compañeras de la universidad, ellas  dejan sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 3  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo ya que su marido no gana mucho en el campo.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otros productos. Lleva más de tres años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte the members of the "Dulce Amistad" communal bank meet every fortnight. This place is known throughout the whole country for the delicious sweets made by the locals and for the warmth of it's friendly hard-working people.

Fátima lives here. She is 56 years old, married and from this relationship has 3 adult children. Two of them still live with her and one goes to university. Her husband is a farmer.

Fátima is a woman who likes to fend for herself and doing so obtain her own resources and with these contribute to the household expenses. She works selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). Her method of sales is from door-to-door, she works 3 days per week making her rounds. Her daughter helps her selling to her companions at university. She sells the products on credit and collects every week.

She has been doing this business for more than 3 years with which she earns her own money as her husband doesn't make much in the fields. She will use the loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, amongst other products. She has been in the communal bank for more than 3 years and she likes it as she was able to start with the loans. She dream is for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Felinda Caridad

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Felinda, tiene 67 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Felinda tiene un comedor en un sitio turístico de la ciudad, este lugar está atravesado por el Rio Portoviejo lo cual es muy atractivo  para los visitantes, ya que aquí aprovechan para bañarse y pasar un lindo día en unión de sus familias, trabaja los días sábados, domingos y feriados que es cuando más gente llega al lugar, allí  ofrece una gran variedad de platos sobretodo los platos típicos de la provincia su especialidad es el caldo y el seco de gallina criolla el cual es un plato muy solicitado por sus clientes, lleva más de 7  años con su negocio con el cual se gana lo suyo haciendo algo que le encanta.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque siempre le ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the Grupo de Crédito Dulce Amistad meet every 15 days in the canton Rocafuerte.  This place is known for its delicious candies which are prepared by the locals who are recognized in the whole country for their friendly, warm, and hard working character.  It is here that Mrs. Felinda lives.  She's 67 years old, is married, and has three adult children who are independent.  Her husband is a farmer.  
Mrs. Felinda has a food stall in a touristic spot in town.  This area is crossed by the Portoviejo river which is an attraction in town for visitors since they can bathe in the river and spend the day with their families.  She works on Saturdays, Sundays, and Holidays which is when more people come to visit.  She offers a variety of dishes including those typical of her province.  Her specialty is the local chicken soup and another special chicken dish (seco de gallina) which is very popular and highly sought after.  She's had her business for 7 years with which she's able to make some money doing something that she loves.  
This loan is to buy the foodstuffs necessary to prepare her dishes.  She's a founding member of the Credit Group and she likes it because they always help with the loans.  Her dream is to keep working in good health.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Mariana Auxilidora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada pero no ha podido tener hijos propios pero crio dos que son como suyos, uno es mayor de edad y una chica de 17 años que estudia en colegio y aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Mariana es  maestra jubilada, pero desde antes  de su jubilación con lo que tenia surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa la cual actualmente le permite ganar lo suyo para el bien de su hogar, allí vende víveres así como también cosas de bazar, ropa zapatillas, electrodomésticos entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00. Ya son más de 16 años que  lleva con su negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres, ropa, zapatos y ciertos artículos de bazar. Es socia fundadora del Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Grupo de Crédito Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship) meet every 15 days in the canton Rocafuerte. This place is known for its delicious candies which are prepared by the locals who are recognized in the whole country for their friendly, warm, and hard working character. It is here that Mrs. Mariana lives. She's 63 years old and is married.  She didn't have children of her own but she raised two as if they were her own.  One is an adult and the other is a 17 year old girl who is still in school and both still live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.  
Mrs. Mariana is a retired teacher but before retiring she's started stocking a small grocery store in her home with which she earns some money to help with the home expenses.  She sells groceries as well as bazaar items like clothes, shoes, and home appliances, among other things.  She works everyday from 7AM to 8PM.  She's had her business for 16 years now.
This loan is to buy groceries, clothes, shoes, and other bazaar articles.  She's a founding member of the Credit Group and she likes it because they have helped her a lot.  Her dream is to keep improving her business.

loans.use: Comprar víveres, ropa, zapatos y artículos de bazar.

loans.name: Sholpan

texts.ru: Шолпан, 52 года, вдова, мать 5 детей. Много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. У Шолпан среднее образование. По хозяйству активно помогают дети. Шолпан достигла больших успехов в своем бизнесе. В хозяйстве имеет 1 корову с теленком. Также есть земельный надел, 2,88 ГА собственной и 2,0 ГА арендованной земли, где она выращивает фасоль и картофель для реализации. Совокупная прибыль Шолпан составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS), однако этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Поэтому Шолпан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и минеральных удобрений для полеводства, что позволит ей развить бизнес и увеличить доход от сельскохозяйственной деятельности.
texts.en:
Sholpan is 52 and a widow with five children who actively help her with the farm. She has been working for many years in animal husbandry and agriculture and is very skilled in her field.
